It was therefore no big surprise that time, Twilight changed into the 180 pound pony she is now. A thick layer of fat wrapped round her legs and back while her large stomach hung down and shook as she walked.

Returning to the search, Spike shifted a set of books across the bookcase he was looking through and spotted what he was looking for.

“I found them!” Spike yelled lifting the box of cupcakes up above his head.

“Good job Spike.” Twilight smiled and used her magic to take the cupcakes from her young assistant and quickly took a bite out of one of them, “Yum!”

It was at this point Spike burped up a scroll from Princess Celestia,

“Oh a letter from the Princess.” Twilight said as she finished the cupcake and started on another one, “what does it say?”

Spike quickly unrolled the letter and, clearing his throat, began to read,

“My dearest, most faithful student Twilight,

While I am glad to see you having quite an interest in continuing your studies, it has come to my attention that you have become, to kindly put it, quite overweight. There is more to a young pony’s life then simply just studying and snacks. I am therefore sending you to supervise the preparation for the Summer Sun Celebration in this year’s location, Ponyville, and I have an even more essential task I wish you to complete, making some friends.”

*End Flashback*

And so, after a quick ride over in a chariot pulled by two of Celestia’s guards, Twilight sparkle was now here in Ponyville, the library being set up as her and Spike’s home.

“I still don’t see why Princess Celestia feels I should spend less time reading.” Twilight said as she walked with a slight waddle down the town’s main road with Spike, “Okay, so maybe I am a little bit on the large side for a pony of my age, but I don’t really see that as any good reason to spend me all the way here just to make friends.”

“I’m sure she has a good reason Twilight” the baby dragon replied, looking through the list of tasks they were giving.

“Alright let’s get these celebration preparations done and over with before we miss lunch.” the purple pony said with a slightly impatient tone.

“Well, I guess the first thing we could do is go and check to see how the food for the Celebration ‘s banquet is coming along.” Spike said, checking the checklist “According to this, Sweet Apple Acres is in charge, or we could go and check how the weather for is doing, a pony called Rainbow Dash is suppose to be in charge of clearing the clouds.”
1131.title: The big scholar from Canterlot arrives

choices: A few hours later, Twilight's still munching away  and starts talking with AJ
Spike manages to get Twilight away from the snacks to check on the weather
11311.content:
At the mentioning of the word food, thoughts about going home to study instantly disappeared from Twilight’s mind to be instantly,

“Well I suppose, if I must do this task, I’ll get started right away and check out how the food tastes!” Spike gave Twilight a knowing look, making her to hastily add, “erm, you know, to make sure that nothing is overcook or anything.”

The two began to make their way over to Sweet Apple Acres, seeing the sights of Ponyville as they did so. Soon the two reached the apple farm.

“Wow, look at all these apples.” Spike said as they made their way up the road through the trees,

“I have to admit, Spike, those apples sure do look delicious.” Twilight replied, looking at partially yummy looking apple hanging from a tree branch.

“Yehaa!”

Looking round to the source of the yell, the two arrivals from Canterlot looked round to see a orange coloured pony, wearing a Stetson hat. The orange pony kicked one of the trees, causing the apples to to fall into the baskets set a round it.

“Well let’s get this over with.” Twilight said as she moved towards the hard working pony, “Good afternoon, my name is Twilight Sparkle.” Before the purple gray pony could continue with her introduction, she found her hoof being shook vigorously by the orange pony.

“Well howdy do Miss Twilight, a pleasure making your acquaintance.” the orange pony said, “Ah’m Applejack, we here at Sweet Apple Acres sure like making new friends.”

“F-friends? A-actually I…” Twilight replied, her voice quivering as Applejack continued to shake her hoof.

“Now, what can ah do ya for?” Applejack asked as she let go of Twilight’s hoof. At first Twilight just stood there, her front right hoof still shaking, causing her fat to wobble, till Spike held the fat unicorn’s hoof still while stifling a chuckle.

Giving Spike another glare to quite his joking, Twilight cleared her throat, “Well, I am in fact her to supervise preparations for the Summer Sun Celebration. And you’re in charge of the food?

“We’re sure as Sugah are.” Applejack replied, “Would ya care to sample some?”

At this, Twilight’s eyes brightened, “Sure, as long as you’re offer-” she was then quickly cut off by Applejack ringing a dinner bell.

“Soup’s on everypony!” Applejack yelled, causing a stampede of ponys to rush across the farmland, dragging Twilight and Spike along with them to a outdoor table.

“Now, why don’t ah introduce to the Apple family?” Applejack said warmly, “This here's Apple Fritter, Apple Bumpkin, Red Gala, Red Delicious, Golden Delicious, Caramel Apple, Apple Strudel, Apple Tart, Baked Apple, Apple Brioche, Apple Cinnamon Crisp... *gasp* Big Macintosh, Applebloom,” she listed each pony who then proceeded to place a food item of the same name as them or the apples used in it.


“Aand Granny Smith. Up and at’em Granny, we got guest” AJ called over to an elderly pony, who slowly made her way to the table with the rest of the Apple family.

As Applejack continued to list family members and food based items their named after, Twilight stared at the various baked goods, never have seen so many sweets and pastries in place before,

“Oh my, they look so good and delicious and… hhmmm.” the unicorn scholar quickly became lost in thought. For a moment, Spike and the Apple family watched puzzled as Twilight sat there, eyes glazed and drooling slightly.

“Err, is she always like this?” Applejack asked Spike.

“Twi? Twilight? Snap out of it!” Spike said, giving the fat pony the sharp nudge in her flabby side.

“Huh? Oh! Sorry. Everything looks great. It looks the food situation is taken care of.” Twilight said, trying to cover her embarrassment at zoning out.

“Well, we best be going.” Spike spoke up, “We got a lot of others tasks to check up on.”

“Aren’t you going to stay for brunch?” Applejack’s sister, Applebloom asked, looking pleadingly.

“Well…” Twilight hungrily eyed the large amount of food that Applejack and her family had presented and smiled, “I’m sure I could stay and have a apple fritter or two.”

In no time at all, Twilight was already digging into her forth apple based baked good.
11311.title: Meeting Applejack... and the Apple family feast

choices: Spike manages to keep Twilight focused on the tasks in hand and checks on them
Twilight goes in to check the bakery out and meet the pink pony that works there
113111.content:
“*chew* This is amazing, I‘ve never tasted sweet so delicious as these.*munch*” Twilight said, helping herself to her twentieth apple brown betty.

Applejack didn’t say anything. She had never seen a pony ever eat as much as Twilight did. For the past several hours, the purple gray unicorn had so far managed to eat her way though enough baked goods to have feed three pony of Big Macintosh’s size for two week and, apart from one moment where it liked she was going to be sick, Twilight was still going strong and the effects of her eating were clear.

Twilight’s belly had swelled out by several feet further then it did before, covering her lap as she sat at the table. Twilight’s rear end took up enough space for two seats and well on it way to overflowing on to a third. Three new chins framed her face, as she stuffed another cupcake into her fat cheeks.

“These have to be the tastiest apples, I ever tasked.” Twilight said

“Well, that’s why Sweet Apple Acres apples are the best in Equestria.” Applejack said, a proud grin on her face, Twilight’s complement having snapped her out of her surprised stupor.

“It must be nice having so many family members around.” Twilight said, wanting to get to know Applejack better.

“Oh, they don’t live here, they’re just here for the family get together. The only ponys living here are just me, mah sister and brother and Granny. The others have their own farms to take care of.” the farm pony

“So ya’re new here, right?” Applejack said, “Where did you all come from?”

“We came from Canterlot.” Twilight answered as she took a partially large bite out of a slice of apple pie. I was studying there as a student to Princess Celestia and Spike helped as my assistant.” At this, Applejack’s eyes widened in amazement,

“Ya know the Princess?” the orange pony said with awe.

Twilight nodded and wolfed down the rest of the pie slice, “Sure do. She was the one who sent me here. She wanted me to make some friends… and she also said to get some exercise.” she added hesitantly, “Apparently, she thought I need to do more then just sit around and… eat…snacks…all…day…” the words faltered from Twilight’s mouth as soon as she realised what she was doing.

Princess Celestia had sent Twilight to Ponyville to do more then study and eat snacks and yet here she was, sitting there, stuffing her face with enough food to feed a family of ponys. Twilight looked over at Applejack embarrassed, wondering what the farm pony thought of her,

She must think I’m a complete pig. I just stuffed my face. The purple gray unicorn thought as she looked at Applejack.

“I’m so sorry, Applejack,” Twilight looked down ashamed, the action making her newly gained chins all the more apparent, “You and your family have been so kind and welcoming and all I’ve here I am, stuffing myself with food while going on going on about how I’m suppose to be not doing that. Oh what you must think of me…”

Applejack however, instead of giving the insulting or rude remakes she had expected, gave Twilight a friendly smile,

“Now don’t ya fret none about nothing.” Applejack said, “If there’s one thing the Apple family respect apart from hard work and honesty is a pony who enjoys their food. Now, Ah’ll be honest with ya when ah say ya do need to do more then just sit an’ eat, but there’s nothing wrong with being on the big side.”

“Really?” Twilight asked, looking a bit happier.

“Dang tooting.” Applejack nodded, “Ah may need to make a bit more, next time ah invite ya round for lunch, but ah got no problem with ya weight, friend.”

For awhile Twilight just sat there, looking unsure about something, but then broke into a bright smiled and wrapped her front hoofs round the orange earth pony, squishing her in a hug.

“Thanks Applejack.” the purple gray pony said, “I’m glad to have meet you.”

“Sawks Twilight,” Applejack replied, “Ah ain’t nothing special, but ah’m as pleased as punch to be ya friend.”

“Me too, Applejack.” Twilight pulled another pie closer and, using her magic, split the pie in half, sharing it with Applejack.

“Twilight!” Spike spoke up, “We have to go! We got other things to check up on and we’ve been here for hours!”

“Aww Spike.” Twilight moaned. She had enjoyed her time with Applejack and would rather stay, but knew Spike was right. It was starting to get late and they need to make sure that all preparation were done before the Princess arrived for the Summer Sun Celebration.

“Okay, let’s get going.” Twilight said, slowly pulling herself out of her seat, “Sorry Applejack, looks like I got to get going. Maybe we can meet up later?”

With that, Twilight and the baby dragon went on their way, her now larger belly and flank turning the unicorn’s walk into a full blown waddle.

“Well, the food for the celebration is taken care of,” Spike said, checking off the list, “unless you just ate it all.” he added.

Twilight blushed slightly in embarrassment, feeling guilty for her binge, but still gave the little dragon a stare that warned him to stop with the jokes.
“In any case, we’re know running late with checking up on the preparations, we still need to make sure the weather, decorations and music is all done before tonight.” Spike continued, “We best shake a leg and no distractions.”

“Spike, I’m the oldest out of the two of and you’re still a baby dragon.” Twilight replied with a chuckle, “If anyone out of the two of us is going to be distracted it would most likely be y- hey, is that a bakery?”
113111.title: The long lunch and a friend

choices: Decorations- and the stylish white Unicorn in charge of them
Music- meeting the shy yellow Pegasus in charge
1131112.content:
“Twilight! You already ate not that long ago and we’re behind schedule as it is.” Spike said as Twilight opened the door.

“Oh Spike, we’re just only going in for a few minutes.” Twilight replied back and entered the bakery.

Once inside, Twilight’s eyes widened. Cakes and baked goods lined every wall and table in the room, making the purple unicorn’s mouth water, “Oh my.” she said, “Everything looks so… delicious.”

“Yep, they sure are.”

Twilight jumped, not an easy task for a pony weighing close to 290lbs to do, when she noticed the pink pony suddenly standing next to her.

“Wha- where did you- who?” Twilight stammered.

“Hi, welcome to Sugar cube Corner. I’m Pinkie pie, I work here, helping Mr and Mrs Cake make all the goodies you see here.”

“H-hello, I’m Twilight Sparkle and this is Spike.” Twilight said, a bit nervous at first.

“Hello Twilight, welcome to Ponyville. I know you’re new here cus I’ve never seen you before and I know every pony here and I mean EVERY Pony. So if you’re new then that means you don’t know any ponys here yet and if you don’t know any ponys then that means you could do with some friends to help you. So, I could be your friend and help get to know everyone round here.” Pinkie Pie said hardly pausing at all.

Twilight blinked slightly at the pink pony‘s energetic response, but quickly recovered and replied, “Thanks, Pinkie Pie, that is nice of you to offer.” Twilight looked round at all of the cakes, “It must be great working here.”

Pinkie Pie nodded energetically, “Yep, sure it. So what I do for you?”

“Well I…” Twilight began to say when she suddenly felt a bubbling sensation welling up in her stomach.

“BAAAAAAAAAAAUUUUUURRRRPPPPP!” the purple unicorn let out a huge belch that shook the room and causing her own ample frame to jiggle. As the belch died down, Twilight blushed in deep embarrassment, worried what Pinkie Pie thought.

After a second pause, Pinkie Pie bust out laughing,

“Heeheehee that was a really good one, Twilight. I’ve tried many types of fizzy drinks but I never ever managed to make a belch as big or loud as that. You’re really good at belching.”

“Erm thanks,” Twilight replied with a nervous chuckle, “anyway, I’m here to help make sure everything is ready for the Summer Sun Celebration when I saw this place and thought I‘d have a look.”

“Really? Well nice of you to come visit even though there must be so many other places you need to be.” the pink pony said with a bright smile, “While you’re here would you like to try some our treats? We make some great cupcakes.”

At first Twilight was about to say no to the offer when her stomach intervened, growling despite the large meal she had not so long ago. Giving an small chuckle, the purple pony replied,

“Well… Sure Pinkie, I would love to try some.”

“But Twilight, you already had a large brunch when we were over at Applejack’s.” Spike tried to protest, but Twilight quickly hushed him.

“I know, but it’s just a little snack” she said as Pinkie Pie quickly went brought out a tray filled with a number cakes and sweets for the two ponys to share.

“Oh my, they look so… tasty.” Twilight said her, mouth watering,

“They sure are,” Pinkie Pie smiled, “go ahead and try one.”

Twilight took one of the cupcakes and ate it, nearly devouring the treat in one bite.

“Hmmm, I was right.” Twilight said, “These cupcakes are great.”

“Go on and have another, there‘s plenty to go around.”

“Thanks, I think I will” Twilight said, taking another cupcake.

An hour later.

“Thanks again for the cupcakes, Pinkie Pie, I had a great time.” Twilight said. Her latest binge, while small compared to her last one, was still enough to add a few more inches of fat to the purple pony’s already large belly.

“And thank you for the complement on the cupcakes.” Pinkie Pie replied with the biggest smile Twilight had ever seen on a pony. Before either of the two ponies could say anything else, Spike cut in.

“Alright that’s enough.” the baby dragon said, “We’ve been here for an hour now and there’s still a number of tasks we need to complete before the celebration. Besides, aren’t you suppose to be cutting back on the snacks?” as he said this last part, Spike gave Twilight a meaningful stare.

Twilight gave an embarrassed smile as she recalled Princess Celestia’s orders and spoke,

“Right Spike.” she said and looked back over to Pinkie, “I got to go, see you later.” with that, Twilight turned to leave, but ended up stuck in the doorway.

“Erm a little help?” Twilight said, her face flushed with embarrassment.

“Sure thing!” Pinkie Pie said.

Spike sighed as he and Pinkie Pie walked over to the large rear blocking the doorway and began to push. After awhile and a lot of pushing, Twilight eventually came free with a pop.

“Thanks” Twilight said to the two.

“You’re welcome Twilight,” Pinkie said, smiling brightly “thanks for your visit, see you soon.”

Twilight and Spike soon headed off on their way, Twilight’s large weight slowing her down.

“Come on, Twilight, ” Spike said, a hint of annoyance in his voice, “We’re way behind schedule now. We have to hurry if we’re going to be ready in time. So no more stopping for snacks.”

“I know, Spike, I’m sorry, but I just couldn’t help myself. They all looked so good and tasty.” Twilight said, blushing deeply, “I promise I won’t let myself get carried away till we’re done.”

With a roll of his eyes, Spike returned his attention back to the checklist, “Okay, next up is weather, A Pegasus pony named Rainbow Dash is in charge of clearing the sky.”

Looking up in the sky, Twilight couldn’t see any sign of the Pegasus, but a few clouds.

“Well, she doesn’t seem to be doing a good job on it.” the purple pony said, irritated, but before she could say anything else, Twilight heard a sudden whooshing sound approaching along with a yell of ,

“Watch out!”

Twilight suddenly felt something colliding into her pudgy side and bouncing off, into a large mud puddle. Turning to look, Twilight and Spike saw that a blue Pegasus getting up from the mud.

“Well that could have went a lot worse.” the blue pony muttered to herself as she got to her hooves

“Er hello, I take it you’re Rainbow Dash, right?” Twilight asked, slightly embarrassed about what had just happened.

Shaking the mud off of herself, the blue Pegasus nodded, “The one and only.” she said, taking off into the air and hovered in front of Twilight, “why? Have you heard of me?”

“I heard you were suppose to be keeping the sky clear.” the purple unicorn replied, “My name is Twilight Sparkle and the Princess sent me to check on the weather for the Summer Sun Celebration.”

“Yeah, yeah. It’ll be a snap. I’ll do it in a jiffy, just as soon as I’m done practicing.” Rainbow Dash said as she flew up onto a nearby cloud

“Practicing? Practicing for what?” Twilight asked,

“The Wonderbolts.” Rainbow Dash replied, pointing to a nearby poster of the airail team in question, “They’re gonna perform at the celebration tomorrow, and I’m gonna show them my stuff.”

“The Wonderbolts?” the tubby unicorn said, raising an eyebrow.

“Yep”

“The most talented flyers in all of Equestria?”

“That’s them.”

“Pfft. Please.” Twilight scoffed, “They’d never accept a Pegasus who can’t even keep the sky clear for one measly day.”

“Hey! I could clear the sky in ten seconds flat.” Rainbow Dash retorted.

“Prove it.”

The rainbow maned Pegasus shot a glare at Twilight before quickly speeding off, zooming from cloud to cloud, kicking each one into nothing as she passed them, the purple pony watched in a surprise as Rainbow Dash succeeds in clearing the sky within ten seconds as she claimed.

“Loop-de-loop around and wham! That’s ten seconds flat.” Rainbow said as she landed in front of Twilight, “See? I‘d never leave Ponyville hanging.” she then chuckled as she saw the surprised expression on Twilight’s face, “Haha, you should see the look on your face, bet you wish you could move even half as fast as that with those tubby legs pf yours, ha you’re a great laugh, Twilight Sparkle, I can’t wait to hang out with you some more. Later.” and with that, Rainbow Dash speed off to wherever she planned to practice her flying next.

“Wow, She was awesome!” Spike said, clearly impressed with Rainbow Dash’s flying skills.

Twilight, on the other hoof, gave a exasperated sigh and asked, “What’s the next thing on the list. Spike?”
1131112.title: Cupcakes and Rainbows

choices: Twilight approches the pegasus and talks to her
Twilight just wants to get home- sends Spike to talk to the pegasus instead
11311121.content:
“Up next is decorations” Spike said as he and Twilight headed to the town square pavilion where the Summer Sun celebration was going to be held. Twilight was grateful that the celebration was being held in a governmental building with wide doors as she moved her large form through the doorway.

“Beautiful.” Twilight heard Spike saying, look round at the decorations, the purple unicorn could understand how the baby dragon would use that word to describe the area.

“I must admit, it is pretty impressive.” Twilight said.

“Not the decor, her.” Spike said, pointing. Following his pointed finger, Twilight saw a white unicorn at the other end of the room, sorting through a series of ribbons. Twilight watched as Spike began rambling about how he looked and if his spines were straight. Clearly the baby dragon was developing a crush on the white unicorn. Figuring that she was the pony in charge of decorating, Twilight walked over and began to introduce herself,

“Excuse me, I’m-” before Twilight could finish, the white unicorn cut her off,

“One moment please,” the unicorn said, not looking round, “I’m in the zone as it were.“ After a minute, she nodded in satisfaction at the latest bow she had tied round the pillar she was standing by, “Ah yes, sparkles always does the trick, does it not? Why Rarity, you are a talent. Now then, what can I do for you?” The unicorn apparently named Rarity asked.

“Yes, I’m here to see how the decorations for the celebrations are…” Twilight faltered as she suddenly felt a bubbling sensation building up in her belly,

Oh no, not again! She thought as she tried to held it in, but all that food she had gobbled down at Applejack’s and then Pinkie’s places coupled with Rainbow Dash’s crash into the tubby unicorn’s belly shaking it about causing a build up of gas which then about resulting in the purple unicorn letting a belch.

“My word!” Rarity gasped, her face scrunching in disgust, “Really dear, that is not the way for proper lady to act. And your appearance…” at this she levitated a mirror out of her saddle bag and holding it up for Twilight to see.

Twilight looked in the mirror, at the fat purple unicorn looking back. Her mane was a mess from the gusts of wind caused by Rainbow Dash’s clearing of the sky and the crumbs and frosting of all the baked goods she ate all day covered the fat cheeks that framed her face along with the three chins. Twilight’s ears folded back in embarrassment as she realised what a mass she looked. Before she could apologise for her burp, Rarity began leading her out of the building.

“Hey, wait! Where are we going?” the purple unicorn said as Rarity continued to gentle push her along the street.

“Now don’t worry darling, I’m just taking you over to my boutique. We’re going to tidy up your appearance just a bit.” the white unicorn replied.

Soon the two ponies and baby dragon were at Rarity’s boutique and the white unicorn had Twilight’s mane styled, face cleaned and had her put on one of the dresses Rarity had in hand.

“Hmm… No, no, too blue.” Rarity decided after awhile,

“It’s.. kinda tight as well.” Twilight added, the dress having been designed for a pony a third of her weight.

“Hmm yes, I must apologise, I don’t much work for the plus size side of the fashion business.” Rarity said as she helped Twilight out of the outfit. Rarity then hurried over to her work room, levitating a number outfits and dresses with her, “Wait here a moment would you dear? I’ll be back just as soon as make a few adjustments to make these dresses more suited for a mare of your…physic.”

As Rarity left, Twilight looked down at her hooves, her face flushed with embarrassment.

“Isn’t she amazing?” Spike said, finally snapping out of his love struck trance now that the white unicorn had left the room, “it’s great of her adjusting those outfits to be more suited for your “physic” whatever that is.”

“She was just putting it in a nice way of saying she was resizing them to fit a pony as fat as me.” Twilight explained to the baby dragon, feeling even more depressed.

“Oh.”

Twilight sighed and looked at herself in the mirror. Fat cheeks and a couple of chins that wobbled as she talked, her belly bulging out, pressing against her front and hind legs which were also wrapped in a thick layer of fat. Twilight began to pace round the room causing her belly to sway like a pudgy pendulum while large flanks wobbled and jiggled with each step she took.

“Why am I even still here? I have left and gotten on with the rest of the preparations so I can get to the library.” Twilight wondered aloud when Rarity returned.

“There,” the white unicorn said with some satisfaction of a well done job, “these dresses should fit you a lot better now.” she then began to look through the dresses to pick one out, “Now let’s see… hmm, perhaps something in black? It’s quite slimming and of course it’s such a wonderful colour, simple yet bold at the same time.”

Rarity continued on like this as she had Twilight try on different outfits, looking for the one she thought would be right for the purple unicorn.

“Now then, Twilight, you were telling me where you were from?” Rarity asked.

“I-I’m from Canterlot.” Twilight answered. At this Rarity stopped in her tracks and looked at Twilight, wide eyed in excitement.

“Canterlot? Oh, I am so envious. I have always dreamed of living there, the glamour, the sophistication. I can’t wait to hear all about it. We are gonna be the best of friends, you and I.” Rarity said, smiling brightly as she stood close to the purple unicorn as if they were already old friends.

“Emerald? What was I thinking?” Rarity suddenly said, taking a good look at the gem stones in the outfit Twilight was wearing, “Let me get you some rubies.” she then headed off to fetch the gems in question.

“I appreciate the generosity, Rarity, but I-I really should get going.” Twilight told Rarity as she quickly wiggled herself out of the dress she was wearing and then hurried for the door, dragging Spike along side her, “Quick! let’s go before she decides to dye my coat a different colour.”


Twilight gasped for air as she tried to catch her breath, exhausted from her run from Rarity’s boutique to the meadow which, according to Spike, is where they would find the pony in charge of the musical entertainment for the celebration.

“Are *huff* we *puff* almost done?” Twilight wheezed, looking up at the sky to see it was starting to get late. All she wanted to do was to finally get to the library and rest, for once, Twilight decided studying can wait.

“Don’t worry Twi, all that is left is music.” Spike replied, “now according to one of the ponies I asked back in town told me the pony in charge are practising out here in this meadow.” Sure enough, the two soon heard the sound of a choir birds signing. Investing the sound, Twilight and Spike found the choir of birds, being directed a yellow pegasus with a pink mane.
11311121.title: Meeting the stylish Unicorn

choices: Twilight stays and enjoy the party... and the snacks
Twilight tries to get out of the party and gets to her study
113111211.content:
Twilight hesitated a moment as she thought about what to do. On the one hoof she was tired of all of the going around town doing these task, especially since she didn’t really wanted to come to Ponyville in the first place, but on the other hoof, she had been asked by Princess Celestial to do this task and she never shied away from a given duty. So with a sigh, Twilight began to approach the yellow Pegasus and prepared to introduce herself.

As she approached, Twilight listened to the singing birds being directed by the pink mane pony, finding it to be amazing.

“Hello.” At Twilight’s words, the yellow Pegasus jumped in fright and the bird choir flew off.

“Oh my, I’m so sorry I didn’t mean to scare off your birds.” Twilight explained, “I came to check up on the music for the celebration. It sounded very beautiful”

Landing on the ground, the Pegasus stood in front of Twilight and, avoiding the purple unicorn’s gaze, shuffled her hooves bashfully.

“My name is Twilight Sparkle.” the tubby unicorn introduced herself, but the Pegasus didn’t answer and just continued to shuffle her hooves, “What’s your name?” Twilight asked.

“Erm…I’m Fluttershy.” the yellow pony mumbled, not making direct eye contact.

“I’m sorry, what was that?” Twilight asked,

“My name is Fluttershy.” the Pegasus replied in a barely audible whisper,

“Didn’t quite catch that.” Twilight said, at this Fluttershy didn’t replied and simply gave what sounded a scared whimper. After a few more moments of silence, Twilight decided to gave up and continue with more important things, such as getting some lunch,

“Well goodbye, I guess.” Twilight said and trotted off back to where Spike was waiting.

“Well, that was easy.” Twilight said to Spike as she approached the baby dragon when suddenly she heard a gasp of excitement. The yellow Pegasus, having seen Spike, had rushed over, looking at Spike with keen interest.

“A real baby Dragon?” the pink maned pony said, this time speaking at audible level, “I’ve never seen a baby dragon before. He’s so cute.”

“Well, it’s about time somepony recognised that.” Spike said, smiling in a smug way.

“Oh my, he can talks. I didn’t know Dragons could talk, that’s so wonderful, I just don’t know what to say!”

“Well then, in that case we’d better get going.” Twilight spoke up, trying to leave.

“Wait!” the butter yellow Pegasus called, moving to follow the unicorn and dragon, “What’s his name?”

“I’m Spike”

“hello Spike, I’m Fluttershy.” The yellow pony said, “wow a talking dragon, and what do dragons talk about?”

“well, what do you want to know?” Spike asked

“Absolutely everything.” Fluttershy said with keen excitement.

“Well, first of all, I started off as this cutest little egg with spots…” Spike began to tell her.

Twilight groan in despair as she realised that was going to be a long time before she could get to the liberty.


“And so after that, Princess Celestia suggested we try and use some soap to loosen it. And that’s how we finally managed to get to get Twilight free from the bucket and since she learned an important lesson on watching where and what you sit down on.” Spike finished his story with a snigger as Fluttershy listened to the baby dragon’s tales of his life.

Twilight on the other hoof, was starting to wish she hadn’t approached the Pegasus. Since seeing Spike, Fluttershy wanted to know everything Spike had seen and done, including all the embarrassing stuff that has happened to Twilight such as the time she got her flank stuck in a bucket or even the time during one of her pastry binges, she had ended up swallowing a letter from Celestia thinking it was a Swiss roll.

Soon the two ponies and baby dragon reach the tree house that was the library that Twilight and Spike were to live in during their time in Ponyville.

“Oh will you look at that, we’re here already.” Twilight said, trying to change the subject before Spike tells another embarrassing story, “Well it’s been great talking with you, Fluttershy, but this is where I’m staying while in Ponyville and Spike really needs his sleep.”

“No I don’t-” Spike said before Twilight quickly silenced him by making him full off his sitting spot on her back,

“Aww, wook at dat, he’s so sweepy he can’t even keep his widdle abeyance!” the purple unicorn said talking in baby talk to Spike.

“Aww poor thing” Fluttershy said, picking Spike up, “you simply must get into bed…”

“Yes, yes, we’ll get right on that, well g’night” Twilight said, quickly taking Spike and heading into the library and closing the door.

“Rude much?” Spike said, as Twilight lowered him to the ground and began looking for the light switch,

“Sorry Spike, but I have a lot of studying and I certainly wasn’t going to let you tell her another one of those embarrassing stories. Now, where’s the lights?” As if on que the lights suddenly came on, revealing the room to be filled with lots of ponies and a filmier pink pony jumping out in front of the tubby scholar.

“Surprise!” Pinkie Pie yelled, “Welcome to Ponyville”

“GAH! Pinkie, what are you doing here?” Twilight said after quickly recovering from the fright she got, “Come to that what are all these ponies doing here?”

“Well obviously it’s a party, see?” Pinkie Pie said as matter of factly, “See after you left Sugercube Corner I thought to myself, since you’re new here that means you don’t know many ponies here yet, which I though was “oh dear that’s just so terrible.” so then I thought why not just throw you a party and invite everypony. Now now you have lots of friends.”

Twilight gave an exasperated sigh as she realised this meant her plans to study were over as she doubt she could focus with such a party going on, but on the other hoof, it wasn’t like the time she spent with Pinkie at Sugercube Corner wasn’t fun and she could see that Pinie had set out quite a number of snacks for the party.

114.content:
Celestia loved Twilight Sparkle, anypony could see that. The first pony outside of court officials she had really interacted with, and it was easy to see she doted on the pony, becoming almost a second mother to her. And with Twilight's hard schedule studying, Celestia took any opportunity to provide the pony with a little enjoyment. At first this simply meant a sweet here or there, and making sure she had plenty for dessert.

"I'm sure one more scoop won't hurt anypony, hmm?" Celestia asked, smiling to the little filly who looked up at her with such eager eyes. Nopony had smiled at her so eagerly and sincerely before. If all it took was a little extra sweets, nopony was worse off. The chef serving their dessert smiled and nodded, sure that the little girl was just big for her age.

"May I have seconds?" A slightly older Twilight asked of Celestia, earning a ready nod from the princess. Twilight was burying herself in her books more often these days, but at the table they had time to talk. So the longer she stayed at the table, the better. The waiters around the table traded a glance, knowing better than to say anything about the way the young pony's midsection creased as she leaned forward.

"Twilight, come, it's Nightmare Night, you used to love this time of year!" Celestia did her best to keep her regal composure, but she was worried at how distracted Twilight was these days. A big pudgy pony, her flanks spreading out beneath her like a pillow, didn't even look up from her books.

"It's a foal's holiday Princess, and I need to study!" Twilight replied, her extra chin wobbling as she spoke. Celestia wasn't going to let this be however.

"What about the candy? I took the liberty of gathering some for you." Celestia levitated a huge pile of sweets up from behind her. She would have her time with Twilight, no matter what it took. Sure enough, Twilight looked up, lips already wet with saliva.

A year later, Celestia watched her pudgy prodigy waddle away from an invitation to a birthday party. Twilight's size hadn't even entered Celestia's mind as a problem, despite the way that Twilight's belly hung low between her legs, slapping against huge wobbling thighs as she walked, or the way she looked to be carrying saddlebags everywhere she went given her huge sides, or even the way either flank was wider than a regular pony, great big pillows o fat. No, Celestia had no problem with Twilight's size, and it wasn't like ponies typically suffered from weight-related diseases. But Twilight was so closed off that even Celestia couldn't get her to spend time together. The first pony in centuries she had connected with was a total misanthrope. Fortunately, Celestia had a plan. She needed somepony at the summer sun Celebration, which just happened to be at...

11421.content:
"The fate of Equestria doesn't depend on me making friends!" Twilight Sparkle complained to her dragon assistant, her pouting slouch causing a fourth chin to appear. The carriage landed in Ponyville, the team of eight pegasus ponies carrying her panting hard. Twilight got off the carriage, which creaked audibly as her massive weight shifted about. Ignoring his employer's struggle to make a simple step down without toppling over, Spike hopped off and looked around.

"Wow, and I thought it was just Twilight..." he muttered under his breath. There didn't seem to be a single pony here under 200 pounds, and many probably beat that by a good margin. Even the pegasus ponies had pendulous bellies swaying beneath them as they flew. Pegasus magic was a funny thing, as obviously their wing size shouldn't be able to support even the thinnest pony of their size. So like their legs, how much their wings could lift was really a matter of strength more than one of aerodynamics, and a strong enough pegasus would be able to move even when their feet couldn't touch the ground. Twilight, on the other hoof, just tended to make movement unnecessary thanks to her powerful magic. Spike hoped that she'd get at least a little exercise walking around town today. And maybe if she made some friends she'd have something to do other than eat and yell at him when the fridge *somehow* was empty again.

"Just try, Twilight?" Spike pleaded, gesturing to a random pony walking down the road. She had to be as big as Twilight, but with bigger pouchier cheeks and more weight in her belly, which was only inches away from brushing the ground. Twilight's ears flattened against her head, betraying the fact that all self-important bluster aside, she didn't want to make friends because she didn't know how.

"Um, h-hello there." she tried, greeting the pink pony in front of them. Suddenly the pony gasped, and leaped up higher than anypony her size had any right jumping. In an instead she was waddling off, belly slapping hard against all four of her legs as it swayed against her.

"Oooookay." Twilight said. "Let's just get this over with. What's our first stop?"

Spike sighed. That had gone well. Pulling out his list, he read off Sweet Apple Acres to her.

"Alright, let's go." Twilight replied, getting her bearings. Spike walked beside her - you'd think with all that weight she'd be able to handle a little more and let him ride on her, but nooooooo

With a lot of huffing and puffing, Twilight made it to Sweet Apple Acres, spying-

Meanwhile, a skinny orange pony was admiring her work. She had the west field covered. All the apples in the trees had been bucked by that mare.

The orange pony's left hoof was crossed in front of her left hoof. Her head was in the air, and she smirked delightfully.

Twilight sighed and sagged her head down onto her chins. "Let's get this over with.." she sighed, as she waddled over to the orange mare.

The skinny pony looked over. Great. Another obese pony.

She would just have to deal with it.

Like she had dealt with others.

Twilight finally reached the other mare. She was out of breath. "Uh.. he..llo.. I..I'm.. Twilight.. Sparkle.." She breathed. She was suddenly struck by a hoof.

"Well how'dya do Twilight? Pleasure makin' yer acquaintance. Ah'm Applejack, and we here at the farm sure do like makin' new friends." Applejack was shaking the fat hoof of the pony.

Twilight's fat was jiggling all around, her plot shaking up and down. Her stomach had waves going through them.

"Actuallyyy... Iyyyyyy..." Twilight tried to speak but the wiggling made her voice sound strange. Applejack finally stopped shaking hooves. But Twilight kept going on, her fat jiggling along with her. Spike grabbed her hoof, trying not to laugh.

"So, what c'n ah do ya fer, Twiligh'?" Applejack asked.

"Well, we were here to check up on the food.." Twilight looked at Applejack. "Oh, the food." Applejack jumped over to the dinner bell and rang it furiously.

"SOUP'S ON, EVERYPONY!" Applejack called with all her might.

Twilight's ears perked as a pack of skinny country-looking ponies barreled toward her. She screamed and was swallowed by the crowd, being carried to the table by 20 ponies.

"Let me introduce y'all, to the Apple Family." Applejack grinned. She was totally in the mood now.

"This here's Apple Fritter. Apple Bumpkin. Red Gala. Red Delicious, Golden Delicious, Caramel Apple, Apple Strudel, Apple Tart, Baked Apples, Apple Brioche, Apple Cinnamon Crisp..." She took a moment to breathe.. "Big McIntosh, Apple Bloom and Granny Smith." Twilight's mouth was watering up to the brim. She never saw as much food as the Apple Family members set out. Then she looked over to Granny Smith. She was skinny. You could see her ribs. "Up'n'attem, Granny Smith, we got guests!" Applejack called to the sleeping mare.

Granny Smith's eyes flicked open. She snorted. "Wha..? Soup's on? I'm up, here I come, ahm comin'..."

She walked very slowly towards the table.

Meanwhile, Applejack turned to Twilight. "Why, i'd say yer already part o' the fam'ly!" She grinned at Twilight and stuffed an Apple Fritter into the purple unicorn's mouth.

The flavor savored in Twilight's throat. "Mmmm!" She licked her lips.

"Is there by any chance I could have more?" She asked.

Apple Bloom hopped in front of Twilight. "O' course!" she squeaked and jumped away to get her plate. Meanwhile, the Apple Family let out a chorus of 'Huzzah!'s.

After she left the farm, Spike said the next thing they had to do is check how well clearing the clouds was going. However, once she lifted her flabby neck, Twilight saw that the sky was still full of clouds.

"Um, Spike? Who's the pegasus in charge of clearing the sky?" Twilight had asked slightly irritated.

"Let's see... It says a pegasus named Rainbow Dash was the one put in charge." Spike looked up trying to see if Rainbow Dash was at least heading in this direction, but not a single pegasus was within sight.

"Huh, that's stra-" All of a sudden, Spike was cut off from his sentence by the searing pain of a fat, 220lb. pegasus crashing down on top of him.

"Woops! Sorry about that!" The pegasus had a very distinct rainbow colored mane, so it was easy for Twilight to guess that this was the weather mare who was slacking off.

"You're Rainbow Dash right?" Twilight had asked, now even more annoyed as she had just squished her only assistant.

"The one and only!" Rainbow Dash made it pretty clear she had a big ego. "So I'm guessing you're new around here?"

This caught Rainbow Dash off guard, but it certainly didn't damage her confidence. "Sure I'm overweight, but I'm still the best flyer in Ponyville!" She then carried herself up on top of one the clouds and laid down to rest.

Spike gasped for air as he was now freed from Rainbow Dash's crushing weight. However, Twilight was still distracted by just how smug the pegasus was. "Don't you mean LAZIEST flyer in Ponyville? Because you've certainly been slaking on clearing away the clouds!"

"Oh right, that. Whatever, I'll prove it to you then! I'll have all these clouds cleared away in ten seconds flat!" Rainbow Dash was boasting even harder now, which just succeeded to make Twilight even more irritated.

Rainbow Dash did as promised and cleared the area above of clouds in exactly ten seconds leaving Twilight with her jaw dropped. "I *huff* told ya *puff* I was the fastest!" "U-Um..."

Deciding to check how decorating was going was the best choice, since it was so close, meaning Twilight wouldn't have to walk much. Standing in the middle of the town hall was a white unicorn with a distinctly fashionable mane admiring her work. She appeared to be about 240 lbs. "Are you kidding? Just look at her." Spike had the tone of someone who had fallen in love at first sight, and this was indeed the case.

"Okay, I see." Twilight chuckled under her breath and walked over to the the white unicorn, who she could probably guess who she was. "You're Rarity, right?"

"Why, yes! Is there anything I can help you wi- *GASP*" The overweight unicorn was shocked at the pony she had just laid her eyes on. "Darling, I must know, what is your name?"

"Hoo-wee!" came an enthusiastic call, making Twilight look up. She had walked literally dozens of steps, and was quite out of breath. She looked up to see an extremely round orange earth pony standing next to an apple tree laden with fruit. This earth pony looked to be all belly, her wide-as-a-barn-door sides forming a smooth curve with her wobbly belly. Her bag legs were much thicker than her front, a clear mix of muscles and fat, and her freckled cheeks were the size of the apples on the tree. As Twiligth watched, the pony stood beside the tree, and with a heave slapped her belly straight into the trunk with such force that apples rained down into carefully placed barrels. Twiligth approached with caution, slightly awed by the display of girth put to use.

"Ahem, hello there, my name is Twilight Sparkle and-"

"Why howdy there Twilight, good to meet you!" the earth pony trotted up to Twilight, showing to be much more mobile than Twilight would've expected of a pony her size. She grabbed Twilight's hoof in a overly hearty shake. The resulting quake of pony flesh was absolutely obscene. It seemed to go up Twilight's body before going down, and her chins alll began to sway at their own rhythm. Her cheeks nearly blinded her as they bobbed up and down. But then the quake went down to the rest of her. Her front jiggled against her neck, her foreleg fat against her sides, her belly against <i>everything</i> and her rump quaked against her back legs. She actually fell over - all of two inches or so before her belly hit the ground. She took a seat and tuned back in to the pony blabbering at her. Her name was Applejack apparently, and something about being friends?

"Umm, actually, I'm just here to check on the food." Twilight explained. Applejack's eyes lit up, and she trotted to a triangle suspended on a pole, giving it a great ring.

"Soup's on everypony!" Applejack hollered. "Let me introduce you to the family." she turned to Twilight. What proceeded next was the largest procession of bellies Twilight had ever seen. The Apple family apparently prided themselves on being the best "applebumpers" in Equestria, able to knock down all the apples in a tree with a single swing of their gut. Twilight had never seen any such thing at Canterlot... maybe there was something to this Ponyville.

"...Big Macintosh, Granny Smith, and Applebloom." Applejack finally finished, pointing to a little yellow filly who was clearly already well on her way to being a prime applebumper. Still, a number of these farm ponies had come straight from the field, and, well, smelled.

"Well, I can see the food situation is in order..." Twilight said, looking around at the admittedly delectable treats many of the ponies carried. "I really should get going."

"Aren't you going to stay for lunch?" The little filly asked. Twilight hesitated, but her belly reminded her that she hadn't eaten since she had left Canterlot, and that had been nearly an hour ago!

"Well, maybe for just a little..." Twilight replied, gathering a hurrah from the gathered family.

~~~~~~~~~

"Boy, mph, Twilight, y'sure know how to eat!" Applejack said with her mouth full, crumbs spilling from herr mouth. Lunch had lasted for about two hours now, and while most of the family had gone back to work, she and Twilight were still stuffing their gullets like there was no tomorrow. Twilight had never met anypony who could keep pace with her before. Applejack sure was a messy eater though, nothing like the refined company Twilight had been forced to endure in Canterlot. So she had decided to likewise let loose a little, and crumbs now littered the top of her belly. The two obese ponies sat back from their table, and as Applejack clutched her belly she let out a huge belch.

"Ahh. Y'sure are a barrel of fun, Twi." Applejack slapped a friendly hoof on Twilight's back, triggering a crumb-filled burp to erupt from the unicorn. Applejack just gave her a friendly grin. Twilight blushed a little, but had to admit, not only had the lunch been delicious, but this pony's attitude was as unusual as it was enticing.

Her cheeks were equally round, and rosy from the stress on her clearly rarely-used wing muscles. She was only flying to reach the blue jay at the top of the tree.
"Oh my... um, stop, please everyone," she said. She approached the blue jay. "Um, excuse me sir, no offense... but your rhythm is just a... teeny, tiny bit off... would you mind, um, just... singing along?" she smiled, her wide grin showing the dimples in her chubby cheeks.
Unfortunately, the blue jay had taken offense. It turned its head away from the pegasus and refused to make a peep. "Oh, I'm sorry... let's see... would you sing if I gave you a yummy nummy snack?" she produced a large sack of bread crumbs and held a good portion of them out with her hoof. The blue jay eagerly consumed most of the crumbs, gave a most melodic belch, and hopped back in line.
The pegasus retreated to the ground with relief, exhaling loudly, and was about to begin the verse again when Twilight, who had only just recovered her breath, exclaimed a hearty "Hello!"
The mere power of her voice was enough to frighten away all of the birds in the tree, and even startle the pegasus, who fell over, shaking the trees around them. Twilight - who was oblivious to the ruckus she had caused - continued speaking in the same loud tone, her body quivering and jiggling with each word. "My name is Twilight Sparkle, and I am here on royal Canterlot business to check up on the music. It sounded beautiful!" it was only when the pegasus failed to reply that Twilight noticed the commotion. "Oh my, I'm sorry... I didn't mean to frighten your birds..." The pegasus was still struggling to get off the ground, and was failing miserably. Luckily, Twilight's magic was especially strong, due to her using it more often than her muscles. She levitated the heavy pony off the ground and back onto her feet, though even with her magic it was a struggle. The pegasus was truly thick. When all was set right again, the pegasus hid her face in her mane, evidently flustered. Afraid she hadn't heard the first time, Twilight repeated, "I'm Twilight Sparkle," and when still no reply was given, she said "what's your name?"
The pegasus muttered something as she picked up her bag of snacks, but Twilight couldn't make it out. "I'm sorry, what was that?" she asked. She was eyeing the bag.
The only word she could make out in the pegasus's response this time was "um". "Didn't quite catch that," said the unicorn, taking a whiff. There was definitely something in there other than breadcrumbs. Sure enough, the pegasus whimpered, and impulsively stuck a hoof in the bag, producing a tea cake, which she ingested furiously. Twilight, who was far too hungry to remember her manners, licked her lips as she asked, "Those look delicious! Would you mind if I had one?" She took a few steps forward, eyes gleaming. The pegasus took another cake and shyly tossed Twilight the whole bag. It was only after her third cake that the unicorn realized how rude she'd been. Eager to leave the awkward situation (and get a more substantial meal), she hastily stammered with her mouth full, "Wull, it looksh like yer furdsh ur burck," and placed the food sack in her saddlebag. Then her lower lip began to quiver.

A wise mare once said that "Love can take on many different forms, big or small."

And for the newly crowned Princess of Friendship, Twilight Sparkle... Love has an oddly precarious way of showing itself.

We begin this erotically romantic tale moments after the beginning of Twilight's official coronation as a newly christened Alicorn, as she stood before the crowd of Ponies alongside her mentor, Princess Celestia, and Princess Luna.

However, unlike her noble mentor and the Princess of the Night, Twilight had a more...let's say "robust" physique. And when we mean by robust, we mean "Rotund". What Twilight lacked in height as an Alicorn, she undoubtedly accommodated this conundrum with her weight. Sure, she was always know to be a rather "curvier" Pony than most mares in Equestria, but when her friends' destinies were swapped (along with consuming the calorie-rich delicacies of the Apple Family for an extended period of time), anypony would certainly notice that Twilight had undoubtedly "ballooned" in size, as they say.

But when she had ascended into an Alicorn, her increased weight stuck out like a sore hoof. However, Twilight had become accustomed to the stares she would get at her bulk, but now she knew that she would somewhat scrutinized by her girth now that she was an official Princess.

And yet, as she made her honestly humble speech, one mare stared keenly and profusely upon Twilight's burgeoning girth jutting out within the confines of her dress; The famed Fashionista of Ponyville known as "Rarity".

To the average onlooker and resident of Ponyville, Rarity was merely gawking at the intricate designs of Princess Twilight's gown. But in reality, Rarity was focused only on the copious amounts of flab Twilight carried upon her now Alicorn physique. Like a doctor monitoring a patient's progress, Rarity easily noticed how fat her mauve friend was getting prior to her ascension.

However, as she got to know Twilight better, the stark white Unicorn mare began to develop..."certain feelings", shall we say.

Feelings of affection.

Feelings of romance.

Feelings...of love.

Suffice to say, Rarity soon realized that she was in love with her best friend, just before Twilight's ascension into a full-fledged Alicorn.

In her mind, just as Twilight reached Celestia before her and many ponies, Rarity now knew that she had to come clean and confess her feelings for the rotund Alicorn Princess.

Otherwise, she wouldn't get over herself.

------------

Shortly after Twilight's humble speech, the festivities soon began in full swing. Pinkie was excited as always, Fluttershy was spending time with Discord, Applejack and Rainbow Dash continued their friendly rivalry as usual. And Rarity herself was keeping herself temporarily preoccupied as to avoid looking conspicuous.

From there, as she finished off her glass of red wine, she soon began searching for the rotund Twilight Sparkle, where she soon found her...

As the sun rose over Ponyville, a purple unicorn stirred from her heavy slumber. Another day was set out for her to conquer, and she was ready for anything! She giggled as the light poured in through her window, tickling her nose and all of her body, encouraging just enough movement to get out of bed and start her daily adventures. and toppled out of bed and down the stairs.

"What in Celesti-owwww..." Twilight rubbed her flank. It had received the full blast of the fall, and now was pulsing in pain. Sorely, she retreated back up to her room. She slowly turned around in front of her mirror, hoping that her accident hadn't left a bruise, but what she saw was a bit of a surprise.

The unicorn had never been skinny - a strict schedule of reading books and writing letters leaves very little time for exercise, but now she was noticing that she was... well, fat. She stared at her reflection in wonder and fascination, observing every detail about her body. Her cheeks were soft and doughy, and hung a good inch off of her face on either side. They wobbled in unison with her three chins when she talked, quivering with waves like water. A thick forehoof sunk into twenty inches' worth of squishy, pillowy blubber. Her stomach hung fairly low, only about six inches off the ground, and it jiggled with each of her movements. But the prize had to be taken by her flank. With a cutie mark stretched out to twice its normal size, a good full four feet of rump totaled across her back. It was perfectly round, and swayed evenly and smoothly, contrasting to the bouncy ripples of the rest of her body. Overall, she resembled a 5ft x 6ft bowl of cuddly gelatin, weighing about 150 pounds.

Twilight was astounded. How had she gotten so big? Or, even more baffling: why hadn't she noticed it before!? Surely such a large weight was noticeable. Logically speaking, thought the unicorn, I might have just been gaining for an extremely long time, and the change didn't occur to me till I actually thought about it.

Twilight looked back into the mirror. The sun fell on her rolls of fat, illuminating them with a golden glow. A warm feeling of contentedness flooded over her, and her eyes twinkled with delight. She smiled, and did a little twirl. She had never felt quite so good about her body. Suddenly, she was very excited. Another adventure to look into, to explore and experiment with. And best of all, she didn't have to convince any of her friends to be her lab rat! Surely gaining weight for the sake of learning was no great sin; when she was through, she could just work it off - if she even wanted to get rid of it. She could study how quickly she could gain, how big a pony could get, different ways to get bigger. A whole new frontier, and one that didn't even require her to-

GUUUUUURGLEEEEE.

"You ready for this, squirt?"

It wasn't too often, but Rainbow Dash could tell that Scootaloo was starting to see her as more than just an icon for her to obsess over............At least that's what she assumed.
