154222.content:
Celestia snuggled into the great many pillows below her. She sighed contently as she gave a few of them a squeeze. "You're being too good to me, Luna."

Luna merely smiled as she lifted up a massive platter of various appetizers with her magic. "Nothing is too good for my sister."

The dining hall had been altered in but a few slight ways. Celestia now laid upon a mattress and was surrounded by pillows so as not to strain herself. There were now many tables to be seen, each with it's own selection of glorious food. Celestia's eyes were a bit glossy as she waited for the servants to finish filling everything up. She didn't want to wait for the wonderful smelling delicacies.

"Open wide, sister," Luna said as she held a spinach wrap. Celestia greedily ate it whole a moaned in pleasure.

"Food, glorious food..." Celestia said with a giggle.

"Servants?" Luna addressed, to which the assembled fifteen or so waiters and the ten guards stoically nodded. "Let the feast commence!"

And then it began. Luna and the assembled ponies began to pick up food and bring it to Celestia's waiting maw. Aside from chewing, the Sun Princess had to do nothing as she was fed meal after meal. She amazed herself as she managed to get more and more into her mouth as she took bigger and bigger bites. She massaged herself as she felt her stomach get larger as it became stuffed with food.

Her mind hazed over as she became lost into the wonderful sensations of the food she her soft body. She wondered why she had never thought to do this before. For the life of her Celestia could no longer remember why she didn't spend more time eating. Some part of her wondered why she wasn't feeling full yet, but she shoved that thought aside. If she got to eat more, why should she care?

"She sure can pack it," one servant commented as he carried the bowl that held the five gallons of pudding that had just been slurped up.

"She's already massive," another said from around back of the princess. "Look at her flank."

"Mah frank?" Celestia asked with her mouth full of cake. She swallowed and turned to look behind her. Or she tried at first. Her new chins actually made it rather hard. "Are these my shoulders? I thought somepony had put pillows around my head. Just how big am I?"

Luna smiled and nuzzled Celestia's neck fat. "To put it in perspective, your cutie mark is now half the size of a normal pony."

Celestia's eyes grew wide and she once more tried to look around herself, this time with success. To her shock, she had grown huge. She reminded herself of a pear almost. Each cheek of her rump could hold perhaps three small fillies. She saw her stomach and gasped at how it had grown large enough to push the pillows of the mattress. She covered the mattress. Her once slender legs could now be mistaken for small tree trunks.

She felt her newly formed chest fat and and smiled despite herself. "I must be over three hundred pounds," she said in amazement and maybe with a little pride.

"Indeed!" Luna nearly shouted. "To think you were a stick yesterday."

Celestia laughed, causing her neck to jiggle. "Yesterday I wasn't so hungry. But I think I look rather nice with all this extra padding. What do you all think?"

She turned to the servants and got mixed reactions. Some of them nodded and seemed to go along with it as servants tend to do. Some of them looked rather mortified at the idea. Most, however, were blushing and sweating slightly.

"I think you look lovely," one guard said.

"Aye," agreed another.

Celestia smiled warmly. "Wonderful. Then I suppose you all wouldn't mind if I got bigger?"

The red faced servants became even redder.

Luna smiled. "That shan't be a problem at the rate you've devoured my feast to you. The castle has almost ran out of food trying to satisfy you."

Celestia blushed. "Oh my. Well then..."
154222.title: Luna has the dining room set for Celestia to ea...

choices: Luna has Restocked the Castle, so the Binge Continues
Luna has a Special Present for Celestia
1542221.content:
"I think we should stop for now," Celestia said as she struggled to push herself up from the fluffiness of the mattress and her billowing self.

Luna pouted while a few servants seemed relieved. Only a few. The rest looked disappointed. "Are you sure? You can't be full after all this. Well, maybe you can..."

Celestia wobbled on her legs, her muscles aching from lack of use and the extra weight. "Well, no, I am still quite hungry. But as you said, there's no more food in the castle. We should all just go to bed and continue on with our lives."

Luna sighed. "Very well, if this is how you feel."

Celestia smiled in return. "Thank you for indulging me, Luna. I would love to do this again sometime if we can." Celestia yawned and began to waddle to her room. She giggled as she felt herself bounce.

The servants began the three hour long job of cleaning up Celestia's mess while Luna grinned. "Faithful stewards, restock the castle as soon as you can. Celestia says she is not satisfied, so we must feed her until she is."

The servants, for the most part, seemed quite happy with the idea. "We shall bring her snacks whenever we can," one servant said.

"By the way," Luna began with a mischievous smirk. "Are you all enjoying feeding my sister?"

The ponies had once more gone red faced.

"In that case, I have a plan."

--

Celestia struggled to stay awake during the Court she always held at noon. She always had trouble listening to the noble ponies complaining about some such stupid thing or another, but today it was extra hard not to fall asleep in her throne. It wasn't that she didn't sleep well, far from it. It was that her dreams were filled with mountains made of cake and donuts as big as Canterlot and rivers made of chocolate and many other wonderful that were all for her to scarf down. It had be so much fun, even when she became so big that she herself could have been mistaken as a mountain. Just the thought of all that delicious food was making her drool.

"... so, due to the... and because... raise tax on apples..."

Mmmhh, apples. She could have gone for some pie right then. She could almost smell the warm goop inside a lovely crust.

Celestia sniffed harder. Was her imagination really so wild, or did she smell apple pie? She blinked and saw a pie tin with a fresh pie floating in front of her. She turned to look at a guard who smiled up at her as his horn glowed. "Feeling peckish, my princess?"

Celestia mouthed a 'thank you' and munched on the pie as the noble ponies droned on. Each time she finished, another treat floated in front of her. Soon there was a constant stream of food going into the solar princess.

"Uh, my lady?" the noble pony who had been talking asked.

"I'm afraid she's a bit preoccupied right now," a guard said as he ushered them all out of the throne room. "Come back tomorrow if you don't mind."

"But-" the door was slammed in his face.

"Wha?" Celestia asked groggily with her mouth full of cookies. "Where'd they go?"

"They decided to leave you alone today," the guard that brought her the latest tub of ice cream said. "Just relax and let us make you happy."

Celestia burped in reply and blushed. "I hope I didn't scare them away. Oh my goodness, I would love an ice cream right now, if you can get me some".

Celestia ate without abandon as more and more food was brought to her. At last she decided that this was enough (although she is still wasn't full). She tried to sit up from her throne and met resistance. She blushed as she realized that her flank was so big that her bottom was wedged in her seat.

"Um, help?"

"Help, you say?" Luna asked as she walked int the room. "I can see our little piggy is filling up nicely. She's already too big for her chair."

Celestia rubbed the back of her head. "I can't believe I put on all this weight in less that twelve hours. What am I up to now, four hundred pounds?" Celestia licked icing off her face. "But food is just so good."

"Ha!" Luna laughed. "You thought that was a feast last night? It is time for a real feast."
1542221.title: That's enough for one day... or maybe not.

15422212.content:
It took Luna and two guards to pull Celestia out of her throne, and that ruined the seat indefinitely. Celestia looked and the dented throne and blushed. "Oops."

Luna laughed. "I just don't have the words to describe my mirth right now."

Celestia turned to her sister but noticed the guards were as red as she felt. "Thank you," she said with a smile. "You have no idea how hungry I am." Her stomach growled loudly. "Or still am."

"No trouble my lady," one said as they both bowed. "You looked so hungry."

"And we love seeing you so happy," the other said.

Celestia thought for a moment. "Wait a minute, where did you get that food."

They kicked their hooves bashfully and Luna spoke for them. "They cooked some of it themselves, but received quite a bit of help from the kitchen staff. In fact, most of the castle has been preparing to feed you."

Celestia gaped. "The whole castle... wants to feed me?"

Luna nodded.

"Why?" She turned to the guards for an answer.

"Well, we like seeing you happy."

"And, er... you're beautiful. Not that you weren't before."

"Beautiful?" Celestia said with sparkling eyes. "You mean I'm a whale and I'm beautiful?"

Luna clopped her front hooves together. "Save your fantasies for later, I have a surprise for you. To the dining hall!" With that, Luna trotted off. The guards made to leave, but Celestia used her magic and grabbed the one brave enough to speak his mind.

"Come by my room later. All this blubber could use a good cuddle." She let him go and made a huge show of swaying her flanks and letting them jiggle. The guard's eyes rolled back and he promptly fainted.

--

"Keep your eyes closed."

"They're closed, they're closed."

"Be prepared for you head to implode, sister, for you are in for a treat."

"Are you sure you don't mean for my mind to be blown?"

"Whichever works. We are almost there."

"Ooh, something smells heavenly. Chocolate, and lots of it. And also familiar."

"We are just about ready."

"Wait a moment... it can't be. Luna, you didn't."

"Alright, open your eyes and prepare to go to heaven."

Celestia opened her eyes and almost cried. It was the best cake that had ever existed, one she had been taunted by only tasting it. A massive spongy cake with a name her glazed mind could not remember, cover in frosted donuts and eclairs and topped with the head of a literal chocolate moose. She practically drowned in her own drool at the sight of it.

"That cake," Celestia moaned. "The ultimate cake. The cake that makes every other cake wish it could have just a little of its frosting as to be a little bit closer to its magnificence. How is it possible?"

The surrounding servants all looked happy with their princess's reaction while Luna flicked her mane. "It was a lot of luck that brought this sugary delight before you. I had originally intended to just have the actual cake part, but as soon as it was mentioned it was for you the chefs all came together and made this masterpiece of sinful food immediately. So enjoy yourself sister dearest; this monstrosity is all for you."

Celestia pulled Luna and as many servants as she could into a great big flabby hug. "Oh, you are all too good to me! What did I do to deserve this?"

Luna snuggled Celestia's fat despite how against decorum it was. At this point, she decided, decorum had been thrown out the window. "No need to thank us, your happiness is all we require."

"Well then," Celestia said as she let them go and approached the gargantuan cake. Even though it was up on a table, she could see it was bigger than she was in height, and maybe even in mass. She floated a plate and fork over but it was quickly pulled away by Luna's magic.

"No need to use manners with us. Go ahead and glut yourself."

Celestia smiled and tore off a chunk with her magic. She bit down and actually did cry. She had only one slice of this amazing pastry/cake/chocolate/thing before and it wasn't enough. The explosion of flavor in her mouth threatened to rip her jaw apart. She might as well have been the jelly she was eating, because she fell to the ground as her legs gave way.

"Soooo goooood," Celestia moaned as she took another bite. She entered a drunken state where all she wanted to do was eat, eat, eat! She worked her way through each part of the dessert methodically and she savored each nibble and lick she took.

Then, all to soon, the cake was gone. Celestia chewed on the moose head as slowly as she could and let it melt in her mouth. Her snout, bulging cheeks, and massive jowl were covered with sticky sugar, sprinkles, cream, and chocolate. She was now almost perfectly round while sitting on her massive butt. She could hardly believe herself as she tipped to and fro in her cake educed stupor.

And, despite eating more than what was once her whole eight in cake, she still was not satisfied.

Luna's mouth hung open at the sight of her rotund sister licking frosting off her hoof. She had not believed Celestia would actually devour the whole thing in one day, let only one hour! Celestia stomach gurgled a roared. "It's not possible," Luna said aloud. "You absolutely cannot still be hungry after that."

Celestia blushed. "Well, I might have room for a snack."
15422212.title: This Cake is no Lie

choices: Celestia kind of gets that Feast
154222122.content:
Celestia sighed in contentment as she snuggled deeper into her pillows. She shifted slightly and the blanket that barely covered her belly slipped and fell to her side.

"Drat" she said, feeling too lethargic to even use her magic to lift it back up. It didn't seem worth it since it was obvious she needed a parachute to cover herself at this point. Her flab kept her warm enough anyway.

Celestia looked out the window from her perch on her bed and pouted a bit. Once again the castle had run out of food. Luna had been forced to reduce her meals down to the breakfast, lunch and dinner and to semi-normal proportions. She was allowed to eat as much as a normal pony, but no more. Celestia desperately wanted to protest this but knew that her new found hunger was difficult to keep up with. Besides she was now massive. If she got too much bigger she'd spill over the bed. She shivered a bit at the thought and realized it did not sound terrible. Quite the opposite in fact. She felt like a new mare with all the pounds added to her. So soft and jiggly like a water bed. She nuzzled her great big second chin at the thought.

A gentle knock came from her door Celestia jumped with a start and her fat bounced around. "Who is it?" Celestia called.

"White Wind. The uh, guard from earlier."

Celestia smiled and said "Come in please."

White wind walked in with a serving trolley behind him and froze at the sight of the princess so amazingly fat. "Wow"

Celestia giggled and beckoned him seductively. "Come in White. Close the door behind you please"

He did as he was told and brought the trolley over to her. He stood there for a bit, awkwardly shuffling his hooves.

"Well?" Celestia asked. "Are you going to get into this bed with me or will I have to use force?"

White Wind gave a small and excited smile as he removed his armor. "Forgive me Princess. I am quite nervous actually"

"Please just call me Celestia." White Wind climbed onto the bed and became rigid as Celestia pulled him into a blubbery hug. Celestia was disheartened and thought that he was terrified, but he slowly returned the gesture.

"This is different" White Wind said red faced.

Celestia turned so that White Wind was laying on her chest and stomach. "Do you really think I'm beautiful despite the fact that I'm so fat?"

"I, uh... well yes. I think all of this extra you is... pleasant. Yes pleasant is the word."

Celestia let out a little squee and held him a bit tighter. "You don't know how wonderful it is to here you say that."

"Really?" he blinked. "But everypony tells you that you are beautiful. What made me so different princ- Celestia?"

"Everypony tells me that I am beautiful or tells me I am the best thing since they invented ink or tells me I am perfect. Now I am an overweight slob. I have eaten enough in the past two days to feed a whole town. I haven't gotten a single compliment since all of this started and at most ponies just bring me more food to satisfy me. They are too scared to say anything and I know that quite a few of them like me like this" Celestia smiles coyly as she pressed his whole face into one of her cheeks. "And then there is you. You were brave enough to be something other than a guard. You told me I am beautiful and if your blush means anything then you meant it. It has been so long since a pony was honest to me. Such bravery has to be rewarded" She leaned in and gave him a peck on the nose. He went limp and almost passed out. "Did I overwhelm you?"

White Wind shakily brought his head up. "I'm fine Celestia" he said dreamily. "I was not expecting a kiss. I do not really know what I was expecting when you called me in here but I am happy I could make you happy."

They smiled and simply snuggled into each other for a while. "I don't remember the last time I held anypony this close" Celestia said happily.

"You must get so lonely" White Wind replied. "We are taught in training to never try and get friendly with you. I'd be fired in an instant if anypony found us"

Celestia sighed. White Wind chuckled at her adorably chunky pout. "How many times do I have to ban that before they get that I want to be friendly with my guards?"

"Do not be too mad at us as you do raise the sun and the sun is far and out of our reach. Why would the magnificent mare that moves it be any different?"

"Oooh a poet too. Am I not the lucky one?"

"Heh thank you. Celestia?"

"Yes my tiny little pony?"

"May I... feed you?"

Celestia's eyes twinkled. "I thought you would never ask. What did you bring me?"

White Wind's horn glowed as he magically lifted a large plate with a sliver lid covering it. "Since the castle is out of food I had to do something simple. It is not much but this was something my mother and I liked to do. First a big plate of fresh chocolate cookies" The lid was lifted and there was a pile of warm cookies underneath. Celestia looked ready to smother him at the sight.

"Goodness you have no idea how hungry I am"

"Open wide"

Celestia opened her mouth and a cookie was placed inside. She chewed and moaned as is squished in her teeth. "So warm and chewy." She swallowed and let another cookie be put in her mouth. "Your mothers recipe?"

"Family actually. I am a baker on my mothers side I suppose. More?"

"Please" Another disappeared into her. "I don't think I've actually had a cookie for two hundred years since it became out of fashion to eat tasty things"

White Wind forced a cookie between her lips. "I will never understand why ponies that look like they are starving are attractive. A good mare needs some meat on her" He placed a cookie on her tongue.

"I take it I am not the first fed by you"

"Just one other. Until then I had a hard time dating. I was never interested in them physically. Then I met this one gorgeous mare maybe a fourth of what you weigh"

"Two hundred and fifty? She sounds lovely" This time he used a hoof to put the treat in.

"She was amazing. Sweet with a healthy appetite and so nice to hold" He sighed and stared at the cookie he was holding.

"What happened to her?" Celestia asked at seeing his faraway look.

"She couldn't stand the way ponies looked her and went on a diet. Now she is so thin she puts tooth picks to shame. I hated seeing her starve herself so we broke up. She is dating that Fancy Pants fellow now"

"You poor thing" Celestia said as she enveloped him in her bulky legs.

"She is happy so what else can I ask for? This situation is pretty decent anyway" He traced a cookie around her lips before she chomped into it.

"I could never go back to small portions. I mean really, food is so good! How could anypony deprive themselves of this?" He placed a cookie on her nose. "Now you're just teasing me" She reached with her tongue and cheered when she pulled it into her mouth.

"I have been giving them to you. You will have to work for the rest" He held a cookie just in front of her face.

Celestia gave a fake sigh. "But a fatty like me will never make such a long distance"

He merely waved it in front of her.

"Oh fine you brute." She made a show of tipping her head forward to reach it. She gobbled it and over dramatically panted. "Oh I am so tired. How could you make a princess exert herself so?"

"Last one. You can work that jaw Celestia" He placed to cookie between his teeth and wiggled his brow.

Celestia laughed and rippled. "How sly of you. I think I can muster some strength for this one" She reached her head forward and bit the cookie. She then surrounded his mouth and explored it to get the rest. White Wind became limp again but entwined his tongue to hers. This lasted for about five minutes before they broke apart and looked into each others eyes.

"Best cookies ever" Celestia said.

"Yeah" he said tasting the chocolate that had once been on Celestia's teeth and looking ready to die without regrets. "But I have got one more thing for you. Have you ever baked, Celestia?"

She blushed. "I can't say that I have"

He magically floated a bowl over to them. "One thing common ponies sometimes do after baking is lick the bowl of any excess dough or frosting. My mother and I always made extra so we could munch on cold cookie dough" He scooped a spoonful of uncooked cookies. "We were never sure if we liked it better cooked or not so we always had both. Open up"

Celestia ate the chilly dough and jiggled as she shivered. "So good. This should be the main desert at all the Galas. More!" She had another bite and as she chewed he smeared some on her muzzle to lick off. It did not take long for the bowl to empty and she looked so sad when it did. She suckled the spoon to get as much of the taste as she could.

"I would make more but as I said the castle is being restocked"

Celestia sighed and smiled up at him. "It is alright. I just sort of wish I was full. Either that or I had an endless feast to munch on. But I'd rather you stay here with me anyway." Celestia amazingly turned over and covered White Wind with her belly and fore leg fat. "And this will make it so you will stay with me all night"

White Wind grinned like a fool. "Try not to suffocate me." With that he laid his head on Celestia's other leg and they talked until they fell asleep.
154222122.title: Character Development? In a weight gain story?

choices: Celestia's feedings slowly make her fatter.
Wait a minute, she's an Alicorn. She can use magic to make food!
1542221221.content:
Celestia peaked her thick head out the door to make sure nopony was outside waiting. She grinned when she saw she was alone and closed the door behind her. She lumbered through the royal pantry (how long had this been here?) and began searching for something tasty to eat. She found a bag full of apples and a tub of caramel sauce, much to her joy.

"This is better than dunking doughnuts in milk," Celestia said aloud. The let an apple sink in and pulled it back up dripping with sugar. She took a bite and moaned in pleasure.

"Sister!" Luna shouted. Celestia spat her snack out in surprise. "What do you think you are doing?"

Celestia turned to Luna with a guilty expression. She smiled feebly. "Um... eating?"

"Celestia, we had dinner twenty minutes ago. Have you forgotten the rules again?"

Celestia sighed and fell on her haunches which made her quiver and quake. "I'm sorry Luna, I really am. I'm just so hungry all the time."

Luna rubbed her face with her hoof in exasperation. "I know things are different in this era and we don't need to act so haughty anymore, but you don't act like a princess at all anymore. You don't wear your regalia or tiara anymore, you don't even try to listen in court, and you eat like a hog."

Celestia winced at that.

"Alright, I'm sorry. It's not your fault you can't feel full. But really, this is most unbecoming. You don't act like a princess, you act like..." Luna blinked as she watched Celestia regretfully lick some caramel off her original chin. Luna's thoughts wondered to the last two weeks of almost regular meals. The time Celestia discovered that grapefruit was dangerous, or when she first tried onion rings at that accursed White Wind's request. All the while, even when her stomach was growling, Celestia was smiling and laughing in a way that Luna barely recognized. It was back when they were still fillies...

"Like a normal pony," Luna sighed.

"I'm sorry Luna," Celestia said. "I'm not trying to hurt anypony. I know that if I eat like I did the first two nights everyday Equestria would run out of food in a few months, but food is so good. I can't explain it, but all I want is to eat and eat."

Luna shook her head dejectedly. "Having you been snacking behind my back?"

Celestia's eyes shot around. "N-no. Just these apples."

Luna looked suspicious and and would later be glad she did. At that moment, White Wind Merrily walked in with a plate of brownies. "Oh Celestia, I brought you usual after dinner desert," he sang before he noticed a guilty looking Celestia and an irritated Luna shooting him a death glare. "Heh, heh. Maybe I should leave."

"Hold it right there," Luna said, shutting the door with her magic. White Wind nearly dropped the brownies in fear. "So, you have been bringing my sister treats when I clearly told all the staff that doing so was prohibited."

White Wind was suddenly pulled away from Luna and into the pillow like fore legs of Celestia. "Please don't be made at him, it's my fault. I should show self restraint but I don't. He's just being sweet to me."

White Wind instinctively hugged Celestia before remembering he was in trouble. "I am sorry, Princess Luna. Celestia- ahem, Princess Celestia has only been munching on thing. Really, the castle throws out more food a day than what I've been making for her."

Luna stepped up to them and Luna gazed into White Wind's eye. "Guard pony, tell me something, and be honest. Do you love my sister?"

White Wind gulped. They hadn't told anypony about their relationship for fear of paparazzi and Luna's wrath. But he decided it was do or die time. "I... I do, Luna. I merely wish to see her happy. As it turns out, eating makes her happy. I'll do anything to please her and would never stop loving her and caring for her as long as I live."

"And you, sister, love this pony as much as he claims to love you?"

Celestia nodded fervently, making her upper body jiggle. "With all my heart. He's kind and caring and talks to me honestly he treats me like... like..."

"Like a normal pony," Luna finished. She smiled softly with her eyes closed. "Alright, new rule; you can eat as much as you want whenever you want."

Celestia beamed at this.

"However," Luna quickly added, "he has to be the one to make it. You won't ask any of the chefs to cook you food if it isn't mealtime. If he can make it you may eat it."

Celestia looked incredibly happy. "Luna, you have no idea how good it is to hear that."

"And you" Luna pointed a hoof at White Wind. "If you dare so much a chip her heart banishment to the moon will seem like a light sentence."

White wind forced himself out of Celestia's grip and stood face to face with Luna. "I would sooner die than break Celestia's heart."

Luna looked him over and smiled softly at them. "Very well, enjoy your snack time. You'd better be out of here in an hour."

"Thank you, Luna. This means so much to me."

"Think nothing of it. One of us has to be the bigger mare. Wait a minute, that's not me, is it?" Luna snickered and Celestia groaned. "Don't be like that, you really take the cake. And the brownies, the cookies, the ice cream." She laughed. "Don't get angry with me, you are giving yourself more fluff than all the pillows in Equestria. I reserve my right as your sister to poke fun. You two enjoy yourselves while I make sure our country doesn't fall apart." With that Luna left Celestia and White Wind alone.

"Well, that worked out nicely, didn't it?" No response. Celestia walked over to where he was still standing, unmoved from where he spoke to Luna. "White Wind?" She gently poked him and he fell over stiff as a board. "I'll just carry you back to my room."


Life for Celestia was very different after her first super binge. First and foremost, she was now massive. Her Cutie Mark was stretched across her flank to where it was bigger than any of her royal staff. Her belly hung low between already thick legs and made regal walking impossible. Sitting on her rump completely actually raised her higher then any chair used too, not that any chair could survive her posterior. Her neck had long since vanished to be replaced by a mighty jowl. She was practically a fat filled pear if her body stopped jiggling long enough for her to check.

She was so wide that it seemed impossible to see around the over one thousand pounds that were Celestia without walking a little ways. Where once ponies got out of her way in fearful respect they now moved in fear of being squashed beneath her lard. The rich delegates at her court couldn't get a word in because they were so confused by the new shape of their princess. There was hardly a door in the palace she could fit through that wasn't a huge ornamental door. And she seemed so happy. Her servants were treating her less like a princess and more like a mother to be pleased. She had finally accepted the hidden glutton within her and life had become great. She loved strutting her blubber around the castle and seeing the stares of the aroused guards trying not to oogle her. She felt sexy and could hardly believe the effect she had on them.

Celestia had an understanding Sister, a wonderful stallion taking care of her and a plate of brownies. Nothing could make this better.

Except to feel full.

"Last one," White Wind said as he dangled a brownie over her head. She pathetically reached for it before falling back onto her pillow. "Aw, my princess is all tuckered out." He shoved the brownie into her mouth and she chewed with a grateful coo. "Be careful. If you eat like this you might get fat one day.

They both laughed. "What are you talking about? I'm skinny and always will be." Their conversations consisted of nothings like this that were about how skinny or fat she was. Celestia pulled him close and gave him a kiss, allowing him to taste the chocolate he had made.

"I meant what I said back there," White Wind said as they broke apart. He hugged against her thick chin. "I love you, every pound. A better mare cannot be imagined."

Celestia almost cried with joy. "Oh, my tiny little pony, I love you with every pound in my body. I don't know how I can express it better." Her stomach growled at her. "Quiet you, we're having a moment."

White Wind laughed. "Still hungry of course. You should have brought those apples."

She shrugged. "Don't worry about it now. Just being here with me is enough for now." Her stomach growled again. "Well, if you wouldn't mind going..."

White Wind kissed here again and jumped off her to the floor. "I will be back soon, my great big pony." He left her alone in her room.

She sighed contently an massaged her belly, kicking her legs slightly while feeling like a bloated water balloon or a stuffed pig. "Calm down please. I sure wish I could make you full." She leaned into herself and began to dream about food again.
1542221221.title: Life as a Fat Princess

choices: "Give me a moment, that one's in the back."
"You do know that's physically impossible, right?"
15422212212.content:
Celestia slurped down the remaining caramel sauce a breathed heavily when she finished, placing the tub on the floor. She moaned in frustration when her stomach growled at her again.

"No, bad tummy. Can't we go ten minutes without eating? I want to lay with White Wind." It gurgled back in response.

White Wind chuckled and climbed her mountainous belly. "Maybe this will help." He kneaded his hooves into her fat and she sighed in contentment.

"Ooh, yes, that's the spot. No wonder dogs like it so much." Her stomach remained silent as he did this. "But I can't kiss you while you're up there. I wish there was some way to fill me up, at least for a bit."

White Wind slid to Celestia's face and patted one of her chubby cheeks. "Don't worry. Tomorrow I'll wake up and make enough extra blueberry pancakes to reach the ceiling."

Celestia smiled. "You spoil me, my tiny little pony. But, uh... could we get a midnight snack now?"

"It's not even nine o'clock yet."

"I know," Celestia sighed. "I'm just so hungry. It feels like everything I eat gets turned straight to fat." She rubbed the little bit of herself that she could reach. "Not that that's terrible, but I would like to just hold you without having to be interrupted by my roaring hunger."

"Yes, I know. I don't mind feeding you but it has to be annoying to not be able to go about your business without wanting to eat."

"Oh, I don't mind the eating part," Celestia said giggling. "It's the hunger that gets me."

"Hhm. Too bad you can't just conjure more food with your magic."

Celestia blinked at that. "White Wind... after breakfast tomorrow, will you escort me to the castle library?"

--

The royal librarian struggled to keep her eyes opened as she nodded in and out of sleep. It sure was boring duty she had. None of the ponies at Celestia's School for Gifted Fillies ever came here to do any decent research, and the only pony who actually cared abut the dusty books had left some time ago.

She sighed and turned a page of the book she was reading for the fifth time. She wished somepony would come with a desire to read.

All of a sudden the library began to shake with a massive tremor. The shelves rocked dangerously and books fell around the front desk.

"Earthquake!" the librarian screamed before she jumped under her desk. As soon as it started, however, it ended. She shakily looked up to she her carefully maintained library a mess. She sighed. "At least its something to do. Then the door opened and a disheveled guard stepped though.

"Presenting her royal highness, Princess Celestia."

A great white behemoth lumbered into the library, wedging itself through the door. The librarian rubbed her eyes at the site of Princess Celestia, a massive mare made of lard. She had heard Celestia had put on weight, but she had no idea it was to this extreme.

"Hel... hello my... good... librarian..." Celestia panted. "I came to... to... I need a break." She promptly let her legs give out and crashed to the floor, making the room shake a bit. She wobbled with a silly grin on her face. "That was intense."

The librarian blinked. "Is she okay?"

"No need to worry," the guard said. "She can walk just fine if that's what you're worried about. She's just a bit sore right now from the fall."

"Fall?"

"She tripped down the stairs."

The librarian's eyes crossed as she realized she had actually experienced a marequake a bit ago. "Right. How may I help you today? Will it be a diet book or a cookbook?"

The guard grinned. "Ooh, there's a cookbook section? I'll gladly look at that."

"I was jok- never mind. Why is a half ton princess in my library?"

"Oh, yes. She is hungry."

"So you came to the royal library?"

"You did say you have cookbooks."

"I meant 'why is she a half ton?'"

"I told you, she's hungry."

"Are you messing with me?"

Celestia motioned to the librarian. "Excuse her, White Wind, she hasn't caught on with what's happening. Good mare, to put it simply, I've embraced my appetite and and am glutting myself every chance I can."

The librarian gaped at the massive princess. "But why?"

Celestia giggled. "Why not?"

"Because... because..." Because why? It's not exactly like the librarian could tell the princess what to do with her body. "Alright then, let's just pretend this is normal." She went behind the desk. "Hello, and welcome to the royal Library. How may I assist you today?"

"Yes please," Celestia said. "I'm looking for matter related spells, specifically duplication spells."

"Duplication?" the librarian mused.

White Wind nodded. "We wish to know if it is possible to multiply food."

She looked at the tubby and blushing princess, who she just noticed wasn't wearing her royal crown and whatnot. "Multiplication spells..."
15422212212.title: (Some pun about magic solving eveything.)

choices: "I'm not done yet. I'm going to make the spell myself!"
154222122122.content:
"You do know that's physically impossible, right?"

Celestia blinked. "Impossible? What do you mean."

The librarian looked a little nervous. "Ahem. Not to be impertinent, my princess, but it just is. That's one of the basic laws of magic; you can't create something from nothing. In theory, you could turn something into food, but you can't make new food. The matter has to come from somewhere."

Celestia looked crestfallen and felt a little dumb. How long had it been since she reviewed the basics of magic? That was the first thing taught after kindergarten.

"I hope you do not mind if we look around anyway," White Wind said as he took Celestia's hoof. He was nowhere near big or tall enough to actually help her up, but Celestia appreciated the thought.

"Going to check out those cookbooks?" the librarian teased. "Better be careful. If you keep eating like I think you are then it won't be long until you end up bigger than a whale!" The librarian immediately clamped her mouth shut when she said that. Why did she say that!?

Celestia just took it in stride and offered a warm smile. "You might be right. Wouldn't that be something?" She sauntered off into the depths of the shelves, White by her side. The librarian sighed in relief, but was still tense and very confused. She gulped and tried to focus on cleaning up the books that had fallen.

She tried very hard to the think about Celestia's hypnotic hips.

--

"Worse than nothing," Celestia said as she levitated a book back up onto the shelves. "Master Star Force says the same thing as all the others; matter can't come from nothing." She smiled as a danish was brought to her her. She took a grateful bite.

"It was not totally worthless coming here," White Wind said, being careful to balance the stack or books he had with him. "I have got all sorts of new recipes to try. I think you'll love Zebra styled meals, they look to have a certain spicy flare about them."

Celestia nuzzled White Wind. "You're always trying to please me. You don't have to work so hard for me."

"I know that. I want to."

Celestia's smile became warmer. "Well... I don't know what to do now. I was hoping for a way to ease my hunger."

"Maybe we should just let things be. I don't mind feeding you."

"And I don't mind being fed. I love it, believe me. I just wanted to actually feel full."

"Well, I'm here for you. If you need anything, just say it."

Celestia sighed.
154222122122.title: Something Magic can't do?

1542221221222.content:
"I'm going to make the spell myself," Celestia said with finality. "Come on, let's get to the Star Swirl the Bearded wing. There's enough equipment there to test out some theories I already have." She turned and began to waddle out of the library

White Wind smiled, amused. "Now, I'm all and all for performing experiments to disprove basic laws of magic, and believe me, I love watching the fat filled flank jiggle as you walk. But in order to avoid another confrontation with the stairs, why don't we teleport there?"

Celestia halted, the sudden stop causing her bulk to sway forward and back. She turned around and gave White Wind a coy look. "I'm not sure who I'm more mad at; you, for not telling me sooner so you could watch me jiggle, or me for not thinking of it myself."

White Wind tried to look innocent and failed.

"I think I'll have to punish you later my tiny little pony."

White Wind faked being horrified. "Oh no. What do you have planned for me, my princess?"

Celestia got close to him and enveloped him in her fore legs and fat. "Hmm, I think laying on top of you will suffice. All these pounds surrounding you, engulfing you, squishing you from above. You'll be absolutely smothered by all this fat."

White Wind looked ready to pass out. "Oh dear, how could I ever survive all that mare?"

"You'll just have to be stallion enough," Celestia said sensually as she closed her lips around his. With a golden 'pop', the two vanished from the royal library.

"Darn it!" the librarian swore from the other side of the shelf Celestia's mass had just about been pressing against. "Dear me, why did I want to watch that so bad?" She thought for a moment as she noticed the cookbooks White Wind had forgotten. "I wonder... How many other stallions like a full mare?"

--

White Wind chuckled at Celestia with a pair far too small goggles. They squashed her face and looked a little uncomfortable, but Celestia said she was fine. White Wind had his own pair, though wasn't going to be of too much help. His expertise was in guarding and cooking, so he was there for moral support and looking up what ever Celestia may need.

Celestia scribbled furiously on a piece of parchment. "Gah, so many runes to sort through. How many spells did Star Swirl actually come up with?"

"Technically two. The rest were improvements of spells that already existed." White Wind opened a scroll. "Ooh, time traveling for dimwits. Maybe I can stop myself from embaressing myself in school..."

"Really?" Celestia asked, trying to turn her neck to him and forgetting she was too fat to do that. She shifted her form so she was looking at him. "How'd you know that?"

"A random tidbit I picked up from Miss Sparkle," White replied. "You know she would go on those rants to anypony who had an ear when she learned something new."

Celestia's eyes lit up. "That's it! White Wind, you're a genius!"

"I am?"

Celestia got out a fresh scroll and began to speak aloud as she wrote. "My most faithful student Twilight Sparkle,

"I am working on a new project that I'd like assistance with. As you know, it is possible to transmogrify objects into other objects. I am attempting to duplicate objects and make an exact copy of them. It would be appreciated if you had any knowledge or ideas on the subject or could help me.

"Sincerely, Princess Celestia." She rolled it up and made it pop out of existence. "If Twilight Sparkle can't help me then nopony can."

White Wind smiled and opened his mouth to speak but was interrupted.

"You are really determined to get something to eat, aren't you sister?"

Celestia and White Wind turned to see Luna standing at the door. "Oh, hello Luna. I'm just performing some experiments. Not sneaking extra portions."

"I can see that." Luna looked over the notes and runes Celestia had made. "You're trying to completely change the face of magical theory as we know it. Doing so could revolutionize that way we live our lives. And why? Because my porky sister desires meals between meals."

Celestia blushed.

"Don't get me wrong, I fully support what you're doing. If you succeed, nopony will ever go hungry again. Maybe you'll even be satisfied." Luna began looking through the notes a little harder. "I see you're on the right track at any rate."

Celestia smiled. "Does that mean you'll help us?"

Luna nodded. "Why not? It's been a while since we've had some time together. It sounds like... fun, I believe. Even if I don't think for a moment we'll do it."

Celestia clapped her hooves together. "Yay! Thank you Luna." She grabbed her sister in a hug. Luna blushed and hugged back, feeling a bit jealous that White Wind felt this every night.

A scroll popped it front of Celestia and she opened it with her magic.

"What does it say?" White Wind asked.

"Twilight?" Luna asked. "Is it Tuesday already? I must be losing track of time.

Celestia scanned the letter...
1542221221222.title: Do it yourself magic.

choices: "Actually, I'd like to study your newfound hunger."
15422212212221.content:
"She would love to help!" Celestia exclaimed. "With the smartest unicorn in Equestia helping us, there's no way we can not get the spell." She tried to jump in glee. Emphasis on tried. She didn't even get off the ground, but did manage to lose her balance. She began to teeter to her side.

"TAKE COVER!" Luna shouted, and she and White Wind jumped under a desk.

"Oh dear..." Celestia said right before she impacted.

--

Twilight Sparkle made a slow trot through the familiar front gardens of Canterlot Castle with a smile on her face. She was so pleased that Celestia had decided to ask for her help with this matter. Twilight was so pleased that she used her newly learned and potentially dangerous long range teleport spell to make it in only a few minutes. She gave merry hello to the gaurds as she passed through the door. A servant was waiting for Twilight. He seemed a bit disheveled, but Twilight made no mention.

"The Star Swirl the Bearded wing, Lady Twilight," he said.

Twilight blinked. "But I didn't even ask."

He placed a hoof on her shoulder. "I was told to wait for you. Yes, Celestia planned for you to already be here. No, nothing of world shattering importance is going on. We all really hope you can help her."

"Is she in trouble?"

"Nothing serious, but... be warned. Celestia's apatite has gotten the better of her." With that, the servant walked a few steps away before tripping and falling asleep on the spot.

Twilight scratched her head and made a quick warp to the desired wing and knocked on the bars. "Celestia, are you there?"

Instead of her white colored teacher, Luna came up and opened the door. "Salutations, Twilight. I trust you are well?"

Twilight looked over Luna. Her regelia was barely hanging on and her crown was tilted. Her starry mane was limp. Despite this, she seemed almost giddy.

"Yeah, I'm fine. are you okay?"

"Don't worry. Just a marequake."

Twilight felt her brain stop. "Marequake?"

"Come in and you'll understand. Just... be prepared for a sight that will haunt the rest of your life."

Twilight followed Luna inside and noticed the fallen books and scrolls all over the place. It looked like a earthquake had happened, but Luna said it was a marequake. But what was a....

Twilight's mouth hung open at the image before her. Celestia was eating a jelly doughnut with a plate of several others next to her head. She was laying on her side on the floor. A stallion brought another plat of doughnuts to her and pecked her on the cheek. Those things alone was enough to make Twilight's brain melt, but that wasn't the worst of it.

Celestia was not fat. She wasn't obese. She was masive.

"Oh, herro Twiwight," Celestia said through her treat. She swallowed. "How was your trip?"

Twilight didn't do anything for a minute except stare. Finally her brain reformed enough to form a thought. "Princess... are you okay?"

Celestia blushed. "Well, I had a little accident. I was so excited when you said you were coming that I... lost my balance."

Twilight suddenly realized what a marequake was. "Celestia... why are you so... so..."

"Fat?" Luna interjected. "Go ahead and tell her why you are fat, sister dearest."

Celestia patted her blubber. "Don't get the wrong idea, Twilight. I'm perfectly fine. Healthy as always. I don't even think I can get sick anyway. The thing is, a few weeks ago, I had a realization. I love food. It's just so good that I could stop eating. My sister and the staff were so supportive that they let me eat to my heart's content. The thing is, after a few days of non-stop eating it became apparent that I can't feel full, or at least it takes a lot of food. I've never felt it, so I don't know."

Twilight pointed at the stallion. "And him?"

Celestia pulled the stallion close and hugged him. Her forelegs were so thick that the stallion almost disappeared in her flab. "This is White Wind, my new personal chef and coltfriend." She kissed him quickly but meaningfully. He returned it.

Twilight wasn't sure how she felt. "And you're... happy." It wasn't a question.

Celestia looked almost like a filly caught stealing from the cookie jar. "I am, Twilight. I know I'm a great big fatty now, but I feel good. I finally feel like... me, almost, if that makes sense."

White Wind was released and shook Twilight's hoof. "It is nice to see you again, Lady Twilight. Eclair?" He offered Twilight a doughnut.

Twilight shook her head and walked over to Celestia. "Um... Celestia?"

"Yes, my student?"

"May I... may I hug you?"

Celestia smiled and reached our with her legs. "Come here, my darling student."

They embraced each other, and Twilight felt incredibly warm. "It's so strange... I feel like a little filly again when you seemed like the great big powerful princess."

"Well... I don't think that changed all that much."

Twilight chuckled and nuzzled Celestia's jowl. "I guess it didn't."

--

A few minutes of hugs, jibes, and doughnuts later, Celestia finally stopped being lazy and picked herself off the ground. Twilight was a little intimidated by her size, but Celestia's motherly smile put her at ease.

"So..." Celestia said as she waddled over to a table. Twilight giggled at Celestia's proud and hilarious waddle/strut. "Think you can help us with this spell?"

"So, you want to duplicate items to make more food. I'm not sure, but we can try."

Luna looked over some notes. "I'm sure. This won't work at all. But it seems like it would be fun to waste our time trying to deny the laws of magic."

"Shall we get started?" White Wind asked. Somehow he had conjured a plate of cupcakes.

"Ooh, I smell lemon," Celestia said as she levitated one and ate it in two bites.

Twilight looked thoughtful for a bit.
15422212212221.title: And the student.... something... the master.

154222122122211.content:
"So, here's the thing," Twilight said as she set the top of a twelve foot long scroll down on the table. "You can't make matter from nothing. That's a given. One thing I think they all have wrong, however, is that you can't make matter at all. It's simply about equivalent exchange. It's easy to turn something into something else. We just need to make energy into matter."

White Wind scratched his head while looking over the complicated calculation on the other end of the scroll. "You make it sound simple."

"It's not simple in the slightest," Luna said. "The amount of energy needed to do this is astronomical. It needs a higher concentration of power than my sister has pounds."

Celestia chewed on some sponge cake and looked thoughtful. "Well... I am an alicorn. Maybe if Luna and I combine our power, we'd have just enough."

Twilight scribbled a little more. "This spell should definitely work. All it needs is power. If we can get it to work once, I'm sure we can tweak it afterwords for easier use."

Celestia daydreamed for a moment. She was surrounded by conjured food that was flowing into her mouth at a constant rate, a myriad of flavors passing her tongue and filling her stomach. Just growing bigger and bigger and bigger...

"Sister? Sister, are you dreaming about eating again?"

Celestia shook her head. "Sorry, you know how I am. Are we ready to give this a try?"

"Hold on," Twilight said. "We're going to need everything you've got for this. You need to be mentally and physically peaked to do this. You need to consume energy and expend it."

Celestia looked ready to dance. "So you're saying we need to eat?"

"The more the better," Twilight said.

Luna looked mortified for a moment. "You had to say that, didn't you?"

"Ooh, ooh, let's get them to make that quiche, and those wonderful spinach wraps, and it wouldn't be a meal without White Winds heavenly cookies..." Celestia trailed of as she waddled to the dining hall. White Wind bounced behind her and Twilight followed as well.

"I'll have the quiche..." Luna droned.

--

Twilight had heard of animals that ate their weight in food between a weekly and daily bases. Celestia's gluttony seemed to have matched them, if not surpass it.

"Harmph, omn, yum, ooooohhh, cream puffs, how I have missed you." Celestia popped puff after puff into her mouth while servant surrounded her with more food. Twilight hardly believe it as she watched Celestia actually accumulate fat before her very eyes. She grew like a sponge soaking up the meal and converting it straight to jiggling blubber. Twilight enjoyed the sight far more than she would readily admit.

Luna seemed a little frustrated with the situation, but was smiling all the same. Celestia was enjoying herself and that was all Luna could ask for. Well, no, she did want to ask her to stop, but that wouldn't be fair. She nibbled on her own meal and merely enjoyed her sisters happiness.

White Wind was obviously enjoying this as much as Celestia was. He hoof fed Celestia whenever Celestia wasn't feeding herself, which was most of the time because of her decadent demeanor. Whenever nopony was looking, he's sneak up behind her and hug her glorious growing butt. Celestia's eyes widened in surprise the first time, but the loved the feeling of being squeezed so tenderly. They both felt hot and giddy as she grew beneath his hold.

Many hours later and the castle was once more out of food. Celestia's face was covered with sauces and chocolate that she struggled to lick off. White Wind was on her back... or maybe her neck fat, it was hard to tell, and was wiping of her face with his hoof and sticking it in her mouth to suck on.

Twilight was baffled by Celestia's less than regal behavior. "Wow. I'm not sure what to say."

Luna pulled Twilight close and whispered to her. "I understand that this is most uncouth, but let her enjoy herself. She's been ruler of this land longer than most can comprehend. She deserves to be happy."

Twilight nodded. "I know, I know. It's just... this isn't like the Celestia I imagined as a filly, or even the one I grew up with. She's more (and I can't believe I'm saying this), natural. Her happy face looks so real."

Luna smiled. "Thanks for understanding."

Celestia belched loud enough to rattle all the dishes around her. "Well, urp, all the food gone. I'm ready."

"But still not full," White Wind added after sliding down Celestia's cascading fat. He poked at her belly and made her ripple.

"Of course not. That's why we're doing this. Bring me the scroll." Luna and Celestia looked over the spell. "All right I'm ready."

"I as well," Luna said. The sisters stared at a slice of cake and an empty plate next to it. "If this work, and exact replica of this cake should appear."

"Mmhh, strawberry," Celestia said. "Let's do it."

Twilight stood nearby by with notes to document this historic moment. White Wind Watched in anticipation as their horns began to glow.

There was an amazing flash and...
154222122122211.title: "Let's get started on the spell."

choices: Later, Luna was feeling hungrier than usual...
Later, they decide to celebrate their breakthrough.
1542221221222111.content:
...Sort of!

Luna stared in disbelief at what lay on the table: a two-layer strawberry cake (courtesy of sugarcube corner) sat on the plate, completely indestinguishable from the original, albiet paler in color, the top layer was half missing, and the whole thing looked ready to collapse under its own weight. Twilight Sparkle began furiously scribbling down notes about this momentous occasion, while Celestia pulled White Wind into her flabby embrace.

I... I do'nt belive it." Luna whispered "We've successfully managed to create something from magic." Twilight Sparkle, meanwhile was babbling to herself about different formulas and how more matter could be made from less energy and whatnot. Celestia scooped them all into a massive, flabby group hug. "Oh I knew we could do it!" she cried ecstatically. She and Luna suddenly felt fatigue hit them like a barrel of bricks heavier than the sun alicorn herself, said princess then promptly passed out and, luckily for everypony else, fell over on her back, causing another marequake and her huge body to jiggle for several seconds before finally settling. Luna passed out as well, sinking into her sister's fat with a contented sigh.

Twilight and White carefully pried themselves from Celestia's grasp and stood before the table. "Can you believe it?" Twilight asked quietly, "We've managed to create matter from energy!"

"I'm standing right here and I can hardly believe it." White Wind replied. He was actually starting to get giddy with the possibilities they had just opened up, he imagined Celestia surrounded by conjured food that was flowing into her mouth at a constant rate, a myriad of flavors passing her tongue and filling her stomach. Just growing bigger and bigger and bigger... "Um, White?" He was abruptly yanked from his fantasy by Twilight, who was standing in front of the table, looking at the replicated cake with fascination.

"Come check this out will you? White Wind trotted over to the table and peered at the cake, it had indeed collapsed in the recent tremor and slumped in a heap, it did not look quite as appetizing as its template. Twilight carefully scooped up a glob of copied pastry and took a bite. "The icing tastes watered down, the cake itself is like vanilla flavored paste and the filling tastes like underripe strawberries." She said with a sour look on her face. "But it's actually quite filling." She returned to her notepad and hotter down some more notes. "I'll have to research this further, but the recent events seem to have drained me." With that the lavender unicorn climbed onto her mentor's vast belly and fell asleep. White could do nothing more than the same, but not without trying some of the replicated cake first, it tasted exactly hoe Twilight described it, and it was indeed very filling. He then climbed up his marefriend's folds, snuggled into her jowls, and fell asleep.
1542221221222111.title: It actually worked!

choices: They keep trying for that spell.
1542221221222112.content:
... and there was nothing. Well, not quite nothing. There was an explosion and a good deal of scorch marks left on the table and all ponies were blown back. But, as Twilight poked her snout over the table's edge, she could see that there definitely wasn't a new slice of cake.

Twilight sighed. "Sorry, Princess. I'm not sure if it was an error I made or lack of power, but it didn't work."

Luna coughed and pulled herself back up. "Experience is experience, Twilight. We'll simply have to try again some other time."

"Not to interrupt a moment," White Wind said as he pointed at Celestia, "but we have a slight problem."

Luna and Twilight looked over at the mass of pony that was Celestia and they both stifled a giggle at the sight of her grand rear end. Her legs kicked uselessly as she struggled to get into a position where she could move. Her fat, however, would not let her roll to either side. She reminded all present of a turtle trying to get up from its own back.

"A little help, please?" Celestia whined a sweetly as she could. It was now, as she tried to see her valuable friend, sister, and lover in the room that she realized her own size. Her blubbery body prevented her from seeing most of the room and all she could see was her own fat. Celestia shuddered a little at how vast she was, and images of her growing larger filled her mind. She realized, if she succeeded in her quest and couldn't make herself full, she might eat herself into a castle size immobile blob.

She also realized that she looked forward to the feeling.

"Come now, sister, I know you've become rather slug like, but you can't be lazy enough to use your magic to lift yourself back up."

"Ugh... I can't. I'm out of magic. Used it all up for the spell that didn't work."

Luna rolled her eyes. "Really, you couldn't of-" Luna began but paused. She looked up at her own own with an expression of worry. "I'm... I'm out as well."

Twilight began to sweat. "Uh, no offense, Celestia, but I don't think I have it in me to lift you with my power."

Celestia waved a hoof, though only White Wind saw it past her fat. "None taken. I have gotten a bit too big for my britches, haven't I? I'll just have to wait here until I recharge." She sighed and she expanded outward about half an inch. "Oop, leftovers. Would you mind keeping me company, everypony? It can get lonely stuck on the flo- oof!" White Wind had already hopped up on her and nuzzled her jowls. Twilight climbed up and giggled at the sensation of laying on her teacher's belly. Luna kicked off her shoes with a laugh and climbed up her sister as well. There was just enough of Celestia for the three of them to sit comfortably.

"If somepony told me a month ago that I'd be sitting on my sister's stomach having tea time on top of her, I'd have sent them to a hospital for fear of their own mind."

"Tea?" Twilight said right before a cup of the brew appeared before her.

White Wind smiled. "I came prepared for this."

"You were prepared for Celestia blasting herself back and becoming immobile on the floor?" Twilight said. "You're even better at planning than I am."

White Wind chuckled. "Not quite. I was prepared for the spell failing. Scones, anypony?" A plate of the biscuits floated past them. Luna took one with her hoof.

"It is unfortunate you are but one pony," Luna said after she swallowed a bite. "I can see how my Sister would grow ever larger under the influence of your cooking."

White Wind blushed. "You flatter me, princess." He bent closer to Celestia's head and magically lowered a scone and a cup to her mouth. "Hungry, darling?"

"It's not not nice to tease," Celestia said playfully. She took a sip and a bite and sighed contentedly. "Good thing you were ready for the inevitable failure. I knew there was a reason I kept you around." She opened her mouth wide and let two scones be pushed in.

"Well, that was a bust," Twilight said. "And idea what we should do now."

"Vere's mo may I'm witting," Celestia said through her full mouth.

"I didn't think you were," Luna sighed. "I'm telling you, this isn't going to work. Plus, look at all the food you just ate. If we try this again, it won't be for some time."

"A point about that, actually," Twilight said. "I think you might not have had enough time to convert the food into energy. We probably should have waited longer."

"I was too eager, you mean," Celestia said dejectedly.

"That is what happens when you are a greedy not-so-little piggy," White Wind replied.

Celestia laughed. "I'll have to know that I fit into my dresses just fine, thank you."

"You mean those curtains you were wearing?" White said back.

Celestia blushed and giggled. "I'd appreciate you not mentioning what we do alone in my bedroom, you cad."

Twilight laughed. "Get me a picture, I'd love to see Celestia wearing a curtain to a ball."

Luna rolled her eyes. "Sometimes I wonder who is really the little sister in this relationship."

White Wind slapped Celestia's stomach. "I think that's pretty obvious." They all laughed for another minute or so.

When they settled down, Luna took another bite. "In all seriousness, you can really cook, White. Why are you a palace guard and not a chef?"

White Wind blushed, magicking his armor off himself and setting in on the ground. This revealed a cutie mark in the shape of a wooden spoon and a sword crossed together.

"Technically I am both. I found that cooking was my call, but so is protection. A friend of mine was being bullied while I was baking and I went to his aid. I valiantly used my spoon and the batter to drive the nasty colt off. Afterwords we had peanut butter cookies, and I had a cutie mark."

"A multi-talent," Twilight said. "Usually you see vague talents and not ones so specific."

"I was the chef for the barracks for a while and they loved me, but I took too long for the food and had to serve too many for it to be a reasonable job. So I settled for guard. I cannot complain, since I have the goddess of beauty as the softest bed in Equestria."

Celestia pulled White Wind into a hug. "Flattery will get you everywhere. And three quarters of a ton of mare on top of you."

Luna laughed. "I'm surprised that Celestia can be so paitient if you meals take time."

"I resent that," Celestia said with a silly edge. "I am perfectly capable of waiting for White's amazing food. I'm not that much of a slob." They all felt their resting place rumble and jiggle beneath them. "I wish I didn't have to, though," she added. Another scone floated into her mouth. "Mmhh, so good."

"Don't worry," Luna said. "Somehow, someway, I'll get you to have the satisfaction of being full."

"I'm a little worried, though," Twilight said. "What if her status as an alicorn and the mover of the sun makes it so she can't feel full?"

All their eyes widened.

"If that's the case," Twilight continued, "All the food in Equestria wouldn't make her full."

"I hadn't thought of that..." Celestia said. White Wind looked at her sympathetically.

"If that's the case," Luna said, "then we'll stop when we get there. A ton? Two tons? It won't matter if we haven't even found a way to fuel her hunger."

Celestia had a few tears forming in her eyes. "Thank you for being so understanding, Luna."

"It's just what sister do. Personally, I even a sister that I can use as a bed." Luna looked out the window. "It's almost time for me to raise the moon. You'll just have to sleep here for the night."

"Don't worry," Celestia said slyly. "We'll set up a day when you can sleep on me."

Luna blushed. "Um, ah... Am I so transparent?"

Celestia giggled. "Call it sister's intuition. I know how comfy I am, Luna. You can even come back when you're done and we can have a sleep over on me tonight."

"Yay!" Twilight cheered as she clapped her hooves. "I'm great at ghost stories."

"Grab a fold and get comfy, then, because I know ghost stories as old as Equestria."

They each giggled and Luna went off, feeling her magic start to return. She pondered the issue of Celestia's monster apatite and wished she had more candy from Nightmare Night to give her. Luna shrugged and went off, deciding it was best to worry about it some other time.

15422212212221122.content:
Luna panted as she allowed herself to fall to the ground in a heap. "Hoo... just barely made that. I need some sugar." Luna retreated into her room, panting from the exhaustion of having to raise the moon with so little magic.

She reached a chest a opened it, revealing her secret stash of goodies. "Ahh, Nightmare Night, if there's one thing you do for me, it's give me something sweet to eat." She reached in and grabbed a hoofful of the teeth rotting candy and closed the chest.

Her mind wandered to the fact that the chest held just one town's worth of offerings to her as Nightmare Moon. It was enough to fill a pretty sizable chest. If she had visited every town in Equestria on Nightmare Night, she wouldn't know what she'd do with it all.

Luna's eyes widened and she dropped the chocolate bar she was about to eat. If all those ponies made enough food, it would never fit in the castle. If every pony made something, there's be miles and miles of things to eat, more than one pony could dream.

The dark Alicorn grinned and laughed. "Oh, sister of mine, prepare yourself for a meal you will never forget. If you aren't full after this then there is no hope to be had." Luna ran off to inform the palace and get her plan in motion.

--

It was a week after the first indecent with the failed spell, and not a whole lot of progress had been made. Naturally, Luna wasn't going to let Celestia binge, especially since she had obciously gone from half a ton to who knew how much now. Still, Celestia enjoyed herself very much. She and Twilight would pretend she was that giant Alicorn while she was a little fill, safe in the giant mare's hug. She and White Wind would enjoy meals in the garden, talking of this and that and their love, doing the things that ponies in love tended to do. And she found her larger self all the more appealing, a self pampering form that made her feel relaxed and whole.

Secretly, White Wind and Twilight knew of Luna's plan. Twilight was doing a lot of work to get things going, but White Wind had his own part that was very important.

Celestia was laying in the garden with White Wind at her side, enjoting her own reflection of the bollowing mare that stared back. "Do you think it's wrong that I like staring at myself?" Celestia asked.

White smiled. "I am not exactly the pony to ask. You will find that I am biased."

Celestia giggled. "Fair enough. Still, I wonder why I find my blubbery self so appealing. I sometime wonder what it would be like to just eat and grow right out of the castle."

Celestia grinned to herself as White shivered in anticipation. White playfully swatted his mare's fat. "You teasing cow. You know my opinion already."

Celestia wobbled, forgetting that she could no longer shrug. "Maybe." She frowned at her reflection. "I've been thinking, though..."

"About?"

"My fat, my eating, my growing. At, of course, you."

White Wind patiently listened.

"Secretly, White... I find myself wanting to grow. I want to be bigger and fatter, until the only thing I can do is use my magic. To just laze around, basking in the glow of my sun. And even then, when I'm a blob of a pony, I just keep eating and growing anyway. Am I selfish? Am I disgusting?"

White Wing climbed up Celestia's neck folds and gave her a passionate kiss. "Celestia, I'll love you no matter what. My love for you runs deeper than your body. And, besides that, this just sounds better to me."

"But that's the problem," Celestia said. "What will I be at such a massive size? Can I still make ponies happy? And what about you? You're my tiny little pony now, but by then, you'll be a speck. There's no way we'll be able to do anything together, especially if..."

White Wind raised a brow. "If?"

"If we want children."

White Wind felt ready to explode. "Celestia... are you really thinking of giving me that honor?"

Celestia sniffled. "I've never felt this way about anypony. But I don't want you trap you with a mare that can't do anything, especially when we can't even make love together. We can barely do it now. And then there's the fact that I'll out live you, and if we wanted children-" Celestia was cut off as White Wind pressed his lips against hers.

He pulled back, massaging her jowl. "Worry not, my great big pony. I will always be here for you. If you desire to be fed until all you can do is wiggle your nose, then I shall feed you so."

Celestia had tears in her eyes as she nuzzled him. "I'm being silly, anyway. It's not like I can have all that food anyway."

"Oh, can't you?" Luna said. Celestia, finally used to her large mass, turned her whole body around to face her sister, who looked ready to collapse. "I have done it, my dearest sister. I have prepared a feast to end all feasts. If this doesn't satisfy you, nothing will!" Luna stood on her hind legs and flailed wildly.

Celestia blinked. "Luna, are you alright?"

"You may want to calm down," White Wind added.

Luna took a breath and got back on her legs. "Oh, yes, excuse me. I've been without sleep for the past few days. But it shall be worth it!" Luna tugged at Celestia fat leg. "Come, come, you must eat. A gluttonous, food filled life awaits you."

"Luna, what are you talking about?" Celestia asked, obviously worried but intrigued. White Wind only chuckled, letting Luna do what she wanted. "Did you got the spell working?"

"Not even close," Luna said as danced a little. "A thought occurred to me a while ago. I have a night in which ponies give unto me piles of sugary delights, all because I bring the night and give them a scare.But what about you? There isn't a holiday to celebrate you and all you do for Equestria. Sure, we have the Summer Sun Celebration, but that's just for the sun, not you. So I decided; we need a knew holiday."

Celestia tried to let her jaw to drop, but it was quite difficult against her chins. "You started a new holiday? For me?"

"And everypony came!" Luna cheered. "To celebrate the wonderful, mother-like mare that raises that sun. To celebrate the bounty your wisdom brings, the ponies have decided to give some back. So the ponies of Equestria have come togather and they each have brought you a meal."

Celestia blinked a drool started to drip from her mouth. Her stomach rumbled, her body jiggling in excitement "D-did you just say... everypony in Equestria brought me a meal?"

Luna zapped them with her magic, and the next thing Celestia knew she was on a grand platform at the base of the mountain Canterlot stuck out of. Ponies as far a celestia could see, cheering for you, carrying packages of hot meals and desserts. Her nose was hit with the scents of a thousand home cooked dinners and she loudly rumbled again. More than that, though, she heard her ponies cheer and saw their smiles.

Celestia began sobbing.

"Th-these ponies c-came... just to f-feed me?" Celestia cried. She had never thought her subjects loved her so much, to come all this way just to bring her food, despite the absurdity of it, despite that fact that she was now a blubber ball.

"They did!" Twilight said as she ran up to her teacher. "Let me introduce you to the first Solar Siesta! A day where we celebrate the wise princess who's led us all these years. They each brought you something to eat and want to give you a hug." She blushed. "I hope you like it."

Celestia grabbed Twilight, White Wind, and Luna in a hug and tried her best to absolutely smother them. "Oh, oh, my ponies." She began kissing them each on the cheek. "My ponies. My wonderful, blessed ponies. How could I ever thank you?"

"Eat!" Luna said as she pulled away. She cleared her throat, then shouted in her Royal Canterlot Voice, "We thank you for coming, ponies of Equestria, and showing Celestia your love. Celestia will be ready to eat for meals and will grow accordingly with your love. You may gather around her and show her your love, but be careful, as she will get massive.

Celestia laughed. "You say that as if you know so."

Luna pulled out a chocolate bar and stuffed it into Celestia's mouth, earning a moan. "I most certainly do."

White Wind gave Celestia a passionate but quick kiss, sharing the chocolate with her. "I'll have a special present set up for you later, by great big pony. I'll see you later." White Wind and Luna walked away, while Twilight stayed to regulate the ponies that advanced. With a surprising amount of decorum, the ponies began to bring her meals ranging from the simple to the elegant. And all of them, young or old, classy or country, gave Celestia a hug as she ate. And Celestia made sure to hug each and every one of them back and to tell them how much she loved them.

And as she ate, Celestia grew. It wasn't long before she ballooned passed a ton, and she just kept going, growing more pounds, more blob like, and more happy with every bite she took...
