1552221.title: Runs in the family!

15522211.content:
Both Sweetie and Scootaloo were waiting the Apple Bloom to arrive at the CMC clubhouse. They were sitting at the table outside discussing different schemes for getting their cutie marks. Some of the ideas were ridiculous others made a little sense.

"Ugh, I can't decide," Scootaloo groaned, " I wish Apple Bloom would show up already. We need her opinion on what we should do. Did she tell you when she was going to show up, Sweetie."

"She said that she would be here this morning. Maybe she got stuck doing chores?"

" I'm here," Apple Bloom shouted, "Granny slowed me down a little bit. I also forgot to eat breakfast before I left, can we talk about our plans at Sugarcube Corner. I'm really hungry."

"That sounds good, lets go!" Scootaloo replied.

         The CMC, particularly Apple Bloom, eat a filling breakfast of pastries. "Uuurrrp, that was good. I don't think I could take another bite." Apple Bloom patted her slightly distended belly. "So what plans have you two come up with for this summer?"

         Sweetie pulled a piece of paper out of her saddle bag. "Well we made this list of things to try. Scootaloo's ideas were circus performers, stuntponies, and bakers. My ideas I got are mostly from an art book that Rarity uses for inspiration. They are painters, sculptures, pottery makers, and bakers.

"Wait you both chose bakers?"

" Eh, I couldn't think of anything else, so I put bakers at the end of my list just so that I had more than two activities to choose from."

"Baking was in Rarity's book under culin.... cu... ugh cooking arts, Also you already have some experience with baking, so I figured that it would give us an advantage."

         "Well circus and stuntpony sounds dangerous, and I think we already did painters once before. I do know a little bit about baking. I know! Granny has got tons of books on baking. I know she would let us borrow them. We can make the recipes from the books and add our own ideas for ingredients then get somepony to taste test them for us."

         "That's a great idea", Sweetie replied, "but who are we going to get to be our taste tester". "I think Apple Bloom should do it", Scootaloo answered," She does know more about baking than we do. Plus she can eat more then either Sweetie or I combined can."

"Are you calling me fat, Scootaloo."

"No no, you just have a bigger appetite we do. Heck you won a junior eating contest at the fair last year."

"Well when you put it that way, I guess it makes sense. Alright I'll be the taste tester."

With their decision made, The CMC went back to the Apple Farm.
15522211.title: Meet Sweetie and Scootaloo at the clubhouse.

155222111.content:
The Apple family kitchen was a mess. A direct result of the CMCs attempts at baking. There was cake batter spilled out all over the table, flour on the floor, and cookie dough littering various places. Despite the mess, the three fillies managed to create the confections correctly, or at least almost correctly would be a better way to describe them.

"There we go, the cookies are done." Scootaloo says confidently, "Here you go Apple Bloom, give these a taste."

          "Ok, here we go." Apple Bloom takes one cookie and stuffs it in her mouth. After chewing for a few seconds, her eye's dilate. "Oh my gosh, Scoots these are really good. There nice and gooey in the center. They're a little burnt on the edges, but they still taste great." Apple Bloom eats another one, two, three, four more for good measure.

"Glad you like em, AB. Now you need to try Sweetie's cake."

"Hold on a second I got to........"
155222111.title: Cutie Mark Crusaders Bakers, YAY!

choices: Stashes the rest of the cookies and fritters in her room.
Shares the remaining treats with her family.
1552221112.content:
"Save the rest of these cookies for later." Apple Bloom places a cloth over the plate of cookies and sets it aside. "I'm gonna have to eat these sometime soon", She though to herself. "Ok, now for Sweeties cake." Apple Bloom eyed the vanilla cake up and down. There were thin apple slices on the edges and center of the cake, and it was covered in a butter-cream frosting.

"I hope it came out alright," Stweetie said with a bit of trepidation.

         Apple Bloom took her first bite then her second and then her third. Tasting the cake from different sections. She started with and corner section then moved to the center. She then devours the rest of the 6 x 6 inch cake. Savoring every bite. "Sweetie, this is great. The extra apple slices you added really add to the taste."

"Well, all that is left now is the fritters that you make, AB", Scoots said.

"Oh, I kinda made those for you girls. I've make fritters before, and they are really easy to make. Go on, eat as many as you want."

"Um, its actually time for me to head home", Sweetie replied, "my mom should be making dinner by now."

"Yeah, I actually ate a lot of my cookie dough. I'm not hungry right now. I should also head home too."

"Well ok then, wanna do this again tomorrow? I bet if we keep at this. We will definitely get out cutie marks in baking."

"Sure," Scootaloo responded.

"Of course, this was so much fun", Sweetie replied as she and Scootaloo stepped out the from door of the Apple family home.

         After her friends had left, Apple Bloom cleaned up the mess in a kitchen with the help of Granny. "I wonder what I should do with the left over treats? I could stash em in my room to eat later or share em."
1552221112.title: Save the rest for later.

choices: Apple Bloom eats the treats in the middle of the night.
Apple Bloom saves the treat for tomorrow.
15522211121.content:
"I'm gonna hide the rest in my room and eat them later tonight. Now I got to get ready for dinner. Good thing I got such a big appetite, I still have room in my belly for dinner." Apple Bloom though to herself. She gathers the last of the treats and hid them in her nightstand. After a short bath and grooming, she went down stairs to eat dinner with her family.

"So how was the baking?" Apple Jack asked, "I could smell it all the way out in the barn."

"It was alright. Scootaloo made some cookies, but some of them got burnt. Sweetie made a tiny cake that was great. By the way, thanks for letting us use you recipe books, Granny."

"Yer welcome, honey."

         The rest of the evening, Apple Bloom spent with her brother and sister. They played a couple board games and talked about there days. "I think, I'm gonna go to bed. Today wore me out."
15522211121.title: Stashes the rest of the cookies and fritters in...

155222111211.content:
Apple Bloom pretended to sleep for a few hours. When she was sure everypony had gone to bed she got out of her bed and opened her nightstand. The treats within soon found themselves inside Apple Bloom's belly. Across the room, Apple Bloom could see her reflection in the dresser's mirror. Despite the low light in the room, she noticed that she was slightly bigger than she was before. Her belly seemed to have gained an inch of fat. Her now wobbly flanks and butt seemed to have gotten half an inch thicker. Her checks were more puffy, and the beginnings of a second chin were visible under her regular chin.

"Wow, did I really gain that much after one day of pigging out?"

         Apple Bloom put a hoof to her larger belly and felt how squishy it was. She could feel her flanks wobble with her step. It tickled a bit. She stepped closer to the mirror. She touched her chubby checks and second chin. The soft flesh was plushy and jiggled when she shook her head. She enjoyed the new found softness. Apple Bloom had always been a big filly, maybe some extra weight wouldn't be too bad.

         Apple Bloom hatched a plan to gain more weight. She would encourage her friends to keep baking. As long as, they kept trying to earn cutie marks in baking she would have access to whatever treats they make. Also, she would make more stops to Sugarcube Corner. The treats there was always tasty, inexpensive, and fattening.

         With her plan decided, Apple Bloom went back to bed. She was eager for the next day to arrive.
155222111211.title: Apple Bloom eats the treats in the middle of th...

1552221112112.content:
The last 3 days had preceded exactly has well as Apple Bloom had hoped they would. Sweetie and Scootaloo had indeed continued getting better at baking. They baked treats from the book and a few of their own making, and were meet with moderate success. At the rate they were improving, they probably would get cutie marks in baking.
          Apple Bloom saw a change on herself as well. Within these few days she had added several more inches of fat to her body. Her belly hung three inches lower and jiggled when she walked or trotted. Her two inch thicker butt and flanks wobbled with every movement she made. The small second chin was now very prominent, and her cheeks had gone from puffy to chipmunk status. Even her legs had received some extra padding.
         Apple Bloom had gone over to Scootaloo's and Sweetie Belle's homes but neither of them could hang out today. So that left Apple Bloom feeling incredibly bored. "What am I gonna do today? AJ and Big Mac are off doing stuff in town and Granny is meeting with some of her old time friends later." Apple Bloom pondered in her boredom for a few minutes. "Well I did get my allowance yesterday. I could go spend it on treats at Sugarcube Corner, or i could go to the market stalls. There usually funnel cake or deep fried treats at the market.
         Apple Bloom only needed to think on this for a minute. She began her trek to.......
1552221112112.title: Three days later.

15522211121122.content:
Apple Bloom had decided to walk through the market stalls specifically the food stalls. Typically the food stalls had all kinds of foods ranging from exotic to fair foods.
She could smell things like funnel cake, fried mini-cakes like Hooftess or Little Filly, and pie. Her first stop was a candy stand. Then a stall that made funnel cakes. Her next place was a stall that sold lots of different fried foods.
                                                                                                                        ----
         "*Uuurrap*. Ah this day has been great.", Apple Bloom say while rubbing her distended belly. She had been to every market food stall. She had eaten four funnel cakes, two and a half pies, four bags of cotton candy, and two bags of assorted fried mini-cakes. "Too bad there wasn't much variety today. I would have liked to try some different stuff. Oh well", she said as she heaved herself back to her hooves. "Whew, with all that food I ate I'm sure to put on some pounds."
         Apple Bloom began waddling her way back home. "I had better get home soon. Dinner will be ready in a few hours." During her walk home, she really felt the effects of her new weight. Her butt jiggled and her full belly swayed back and forth. "Wow, walking sure is different now. Its like my backside has a mind of it own. Being this heavy sure feels odd, but I like it." She continued her slow waddle back home, and to the dinner that awaited her there.
15522211121122.title: Market stalls

155222111211222.content:
After a very filling dinner, Apple Bloom could feel herself falling asleep. "I'm gonna go take a bath then go to bed." While in the bathroom, she was able to see her expanded body in the mirror. Apple Bloom had definitely gained weight from her visit to the market. Her barrel was another inch and a half wider and hung half and inch lower. It stuck out to the side so much that she looked like she was carrying saddle bags. Her second chin was larger, and her chubby cheeks made her squint a little.The biggest difference was her flanks and butt. Her flanks and butt now an extra inch bigger plus an inch wider were forming rolls at her hocks. Her thick legs had rolls forming at her knees.
         "Oh my gosh, I've gotten so big. I may need to start taking it easy on the sweets. I'm trying to gain weight, but its not even a week into summer vacation yet.
Ok, time to curb my eating some. I can still gain weight, but I need to slow it down." With the decision made Apple Bloom went to bed.
155222111211222.title: After dinner.

choices: She runs into somepony she knows on the way.
1552221112112222.content:
The previous few weeks were filled with fun and activities for the CMC. Sweetie and Scoots did still practice their baking a few times with Apple Bloom being the taste tester, naturally. The CMC tried some of the other activities as well which was fun, but they still didn't get their cutie marks. Sweetie Belle was going on a trip with her parents tomorrow. Scootaloo was going to Junior Wonderbolts camp as well. Both of them would be gone for the rest of summer. Apple Bloom wasn't happy about this. When not around her friends or family, Apple Bloom just thought food and eating.

"Its gonna be so boring after you two leave. I wish I could go at least one of you."

" I know, I wish you could come to, but its only till the end of summer. It isn't like we are moving away", Sweetie replied.

"Ah, we will be back before you know it, AB", Scoots responded.

The CMC spent the rest of the day hanging out and enjoying each others company. Until that moment when they had to say good bye for a short time.

---

The next day.


         The following morning Apple Bloom blearily looked at herself in the mirror. She had gained more weight over the last two weeks. Her barrel had grown 3 inches bigger and was lightly pressing into her legs. The jiggling rolls on her legs were more prominent. Her cheeks had thickened and made her squint quite a bit. Her plush neck and front was covered in four inches of doughy fat. She turned to the side so she could get a better look at her massive butt and flanks which had swelled another two inches. Both wobbled as she turned. Apple Bloom was a very fat filly now, yet she knew that she was going to get even bigger before summer was over.

         "Wow, I've gotten really fat. Chores are going to be a lot harder to do now. Apple Jack will probably try to put me on a diet too. Like it would matter, I will just gain it all back. Wonder what I should do today?", Apple Bloom mulled over this for a few minutes. "Ugh now I can't stop thinking of food." Her belly growled. "Well I guess I can't think on a empty stomach. Time to go get some breakfast."

          Apple Bloom lumbered her way down stairs. She noticed that Granny and Apple Jack were absent from the table. "Big Mac, where Granny and AJ?", she asked.
"They had to leave for Auntie Golden Delicious' farm. They're having some problems with a fungus damaging their orchard.", Big Mac replied, "If you want some breakfast I can make you something." Apple Bloom responded, "Nah, don't worry about it. I'll just go the Sugarcube Corner."

With that decided Apple Bloom left for Sugarcube Corner.
1552221112112222.title: 2 weeks later.

15522211121122221.content:
Breakfast at Sugarcube Corner was not what Apple Bloom needed. She knew that being there was a mistake, yet there she was. Apple Bloom had only been at Sugarcube Corner for ten minutes and already on her eighth doughnut. She had ordered one dozen doughnuts and chocolate milk. It wouldn't be nearly enough to satisfy her. Apple Blooms appetite was a combination of hunger and boredom. Until recently she never had a problem with overeating because she had friends and family to occupy her. Now that she had neither of those things food was the substitute. She could go hang with her brother, but he would be working right now. She didn't like to bother Big Mac when he was working especially when the farm is short handed. She didn't even have chores at the farm to do. Apple Bloom's chores had been split between Apple Jack and Big Mac due to her weight slowing her down. Neither of them minded really, they did it out of concern for Apple Bloom. They were more afraid of her overexerting or hurting herself rather than her not getting them done.

         Apple Bloom finished off the last of her doughnuts. Her belly growled still. "I'm still hungry. I got plenty of bits. Another dozen wouldn't hurt." Apple Bloom stood up and waddled over to the counter. "I'd like another dozen, please." Mrs. Cake smiled at Apple Bloom, and gave her another box of a dozen doughnuts. "Here you go Apple Bloom. It's on the house today. Come back up for more if you want. Somepony canceled a big catering order this mourning", Mrs cake said. "More doughnuts for free?"Apple Bloom thought," I really shouldn't be eating what I got now, but I can more for free. Well my diet today was already ruined once i stepped in here. No reason to stop the feast now."

         Apple Bloom inhaled the second dozen faster than the first. As she stood up from her chair, it made an audible creak. She ignored it. Mrs. Cake saw Apple Bloom approach the counter again. "How many this time, sweetie?" She asked. "I'd like two dozen this time, Mrs Cake," Apple Bloom replied,"and some more chocolate milk to, please." Mrs. Cake gave her the doughnuts and milk, and watched as Apple Bloom waddled back over to her seat. When she sat down the chair creaked again. Apple Bloom ignored the sound. She gobbled down one sugary doughnut after another. Stopping only to get a breath or drink some milk. After devouring all but two of the remaining doughnuts, Apple Bloom was feeling really full. She slowly picked up both of the doughnuts with her fatty legs, and ate both of them at once. Then chased them with the last of her chocolate milk.

         Apple Blooms breakfast had left her completely stuffed. She leaned back in the groaning chair and rubbed her distended belly. She could almost feel herself getting fatter as she sat there. "Forty-eight," she thought, "I ate forty-eight doughnuts and drank probably a quart of chocolate milk. It's gonna take a while for this to digest." Her belly was gurgling and grumbling, but at least it wasn't growling. Apple Bloom fell asleep in the chair and awoke two hours later still in Sugarcube Corner. Groggy from her food coma, she raises herself out of the strained chair, and nearly topples over due to her new weight. Before leaving, Apple Bloom caught a good look at her reflection in one of the display cases.

         She was huge.It wasn't just her cheeks that were thicker. It almost looked like her entire face had puffed up, and what looked like a third chin was growing below the second one. Her neck and chest had packed on an inch of fat. Folds had formed where her chest met with her upper leg. The rolls on her fat laden legs were bulging more than before. Her barrel had a new inch thick layer of fat, hung just a few inches above the ground, and squished into her legs. Her vast flanks and butt had grown two inches thicker the latter of which sagged greatly. Her flanks were half the width of the door and wobbled so much that even waddling was tiring.

         Despite how big she was now, Apple Bloom could only think. "I'm bored. Should I go home or walk err waddle around town for a while?"
15522211121122221.title: Sugarcube Corner

155222111211222212.content:
"Well there isn't much happening at the farm. I've gotten too fat to do chores anyway. I guess I'll wander around ponyville for a while", Apple Bloom though out loud. She began her slow waddle around town. After walking around for about thirty minutes, a delicious smell wafted past her nose. Her belly growled loudly. "Quiet, you. I'm gonna find out where its coming from. So just be patient," she said to her stomach.

         Apple Bloom followed the scent to a back ally until she entered what looked like a small courtyard. Tucked in the corner of the courtyard was a old style brick oven. She stepped closer to the oven to get a closer look at what was baking inside. There were muffins inside, a lot of muffins. On a table a few feet away there were even more muffins. "If there is all these muffins around that must mean that this is Ditzy's backyard." She was right, As if on que, Ditzy walked into the yard. "Oh, hi Apple Bloom," Ditzy said. "Heya, Ms. Ditzy, sorry I just walked in here. I could smell the muffins baking", Apple Bloom responded. Her belly growled loudly again. Apple Blooms face turned bright red. Ditzy replied,"Its ok. Sounds like your hungry. Would you like some muffins?" "Boy, do I ever!" was Apple Blooms answer. "Help yourself, there is plenty to go around,"said Ditzy.

         Muffins were much more filling than doughnuts, but Apple Bloom was able to ingest sixteen of them before she was full. "Ah, thanks for the muffins Ms. Ditzy. They were so good," said Apple Bloom while patting her gurgling stomach. "You're welcome Apple Bloom. A growing girls has to eat," responded Ditzy followed by and awkward laugh. "How did she eat so many of those muffins?" Ditzy thought. Apple Bloom just sat back on her massive backside. "I may need to take a nap after that," she said," I feel another food coma coming on. Do you mind if take a nap here Ditzy?" "Not at all go right ahead." Ditzy replied. The grass tickled Apple Blooms belly as she waddled over to a particularly soft section of the yard. She quickly dozed off. Her one hour nap was filled with dreams of eating and food. When she awoke there was a plate with four muffins on it which she ate hastily. Apple Bloom slowly rose onto her hooves, which had been getting harder for her to do lately. She walked unsteadily back onto the main road.With each step her body quaked. It was getting more difficult just to keep her balance. She looked at the clock tower. "Hmm, it's only three 'o' clock. No need to go home yet."

         Apple Bloom continued her walk until she reached the park. Feeling short of breath, she decided to find the nearest bench and sit down. "I *huff* need to find someplace to sit. *puff* There's a small bench," She said only to herself. Just seconds after sitting down, the bench broke under her massive weight. "What the hay!" said Apple Bloom as she tumbled onto her back. She squirmed in an attempt to get back on her hooves. After about 5 minutes, she managed to turn over and stand back up. "Geez, have I really gotten that heavy? Nah, must have been an old bench."

"You ok, Apple Bloom?" asked a voice that Apple Bloom recognized as Twist.

"Yeah I'm fine. Thanks for asking."

"Good, actually I'm glad that you are here. I heard from you were taste testing treats from Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo. I was wondering if you wanted to come taste test some of my families treats?"

"Um sure, I'm not really doing anything right now."

"Great," Twist said excitedly, "they are over this way."

         Apple Bloom was shocked to see at least twenty ponies gathered around four picnic tables. "That's your family?!" she asked. "Yep that's all of them," Twist replied," They live all across Equestria, but always gather together at this time of year to sample new treat recipes." Twist ran down to one of the tables while Apple Bloom hobbled behind her.

"Mom, can Apple Bloom join us for the afternoon?" Twist asked her mother.

"Of course she can, honey." Twists mother answered.

         The following several hours were spent gorging on treats of various kinds. Some were hard candies others were pastries, and lots of chocolate. Apple Bloom had inhaled enough pie of differing flavors to equal three whole pies. She ate enough cake for four full grown ponies, and probably six boxes worth of Heart's and Hooves' Day chocolates. She wasn't done there either. She had drank three liters of the soda that Twist's uncle brought. Lastly, five of the containers of chocolate covered fruit were emptied solely by her. Her enormous, gurgling belly was very distended, and kept her seated right where she was. Twist and her family had already left for the evening. Twist had asked Apple Bloom if she wanted her to stay, but Apple Bloom ensured her that she would be fine on her own.

         Apple Bloom leaned up against a tree while she waited for her food to digest. "I've gained so much weight today," She said to herself. She shook one of her legs, and watched the three inches of dangling fat sway back and forth." It's only the third week or summer vacation. Still another two months before Sweetie and Scootaloo come back. I'm gonna have to really watch myself now. I've gotten so fat that I broke a bench when I sat on it." Apple Bloom began rubbing her belly again. After a few more minutes, she attempted to stand up only fall back on her jiggling butt. She tried three more times before successfully getting on her hooves. As she waddled back through town, she noticed that her belly scraped the ground occasionally. Her wobbling flanks would bump into light poles and carts if she walked to closely to them. With each forward step, her hind legs pressed into her quaking belly.

         Apple Bloom stopped in front a antique shop that happened to have a tall mirror leaned up against the wall. She couldn't even see all of herself in the mirror unless she stood three feet away from it. She got a good look at her fatty face. Her doughy cheeks looked as if they had been filled with whip cream. Her two extra chins had joined together making one thick, wobbly chin. Her gigantic belly stuck out to her sides another two inches. Sucking it in did nothing. There was too much fat too suck in. It forcefully squished into her front and hind legs. Her fattened legs had thickened even more. There was a three inch sheet of fat that wrapped around each leg. The pile of blubber that was her flanks and butt had swelled four inches wider making them stick out almost as much as her belly. They jostled from side to side with every movement Apple Bloom made. On top or that, the fat of her flanks was folding over the fat of her hind legs.

         Most ponies would despair at this situation, but Apple Bloom's obesity didn't bother her not mentally anyway. Yes, it was harder for her to walk, and even more difficult to stand up. Her back ached ,and her legs were sore from carrying her bulk around. Apple Bloom didn't mind these things much. It just meant she had to sit down more often to rest.

         The sun was going to set soon, so Apple Bloom started her slow trek back home. Humming a tune while she wobbled and jiggled the whole way.
155222111211222212.title: Wonder Ponyville.

1552221112112222121.content:
Upon arrival at the farm, Apple Bloom noticed that the lights were off. She carefully stepped onto the front porch. She didn't want to repeat what happened in the park. The boards creaked under her weight. She opened the door and stepped inside the house. There was no light on in here either. After some fumbling around in the dark, she managed to find a lamp and turned it on. With the room illuminated, she could see her brother sound asleep on the couch. "He must have been so tired that he did even bother going to bed," She thought. As quietly as possible, Apple Bloom started climbing the stairs. They too groaned as she stepped on them.
Her belly scraped on every step. It was a good thing the steps had been worn smooth, or they could have cut her. Apple Bloom didn't need light to find her room. It was straight down the hall from the stairs.

         Apple Bloom waddled over to her nightstand, or at least she was until her extra wide flank bumped into the corner of her bed. She lost her balance and fell onto her side. "Ooof," she said, "Great now I got to try getting back up without making noise." She rolled over enough to get her legs under her, but struggled to lift herself up. Several failed attempts later, she tried to use her mouth by biting and pulling on the blanket on her bed. A few more tries and she pulls herself back up. " *huff huff* That was a lot harder than I *huff* though it would be." She waddled over to the nightstand and turned on the lamp. "There now I can see what I'm doing." She looked at a short stair case in the corner that Apple Jack had built for her. "Good thing Sis made this for me so I can get in and out of bed," she said as she dragged it over to her bedside. She climbed the up, turned off the lamp, and lied down on her bed. Sleep came to her quickly. She was off to dreamland with in minutes.

                                                                                         {ind ent}                    Morning

         Apple Bloom woke to the sound of pans clanging. "Big mac must be trying to cook breakfast again. He's the best brother ever, but he sure isn't a chef." Apple Bloom though back to the last time Big Mac tried making waffles. He burnt most of them. With the exception of a few that he got right. Apple Bloom climbed out of bed, walked into the bathroom, groomed herself, and walked to the stairs. She stepped down enough to see Big mac. He had clearly given up on cooking something for breakfast. A slice of bread with some jam and a cup of coffee lay before him. Apple Bloom's belly grumbles. "That is no breakfast," she thought," maybe I'll wait till he goes out to the barn. Then I can head for Sugarcube Corner. Although he may want some company. He was on his own all day yesterday".
1552221112112222121.title: The Silent  Fatty.

15522211121122221212.content:
"I'll wait till he leaves. I shouldn't go back to Sugarcube Corner, but the food there is certainly better than some bread with jam." With her decision made, Apple Bloom went back to her room. "I make sure not to make a pig of myself this time." Apple Bloom needed only wait for twenty minutes before she heard the hoof steps of her brother as he walked out of the house. "Alright time to go. About time he left, I'm getting really hungry."

         It was still early morning when Apple Bloom left. She was sure to be the first costumer; therefore, she would get the freshest treats. The air near Sugarcube Corner was permeated with the scent of baked goods. It made Apple Blooms belly growl loudly every few seconds. Just as she was waddling up to the door, Mr. Cake flipped the the open sign around. "Good morning, Apple Bloom," he said as he opened the door for her,"you are just in time. The doughnuts just came out of the oven."
"Good morning, Mr Cake, I'd like a dozen of them and some chocolate milk please," She asked. "Coming right up," he replied. Hesitantly Apple Bloom sat in the same seat she sat in yesterday. "Please don't break," she thought. The chair creaked and groaned, but held her weight. Her doughnuts and milk arrived a moment later. Mr. Cake had brought her a mixture of several different doughnuts. There was glazed, jelly filled, powdered, and chocolate. "Enjoy, let me know if you want anymore," he said as he walked back into the kitchen. Apple Bloom gobbled the doughnuts and drank the milk with in twenty minutes. Feeling satisfied she paid for her meal and waddled out the door.

         Apple Bloom wandered around for forty-five minutes before her belly growled. "Ugh I just ate. I don't need to feed you again." Her belly growled again. "Alright fine, I'll get some more food." She stopped at a small café and ordered three cinnamon rolls. The sugary treats tasted wonderful, she would definitely be coming back to this café again. With her belly silenced for now, Apple Bloom left the café. She meandered from one store to the next looking at the items for sale there was even a painting of her farm in one of the shops. An hour had past before a growl emanated from her bally once again. "Oh you have got to be kidding me. I'm trying not to gorge myself silly today. Will you please knock it off," said thought to her stomach. It responded with another growl. Apple Bloom waddled over to a fruit stand and bought six apples. They weren't Apple Farm apples, but they were still sweet and juicy. After only ten minutes, her belly grumbled for more food. "Oh for Pett's sake. Hmm, maybe I should snack on something more filling", she said out loud. It took a few minutes, but Apple Bloom found a bakery that sold pie. She bought one cherry pie and wolfed it down. Her belly gave a satisfied gurgle. A few hours past, and Apple Bloom's hunger had returned. It was 11:30 a.m. "Guess its time for lunch," she thought. She had plenty of restaurants to choose from, but she stuck with her tried and true place, Sugarcube Corner. Mr. Cake had greeted her as she entered,"Hello again, Apple Bloom, what can I get for you?" She asked," I'd like some vanilla cake, brownies, a big slice of peach cobbler with ice cream, and milk to wash it down with, please." Mr. Cake took her order and brought out four slices of vanilla cake, eight brownies, a bowl of cobbler with vanilla ice cream, and a tall glass of whole milk. Eyeballing her meal hungrily for a few seconds she dug in ,but made an effort to eat this meal a little slower and savor it. She paid and thanked Mr. Cake for the meal. Her journey around town continued, stopping every few hours for a snack until it was time to go home.

         This had become Apple Bloom's routine for several days with weight gain as the obvious result. Standing in her bedroom she viewed the changes to her body in the mirror. "Just how much fatter did I get?!", she thought. Her cheeks had not changed much, but her chin has certainly grown. It drooped 3 inches below her mouth. Her chest and neck were covered in six inches of flab that bulged out further than her chin. The fat on her legs was half an inch thicker and had rolls that covered her knees. The wobbling mass that was her belly had bloated by two inches. It was so big that it dragged on the ground under her. Her billowing flanks and posterior had widened by another four inches and rivaled her belly in shear size and girth. Her morbidly obese body wobbled and jiggled with the slightest movement. She waddled around her room giggling as the rug on the floor tickled her belly. She swayed to the left and right and watched her flab wobble. It continued to jiggle for a few seconds after she stopped moving. Apple Bloom came to a realization. "This is awsome. It's like I'm made out of jello," she said out loud, "Why didn't I try getting this fat before?"

         A voice pulled Apple Bloom from her reverie. Somepony was calling her from downstairs. It was........
15522211121122221212.title: Sugarcube Corner......again.

155222111211222212121.content:
Apple Jack was calling for Apple Bloom to come down stairs. "Sis and Granny are home!" she said excitedly. She rushed downstairs as fast as her corpulent body allowed which wasn't very fast. She gave her sister and grandma each a big squishy hug. "I'm so glad you back. Did you save Auntie Golden Delicious' orchard?" Apple Jack tried to say something. but just couldn't speak. She was dumbfounded by her little sisters gigantic, obese body. "Apple Bloom," she said," just what happened to you? You're enormous! How...when did you get so fat?!" Apple Bloom looked like she'd just been slapped. "Real smooth, AJ," Big Mac retorted. Apple Jack apologized to her now teary eyed sister. "Apple Bloom, I'm sorry that came out wrong." "Ahem," Granny spoke,"I think it time for a family meeting."

         The Apple family sat in the living room. Granny opened the conversation with a question. "Bloom what did you do while your sister and I were away?" "I ate......a lot," Apple Bloom answered. "I see," Granny replied," Why though is what I really want to know." "I was hungry and bored. You have any idea how boring it is with most of my family and friends not around?" "What about your brother here?" Granny responded. "He and I hung out some, but with him being so busy we couldn't do that very much. I just wandered around ponyville, going from place to place. Usually to restaurants or food carts."

         Apple Jack continued the conversation with Big mac. "You knew Bloom was gaining all this weight and you try and stop her?" Apple Jack asked. Big mac shook his head. "Nnnop," he said, "I didn't see a reason too. She seemed to be enjoying herself." Apple Jack snapped back," And you think that makes it ok? It isn't healthy carrying around all that fat." Big Mac replied," You're right. It isn't easy for her to carry it around, but you are not a doctor ,AJ. We can't know if she is healthy or not unless you have the doc take a look at her." "And that is just what I'm going to do," Apple Jack answered.

         Apple Jack slowly walked through town with Apple Bloom waddling beside her. "You could have rode in the cart, you know," Apple Jack said. "I *huff* don't need to. *huff* I can walk *huff* there just fine." The sisters continued the walk in silence for some time. "You know that the doc is gonna put you on a strict diet, right?" Apple Jack asked. "You don't know that," Apple Bloom retorted,"I don't want to loose it anyway. I like being fat. You can't make me loose it either." "Alright, lets make a deal then," Apple Jack said, "If the doc says that you need to diet then you have to diet, but if doesn't say you need to then you can get as fat as you want."
" *huff* Deal," Apple bloom responded.

         ----Doctor Stable's office---

         Apple Bloom and Apple Jack sat in the waiting room for what seemed like hours; though, it had only been 30 min before Nurse Redheart addressed them. "Dr. Stable will see you now, Apple Bloom," she said. Dr. Stable greeted directed them to room six. "Alright, what can I do for you two today?" he asked. Apple Jack answered," A check up for Apple Bloom. She has put on a lot of weight recently." "I can see that. Please step on a scale, Apple Bloom," he asked. She watched as the dial on the scale spun around. 100, 110, 120, 130 the numbers climbed higher and higher till eventually it stopped on 207. "My my, last time you were here you weighed ninety two pounds. Had a few too many slices of cake, Hmmm," he joked. He produced a measuring tape from his lap coat. "This may tickle, Apple Bloom. Please try to stand as still as you can," he asked her. First, he measured her bulging neck it was eleven inches around. Second, he measured her legs. Her front legs measured eight and a half inches while her back legs were nine inches around. Next was her belly, it measured seventy five inches around. Lastly, her butt and flanks. they were bigger around than her belly and measured eighty inches. Dr. Stable then checked her heart rate, breathing, and reflexes. "Alright we are done. Aside from the excess weight and muscle fatigue Apple Bloom is completely healthy. I would suggest an exercise routine to strengthen her leg muscles. Walking briskly and squats would do just fine." "And a diet?" Apple jack asked. "Diet plans on one so young as Apple Bloom can do more harm than good, Ms. Apple Jack. She just needs exercise." With the verdict given the sister walked out of the hospital.

         "I win," Apple Bloom said with her head held high. "You half win," Apple Jack replied, "You don't have to diet, but still have to exercise." "And I still get to eat whatever I want." Apple Bloom retorted. Apple jack sighed in resignation. "Yes, you do." Apple Blooms belly growled very loudly. "I think we should celebrate my victory. Lets go to Sugarcube Corner, I'm starving." And so the sisters made way for Sugarcube Corner. Apple jack walked while her sister waddled beside her. Huffing and puffing the whole way.

1552221112112222121212.content:
Everyday for the last month followed generally the same schedule. Apple Bloom would get up, do thirty five to forty squats. Then waddled laps around the house for a hour sometimes two depending on what she ate the day before. After her morning workout she was free to do as she wished. Which entailed snacking, wondering around town, eating, hanging with her family, eating, some attempts at getting her cutie mark, and more eating. Apple Bloom had ballooned a great deal over this month. If she had not been on the exercise routine, she probably wouldn't be able to walk or stand right now. Her gigantic, rotund belly gained eight inches of fat making it now thirty two inches wide. Her belly was as wide as she was tall! When measured it had a one hundred inch circumference. It firmly pressed against her legs, flanks and the ground under it. Her jiggling, flabby flanks had enlarged by six inches putting it at thirty one inches wide. That was ninety seven inches all the way around. Her hind legs fat had joined with her flanks making them look one third shorter. Her neck and second chin had disappeared under a collar of fat fourteen inches thick and measured forty three inches round. Her pudgy face had added a fourth of an inch of fat. Her sagging cheeks looked as if hey had injected with marsh mellow cream.

         Over the month, Apple Bloom stashed away some of her allowance every week so she could buy enough food for a feast. She was currently at Sugarcube Corner pigging out on pies, ice cream, cookies, cake, nearly every kind of confection served there. "Keep the food coming", she said between mouthfuls," I got plenty more bits to pay for it." Apple Bloom shoveled the treats into her mouth trying to eat as much as possible. She stuffed herself till it felt like her belly was going to burst. "Alright, that .... that is all i can... do. So full." She sat back and rubbed now very firm belly. "When all that digests, this huge belly will be so much softer and squishier," she thought. She looked at the table her food was on. There was a stack of seventeen empty pie tins, nineteen ice cream bowls, and thirteen brownie plates. She didn't bother counting the rest of the empty dishes. She knew that this was the most food she had ever eaten ever before. She slept for three hours since she couldn't really go anywhere while she digested. After her cat nap, she was ready to head back home. Trying with all her might and some assistance from Mr. and Ms. Cake she heaved herself back onto her hooves. The process left her breathless. "Thanks. *huff* Don't tell my sis that I *puff* couldn't get up on my own ok. *huff* I'll see you next month," she said to them as she lumbered out the door.

         Ponies stared at Apple Bloom as she waddled her way through Ponyville. "Oh my Celestia, she is gigantic. How is she even standing. She should be on a diet," they whispered. Apple Bloom just ignored them. "Wonder if I should make a stop at any of my other favorite restaurants on the way home?" She thought. "I'm not hungry so now would be the best time to eat. I read in a book that if you eat when not hungry whatever you ate becomes fat." She thinks for a few minutes. "Why am I wasting time! I got places to go and things to eat," she said to no one but herself. Apple Bloom changed her direction and began her trek to her next meal.

         First there was a ice cream shop, then Bon Bon's candy shop, then the market stalls, and finally a restaurant that was known for its big meals. Apple Bloom had stopped and eaten at four eateries and five of the market stalls. Her day had literally been an all day feast. She started her waddle back home, but was stopped by Ditzy. "Apple Bloom," she said," you shouldn't be out here there's gonna be a thunderstorm in half an hour." Apple Bloom replied, "Why?" "Well you see, Ponyville has missed three scheduled rain showers. So the pegasi of Cloudsdale are gonna make it storm to make up for the missed showers. Come on you can stay at my house till the storm is past." "Ok, lets go. I don't want to get caught out in the storm," Apple Bloom replied. She followed the wall- eyed mare to her home.

         Apple Bloom stepped into Ditzy's house. It was a quaint home with a few furnishings. "Make yourself at home, Apple Bloom. I'll fly to you home and let your family know that you are staying here till the storm is past." "Ok, thank you, Ditzy," Apple Bloom replied. Ditzy went back outside and flew off towards Sweet Apple Acre's.

         Apple Bloom looked around Ditzy's living room. Noticing an extensive collection of fantasy books on book shelves in the corner. There was a small fire burning in the fireplace. It was nice and warm. Apple Bloom yawned. "I don't think Ditzy would mind if I read one of these books, or maybe I should take a nap by the fire.

15522211121122221212121.content:
Apple Bloom browsed the books. Some she recognized others she had never seen before. She took a random book from the shelf. The one she grabbed was leather bound. Its title read "A Hero's Tale". She had not heard of this book before. Apple Bloom opened the book expecting something like a fairytale story. Instead there was instructions. "In this interactive story what happens depends on what decisions the reader, that's you, makes," she read aloud," Start at page one, choose your race and items, and one of three items. From there follow the instructions per page." Apple Bloom flipped the page over and saw picture of an earth pony, a pegasus, and a unicorn. There were two pictures of each pony race a mare and a stallion. Apple Bloom choose earth pony mare. The next page pictured three items, a magical medallion, a round shield, and a spear. She chose the shield. With her character made Apple Bloom flipped to page one.

         Apple Bloom had been reading for roughly fifteen minutes when Ditzy had returned. Ditzy walked up behind Apple Bloom who was too enthralled by the book to notice Ditzy's approach. "A Hero's Tale? I didn't think you would like a book like that," Ditzy said. Apple bloom squeaked. "Oh I'm sorry, Ditzy. I should have waited till you got back before I messed with your stuff," she replied. "Oh its not a problem. I'm sorry too. I didn't mean to startle you," Ditzy said apologetically, "Are you enjoying the story?" Apple Bloom nodded. "Yeah, this is really cool." Ditzy lied down next to Apple Bloom. "Mind if I join you?" she asked. "Not at all," Apple Bloom replied,"Let read it together." Hours had past by and Apple Bloom was getting close to the end of the story. She had slain a troll, saved merchant from a wolf pack, and helped rebuild a town. Now though she was trapped in a mansion with traps around every corner. Pictures, tables, and lamps in the foyer flew at her as if they were thrown. She ran into a banquet hall to escape possessed furniture. With in was a feast fit for a king. An ethereal voice spoke to her," You look hungry. Come partake of this evenings dinner, traveler." Apple Bloom paused. "It's a trap, Apple Bloom." Ditzy said, "You should leave." "Why free food is the best food," Apple Bloom replied. She decides to eat the food. "Flip to page 251," she read. Apple bloom flipped to page 251 and read it aloud. "The hero hesitantly took a bite of the sweet potatoes and was entranced by the taste. She took another bite then another and another. The food was enchanted! The hero couldn't stop eating. She was completely under the spell of the delectable dinner. She ate and ate. With each bite the hero seemed to get bigger and rounder. The buttons on her tunic popped off, and her leggings ripped as she got fatter and fatter. The ethereal voice cackled as the hero continued to gorge. You have met a terrible end." Apple Bloom giggled. Seems more like the best ending to me. The hero looks a lot like me now," she said and pointed at the picture of very obese hero. Ditzy laughed. "You're right the hero does look like you," she said. Another hour past and the storm had stopped, but neither Ditzy nor Apple Bloom had noticed. They were enjoying each others company to much to realize that the storm had passed already.

         There was a knock at the door. "Oh, that must be Apple Jack", Ditzy said, "I guess it's time for you to go home." Apple Bloom nodded. "I guess so," she replied. Ditzy opened the door. It was Big Mac instead of Apple Jack. "AJ said that Apple Bloom was here? I've come to take her home," he said. "I'm coming," Apple Bloom replied. Grunting with effort she tried to stand. She tried and tried again but could not stand up. "um, a little help, please," she asked. Both Big Mac and Ditzy had to help her. Her face red with embarrassment. After a few attempts, she was back on her hooves. Big mac thanked Ditzy for looking after Apple Bloom and they departed. Ditzy waved at them as they walked down the muddy Ponyville street.

" *huff* Big Mac, can you promise *huff* me something", Apple bloom asked.

"Whats that?"

"Can you not tell AJ that I couldn't stand on my own?"

"Eeyup, I promise"

"Thanks, Big Mac."

The azure blue mare groaned as she glared at the advertising poster in front of her, a reminder of far better days.


"Stupid bratty foals" she muttered as she crumpled the poster and flung it into a nearby waste basket with her magic. Then with a huff she turned back towards the bowl of onion rings she'd been munching on and levitated one up to her mouth, savoring its slightly greasy but rich flavor before devouring it
in a single hearty bite.


"Ugh, I hate my life!" Trixie moaned as she ate another two onion rings and washed them down with a slurp of a huge milk shake. Since the debacle of a performance in Ponyville, the showmare had both figuratively and literally fallen on hard times. Her inability to live up to her boast of having vanquished an Ursa
Major had spread quickly after her disastrous showing in the small town and pretty soon everypony's image of Trixie was not as a master illusionist and magician, but as a fraud and bully who embellished her talent, humiliated her audience and bewitched young foals with tall tales that encouraged them to imitate them in spite of the great danger they could put themselves in.


"Hmmf, because somepony saying they've defeated an Ursa means they want you to bring an Ursa to town...what bucking hogwash!" the unicorn cursed
as she swallowed another swig of her shake. "They act as though they've never heard a performer promote herself before... sigh* she plopped down dejectedly and took a bite from another onion ring. As she chewed the crunchy fried treat Trixie stared at the various food stuffs before. Food. It'd been the
only thing that really gave her any sense of comfort, the smell and taste of it helping to smooth away the awful memories of that miserable day and the
hardships she'd gone through since. Pizza didn't run her out of town for just trying to book a performance slot, ice cream's coldness was soothing unlike the
coldness in many a neighsayer's heart, and the burned lips she occasionally suffered from gobbling hot fresh baked cupcakes and cookies actually felt good
compared to the burn she felt from others telling her to "get over it."


Speaking of others...



"Trixie, I thought you were coming to the flea market with me." a stern yet gentle voice said from outside her room. Trixie groaned in frustration as the bedroom door opened with a shimmer of magic and a purple unicorn stepped in, her face wearing a mixture of disappointment and subdued resignation. "You've been holed up here ever sense you came back and haven't done anything or gotten to know anypony." she added with some concern.



"I already told you Twilight, Trixie wasn't leaving her room today nor this library, especially after what happened with those three yipping parrots!" the former showmare replied as she stuffed another three onion rings into her mouth. "Besides Trixie already kept her promise to model for Rarity's new 'plus-sized' fashions and taste tested Pinkie's newest 'flavor' of jello mold." she said the bit about the jello with audible disgust.



Twilight sighed and with a glimmer of magic pulled the lounging mare towards her, Trixie appearing not to notice as she took a long slurp of her shake. She wasn't gonna let this go.



"Yes you did help Rarity and Pinkie, in fact those are about the only things you've down since I let you move in with me." the purple pony argued. Trixie only rolled her eyes as she chewed more onion rings. Twilight sighed louder. "Look Trixie I know things haven't been going well for you show wise since the incident, but most ponies here at least have forgiven you and would like to see you preform again," the royal prodigy waited a moment before continuing,
"Besides you could really use some exercise."



At the mention of the word "exercise" Trixie shot up and glared menacingly at the purple unicorn who only shrugged. Since the Ursa incident and due to the resulting hit to her reputation, Trixie had spent most of her time weeping and stuffing herself with various foods and drinks. This had continued even after
Twilight had invited the depressed and food obsessed mare back to Ponyville and into her home in the hopes of giving her a new start in life, and the eventual
result was the two hundred pound plus pony now standing before her.


Not that she'd ever acknowledge it though.



"Trixie most certainly does not need exercise!" the rotund show unicorn bellowed, causing her two extra chins and fat cheeks to wobble comically as crumbs and splotches of milk shake dripped off of them. Twilight fought the urge to giggle as Trixie waddled around her ranting , enormous belly swaying like a blubbery pendulum, her fat pillowy rump bouncing and jiggling in rhythm with her gut. "Rarity says Trixie's physique is its unique beauty and besides, those
horrid flower gossipers got their just 'desserts' " she finished her rant with a long slurp of her shake before glaring back at Twilight.



The purple pony shook her head realizing she wasn't gonna get anywhere with being blunt to her guest, "Ugh never mind, how about we just visit Applejack
for today. She'll likely have some fresh picked apples for you." she suggested. Trixie's mood immediately brightened at the mention of apples.


"Trixie did say Sweet Apple Acres has the best apples she's tasted" the portly show off said. "And a healthy snack sounds much better then exercise."
She mouthed the word as though it were a slur against large ponies like herself. Twilight just rolled her eyes as she and Trixie headed out.

15533112.content:
The walk over from library to Sweet Apple Acres had been mostly uneventful for the two unicorns, the only interruption being a drawn out conversation with Ditzy Doo the resident mail mare about muffins and the accomplishments of her daughters Sparkler and Dinky. After sending the grey pegasus on her way though they spent the rest of the walk taking in the sights and smells of the warm winter day as they approached the apple farm.



"Well howdy girls, it sure is good to see ya'll," Applejack waved to them from the front porch of the farm house. "Ah've been waiting for ya'll, there's some good hot coco inside if ya'll want some as well as some nice fresh picked apples." The orange farm pony couldn't help but chuckle as she saw Trixie's face light up at the mention of food. Together the three friends step inside and into the kitchen where three mugs of steaming warm coco sat on the table along with a big basket of apples and surprisingly, a newly baked apple pie.



"Wow AJ you didn't have to fix all this for us," Twilight started to say a bit embarrassed, but Trixie hushed her with a hoof. "Oh Applejack that pie simply looks delicious, and those apples are scrumptious." the rotund unicorn said as she eyed the display of food and drink hungrily, a fact that didn't escape the cowpony's attention.



"Heehee whoa there partner, you gotta leave some for the rest of us now." Applejack said with a chuckle as the three mares took their seats at the table. Trixie merely nodded in acknowledgement as she was already chewing on a piece of pie. AJ and Twilight both giggled as they sipped their cups of coco.



"So Twi," Applejack began after cutting them each a piece of pie. "How's getting a show gig for Trixie been going?"



The purple unicorn sighed as she took a long sip of coco, "Not good I'm afraid, every place we've tried is either booked or won't even give her a second look." she answered dejectedly. "Even when I try to explain how the whole you know what wasn't completely her fault we usually get told to go home." the young scholar pony taking care not to mention the word Usra in the presence of her magician friend. "It seems as though nopony wants to give her a chance."



"Oh Twi you know how picky and stubborn some of them fancy ponies can be, " Applejack responded taking a small bite of her pie. "Have ya'll tried writing to the Princess about this, surely she can do something to help. I know overcoming a big slip up like that whole you know what business ain't easy, but she can't just stay in the library and eat snacks all day... no offense Trixie." the farmer added for the sake of her portly friend.



"Mmmff, none taken" the chubby blue mare said as she wolfed down her fifth piece of apple pie. Her already bloated belly was noticeably bigger from her current binge, as were her hips and rear. Applejack and Twilight both couldn't help but chuckle as Trixie let out a small belch before grabbing another juicy apple with her magic and all but devouring it in one hearty bite.



"Anyway," Twilight said turning back to Applejack. "Writing to the Princess sounds like it could work, the only thing is everypony even her tends to be busy this time of year with the preparations for the Hearts and Hooves day and the Winter Wrap Up celebrations in Canterlot. But I know she'll take some time out to help us, what do you think Trixie?" The purple unicorn asked her busily snacking friend, who nodded her acceptance before returning to polishing off the last remaining apples.



"Alright then it's settled," Twilight stated proudly. "When we get back to the library I'll have Spike write a letter asking Princess Celestia to see if she find a place that will let Trixie preform. After all nopony can say no to the Princess right?" Both the farmer and show pony nodded in agreement. Besides when was the last time anyone had gotten in the way Celestia giving her star pupil and her friends a helping hoof?



Twenty Minutes Later.



"Thanks you ever soo much for the coco and apples Applejack," Twilight said as the three ponies walked towards the door after the conclusion of their lunch gathering.



"And if Trixie may add, that apple pie was spectacularly delicious." Trixie added warmly. "We shall certainly do this again, tomorrow perhaps?"



"Ah it ain't nothing girls, ya'll welcome anytime here at Sweet Apple Acres." Applejack replied, "Though next ah need to fix more than one pie so they're be enough for all of us." she added with a chuckle, the two unicorns joining in for a laugh or two before departing.



"Wow that pie was pretty good," Twilight said. "though me and Applejack each only got to eat one piece," she added.



Trixie just gave her a smug smile in response as she waddled along side, not feeling one bit guilty about her binge.



"Anyways, we better get back so we can compose our letter for the Princess and send it today, that way we'll have time to come up with ideas for a performance in case she writes back with some good news. Not that she won't of course," the scholar mare added. "I'm sure some theater close by will agree to give you a chance."



"If they're anything like the simpletons who run the Trottingham theater Trixie wouldn't bet on it, " the tubby showmare answered with a slight frown before suddenly brightening. "Besides Trixie feels that a nice large milk shake from the Sugarcube Corner would help inspire her."



"But Trixie you already ate a whole basket of apples and most of Applejack's pie," Twilight started to protest but Trixie quickly shushed her.



"Trixie already said she's only accompanying you just to get a healthy snack," the fat blue unicorn said sternly, "and if that includes a milk shake and some donuts than that's what Trixie will be having!"



"Ugh fine," Twilight said sighing and noting that Trixie has added donuts to the menu. "Though after all this you're definitely gonna have to lose some of that stomach." she added the last part while giving Trixie a meaningful stare.



Trixie just smiled back smugly as the two ponies approached the bakery.

1553322211.content:
Octavia was practicing her cello playing for an upcoming concert. As she slowly moved her bowstring across the instrument's strings, a soft melody echoed through the room and filtered out into the sun bathed sky. The cellist closed her eyes and for a brief moment, imagined herself on stage before a cheering audience of thousands of ponies, their applause mixing with her music to create a heavenly soothing tune.


*Griggle*


The sound of her stomach growling snapped her concentration and spoiled the dream like fantasy. "Ugh, I guess it's time for a lunch break.." the grey mare said to herself as she carefully placed her cello in its case before heading down to the kitchen. As she made her way to the stairway she caught a glimpse of herself in the mirror and stopped. Sighing dejectedly she stepped towards it and studied her reflection closely.


"Ugh, damn you baked goods." Octavia muttered. It was as much a jab at herself as it was pastries in general, since it was her gradual liking of them that had led to the figure staring back at her in the mirror.


The large, rotund blubbery figure that is.


Octavia's main motivation for wanting to move here to Ponyville was to get away from the drama and pandemonium of Cantorlot... and also reconnect with her younger sister whom she hadn't seen since they were fillies(unless you counted a brief yet chaotic meeting at the Grand Galloping Gala, which both mares preferred to forget). To say she'd been overjoyed to see her would be an understatement, as Pinkie was soon dragging the musician mare all Ponyville introducing her to everypony especially her closest friends and before throwing her a massive "Welcome to Ponyville Long Lost Big Best Sister Who's the Bestest Best Violin Player Ever!!"(she'd explained the differences between a cello and a violin to her later on). Other than the almost weekly parties and having to endure her hyperactive sibling's many wacky antics, Octavia honestly believed settling down in this small town had been a blessing...


...and a curse.



During the time she'd been living with Pinkie the grey musical mare couldn't help but notice that some of her infinitely joyful sister's habits had begun to rub off on her. More than once she'd caught herself walking with a skip in her step or humming one of Pinkie's random songs that had gotten stuck in her head. Octavia considered those minor annoyances though compared to her biggest pet peeve...Pinkie's eating habits. Slowly but surely the celloist mare had found herself increasingly snacking on candy, cookies and other sweets whenever she wasn't preforming or practicing for a concert, instead of the usual and much healthier vegetables and fruits. The fact that the apartment she and Pinkie shared was located above a bakery didn't help matters, and it wasn't long before she'd started gaining weight.... a lot of weight.



"Ah Pinkie, just look at what your sugary goods have done to me." Octavia said to her reflection dejectedly, her extra chin wobbling in response. Examining herself further served only to dampen her mood as she gazed down at her belly, it was as big and round as a jumbo beach ball and jiggled and bounced between her thicker legs as she turned to view her side, making the grey mare grumble. Turning her head a bit she caught sight of her much bigger and thicker flank, noting with disappointment as it jiggled with her every movement. "I look like an overstuffed pig, how could I let myself go like this... " The two hundred plus pound musician mumbled to herself as she continued studying her reflection.



"Oooohhhh Octavia, It's Breakfast Tiiiiimmmmmeeeee!! Come get your pancakes before the twins eat them and throw them all over like frisbees!" Pinkie Pie bellowed from downstairs, snapping Octavia out of her self-critique.



"I'll be right down in a second!" she answered as she went to fetch her customary pink bow piece from the dresser. Snapping it around her chubby neck was getting more and more difficult. "And to think this morning it's pancakes, my absolute favorite." the grey mare muttered as she finally managed to fit the little garment on and she began making her way down the stairs towards the kitchen.



The breakfast table seemed to call to her as Octavia took a seat across from Pinkie, who she noted was already at work gobbling down a stake of pancakes and scrambled eggs. “How she eats so much and hardly gain half a pound I’ll never know.” She thought bitterly to herself before fixing herself a modest serving of pancakes and buttered toast. Taking a cautious bite of the first pancake Octavia was suddenly reminded why she’d come to crave Pinkie’s and the Cakes’ breakfast cooking so much lately, the sweet buttery taste combined with maple syrup was like heaven to her taste buds… and her stomach. “This is gonna go right to my flanks I just know it, but it’s so divine!” she thought with a blush before swallowing and taking another more hearty bite of the pancake. Soon she had finished the whole thing started eating the rest of her stack more quickly, till soon she was scarfing down the reminder of the pancakes along with a big helping of scrambled eggs and toast.


Several minutes later….


“My Mrs. Cake these pancakes are splendid!” Octavia complemented as she wiped her mouth with a napkin. She had lost track of just how many of the fluffy delicious breakfast delicacies she’d wolfed down, but she couldn’t deny the sweet warm flavor that flooded her mouth with every bite and swallow.


“Well you’re welcome dearie,” Mrs. Cake answered as she and Mr. Cake gathered up the empty dishes for cleaning. “Of course Pinkie helps a lot with the baking though some of her recipes are….unique.” she added with a nervous smile.


“Haha well I never would of imagined myself enjoying chocolate pancakes and cinnamon-coated jelly filled bagels, but that was before moving to Ponyville.” The grey mare chuckled as she took a large bite of toast. “In fact living here may be just the best thing to happen to me, sure I miss socializing with the other members of my ensemble and my old music instructor but being able to just relax and not be flustered by all the dignified disorder of Cantorlot makes it worth it.”


“Tell me about, some of those fancy fancypants ponies can be really really boring and some of them even don’t like parties,” Pinkie Pie added popping from beside her sister, startling her a bit. “I mean I know not everypony wants to party all the time like Cranky Doodle and Matilda but they still like to have fun but those rich snotty ponies don’t even like…Mpphh” Octavia stuck her hoof in her sibling’s mouth to stem her tidal wave of words.


“Goodness Pinkie Pie can’t you see me and Mrs. Cake are talking,” Octavia gently scolded her hyperactive sister, “Sometimes I swear you enjoy talking even more than you enjoy eating sweets… and…baked goods….” The words filtered out of Octavia’s mouth as the realization of what she’d been doing that morning hit her. “Oh dear…”


Mrs. Cake looked up from where she’d been placing some dishes in the dishwasher and turned towards the pair, concern written on her face. “Is something wrong Octavia?”


“Well…,” the cellist began hesitantly. “Ever since I moved here I’ve been gaining quite a few pounds.” She said glumly as she put a hoof on her greatly bloated stomach for emphasis. “Sometimes I can’t help but feel like a prized pig, and worst I’ve developed the eating habits of one wouldn’t you say?”


Both Mrs. Cake and Pinkie looked at each other for a moment, before smiling warmly at her.

A week had past and nopony noticed anything wrong. Fluttershy was busy feeding and caring for her animals like every other morning routine. However that day something was wrong with the animals. Many woodland creatures and birds were making signs of being scare and frustration.
"Oh, what the matter?" she asked all of the animals who were affected by the problem.
A squirrel crawled up on her back and talk directly in her ears.
She was listening intensively and repeating what the squirrel said to make sure she heard it right. "A white and black blob? Destroying trees? Growing and rumbling?"
The squirrel tugged on her hair and pointed straight at the Everfree Forest.
"You want me to find the blob monster," Fluttershy whimpered as thought of encountering it gave her the shivers.
The squirrel kept tugging her hair and told her to help the animals.
"You're right," Fluttershy signed, "I have to be more confident to face my fears. I could not always rely on my friends to solve all my problems."
Fluttershy slowly trotted, with the squirrel on her back, to the direction it was pointing at.

Fluttershy observed the surrounding and found nothing out of the usual until she spotted the top of a fallen redwoods tree. It was one of the widest and tallest tree in the Everfree Forest. The tree was taller than 370 feet and 25 feet wide. Fluttershy theorized that it must have been a very big and strong creature. She gulped as she followed the tree trunk to find it's stump. When she continued trotting she found many more trees fall victim to the 'blob'. She soon stop as she could not possibly see the stump as it was covered by something.

It was the white and black blob. The white and black blob squished against many trees and piles of rocks surrounding it. Many trees and rocks were either swallowed up or were leaned heavily against by the massive blob. Some of them looked like it could break at any moment. She can see that is has fur believing it was a living creature.
"Hello Mr or Miss Blob. Are you related to the Smooze?" Fluttershy said with fear, "Could you tell me why are you doing this?"
Before Fluttershy could lay a hoof on it, the blob rumbled. The blob expanded pushing more trees to the ground. Fluttershy gasped as she hid in a bush from a good distance. She can see the blob kept expanding until it stopped. She saw it grew a couple of inches more in every direction. The rumble stop and everything went silent. The squirrel ran away while Fluttershy was hiding. With no animals to talk to, she asked herself, "Should I get my friends now or explore what it is?"
155332222121111.title: Nopony came for a while.

choices: Fluttershy and the girls are back
1553322221211111.content:
Fluttershy stood up for herself and proudly announced, "I need to do this myself. I can't always rely everything on my friends."
She flew up to see the very top of the blob and the area surrounding it. After investigating the blob she examined that it was four times bigger than the biggest barn in the Sweet Apple Acres. She also estimated that the blob will surpass the treetop by the end of the day at the rate it was going. As blob rumbled and increased in size, Fluttershy didn't fly away as she was prepared and a good distance away from it. She only saddened at the fact that more trees were destroyed by it. After circling it one more time, she noticed a odd marking on its side. She flew down and did not believe what she saw.

It was Zecora's cutie mark. Eventhough it was enlarged (big as a billboard), distorted by the uneven growth and obscured by many trees being leaned by it, she was sure it was Zecora's. She flew up and found one of her hind legs. That hind leg just dangled there being useless. The knees was obscured by all its fat and hard to tell where the hips was. She followed around the edge of the blob until she find the head.

"Zecora!" Fluttershy gasped as she rushed there.
She found her snoring without any sign of pain or annoyance. Zecora's cheeks was so large that each one could hide a grown stallion with room to spare. The cheeks forces her eyes to be squinted and her mouth look minuscule to it. Her unending number of chins blend with her fat chest that oozes between her two fore legs. Her fore legs are as useless as her hind legs. It looked like it needed a small herd of ponies to lift it up. Zecora's body rumbled again and expand further. More trees were destroyed but Zecora kept sleeping peacefully like nothing is going wrong.
Needing the answers know, Fluttershy tickled Zecora on the nose with one of her wings, "Zecora. Wake up. What's going on?"
Zecora quickly snorted and sneezed before opening her eyes. She found Fluttershy staring right at her.

"I thought you would become here much earlier, now I became so much heavier," Zecora said as Fluttershy now knew it have been going on for a while.
"How long have you been like this?" asked Fluttershy.
"It has been a week, now the forest became a wreak." Zecora spoke as her cheeks and chins wobbled even with the slightest movement.
Suddenly Zecora's belly rumbled again. "Oh dear," whispered Fluttershy.
Zecora gained another couple of ten thousands of pounds. Zecora looked annoyed and frustrated rather than fear.
"I got used to it. The surrounding I destroyed didn't hurt me a bit," Zecora grumbled.
"What should I do?" ask Fluttershy.
"Get Princess Twilight! She knows what to do! I hope or my body forces to forest to go overload!" urges Zecora.
Fluttershy flew as quick as she can to get her friends.

Zecora just laid there waiting for them. Zecora could not do anything but to talk or hum to herself. Zecora spent most of her week sleeping as she could not even wriggle her hooves. Zecora just waited and waited until something pop up.

15533222212111111.content:
Fluttershy rushed to the Friendship Castle to find her friends. However, she could not find them. She only found a sticky note addressing to her. It said that Twilight and her friends went to a massive book sale far away from here. Twilight didn't specify where they are going and when they would get back. Fluttershy flew straight to the train station and waited there until her friends are back. It was sunset when Princess Twilight and her friend got back.

"Twilight! There is a emergency! I've been waiting since this morning," Fluttershy exclaimed.
Twilight calmed down Fluttershy to understand what was going on, "Fluttershy, breath. What is the big emergency? A monster? Friendship problem? Your animals?"
"Nope, it's.." Fluttershy was interrupted by sounds of trees falling down in the distance.
"Does it have to do with that?!" Rainbow Dash pointed at the white and black blob sticking above the tree top from the Everfree Forest.
"It's Zecora. Just follow me," Fluttershy flew toward the Everfree Forest with her friends following behind her.

They found Zecora who was now slightly bigger than a ursa major. Zecora was snoring as her belly was smothering the forest. Fluttershy poked at her nose to wake her up. Zecora winkled her nose before opening her eyes, greeting all the mane 6.
"Sorry that I took so long to get them. They were at a book sale and it took them almost the whole day to get here," Fluttershy pleaded.
"It's not your fault. Getting them won't instantly make my growing halt," Zecora said.
Zecora explained what happen to her and how long she been here.
"What should we do?" asked Fluttershy to the group.

Skip to the girls get back to Zecora.

However, Rainbow Dash interrupted Twilight,"Hey! Have you seen Pinkie Pie?"
The girls looked around until they heard a squeal.
"Weeeee!" Pinkie Pie was jumping and doing flips on the highest point of Zecora's belly, "Zecora, you would make the best trampoline in all of Equestria!"
Zecora's belly wobbled like jello from every bounce Pinkie was making.
"Pinkie Pie get off my belly! You are making my belly wobble like jelly!" Zecora was clearly seen frustrated as she could not even wiggle her hooves.
"Awww," Pinkie pouted as she hopped off Zecora's belly, "It was so much fun. I could see the Sugarcube Corner from here."
"Pinkie!" Rarity disapproved of Pinkie's action, "Respect personal space. Zecora does not want be treated as a trampoline."
"You right," Pinkie frowned but instantly turn it upside-down, "But she does make a pretty good storage device."
"That's goo... Wait? What!" Rarity just flabbergasted at Pinkie Pie's statement.
Pinkie ran up to one of Zecora's love handles, dug one hoof in it and pull out her party cannon.
"See. By judging by her size, she could fit everything from the Sugarcube Corner and have room to spare," Pinkie didn't notice the stare from her friends.
"Pinkie is being Pinkie. Just go with it," Rainbow dash continued surveying the area.

"If everypony stop what they are doing, I would explain what I am going to do." Twilight clearly gained the attention from everypony.
"Thank you," Twilight clearly clean her throat before speaking again, "I know that you are waiting for the surprise that me and Spike have been hiding in the castle. Spike is currently checking it if everything was going alright."

"Easy. I'm going to teleport her to my castle and.." her explanation was cut off from Pinkie Pie.
"Uhmm... Twilight? Isn't she as big as your castle? And isn't she going to get bigger than your castle soon?" As soon as she finish her comment, Zecora's belly rumbled and increased in more weight. Zecora clearly gained a couple of more chins, more love handles, wider hips, flabbier legs, bigger butt, larger cheeks, and taller belly height. More trees were crushed against Zecora's flab.

"Don't worry girls," Twilight said, "Originally my secrets is used for my books."
"Obviously," Rainbow Dash rolled her eyes as Twilight was annoyed by it.
"As I was saying, the secret was a room in my castle is magically maintain by these magic crystals to make that room to have unlimited space."
"Oh. Oh. Oh." Pinkie trying to gain Twilight's attention, "Can it fit Ponyville in it? Maybe the whole of Equestria?"
"Not that I know of. In theory yes but I don't want to test it out."
Twilight told the girls to stand away from Zecora as she casted a spell.
"Zecora. Are you ready?" warned Twilight Sparkle.
"Better than destroying the Everfree Forest. I don't want to flatten it into dust." Zecora answered through her two massive cheeks.
Zecora was enveloped by a purple aura and popped from existence. Twilight collapsed from exhaustion and the girls carried her back to the castle.

The cloaked pony was standing on the town hall laughing maniacally as ponies trembled with fear as they stared at him.
"No ponies dare to stop me or you be spending rest of your life in a gym," the cloaked pony pranced around with no care in the world.
Twilight and her friends rushed to find the maniac. They tried to get a good look at him but they distinguish what kind of pony is he.
"Ponies! Heed my words. If anypony came in my way, they would suffer a 'big' consequence," the pony laughed as he heard the cries of the ponies.

Zecora stood out of the crowd and doesn't believe that a pony could have the ability to do so, "You are all bark but no bite. How could we tell you are saying is right? If you do than how could you defeat the princess, for instance?"

Zecora was held tight in place, not be able to move a muscle. The pony closely examined her body from all angles like a doll and commenting on it.
