Twilight woke up later than usual as she had been up for almost the whole night. It was a surprise to see all her friends surrounding the table just staring at their breakfast gloomily.
"Girls? What are you doing here?" Twilight took her sight as she looked to each pony, "Something the matter?"
Spike tugged Twilight's tail to give her a letter from the Princess and the local newspaper, "You should read this."
Twilight read the newspaper and gasped what she read. Leaders, prominent members of the court, royalties and random civilians from around the world were inflicted by the weight gain spell. There were pictures of leaders speaking in front of a crowd about the situation while their clothes look close to bursting.
"Princess Celestia is affected by it. Princess Luna as well and she doesn't have a picture on it," Rarity added.

Even the princesses can't stop him. We could end up as blobs as he walk away. Our jobs need us to be in peak condition. I don't want to imagine how I would work while as big as an elephant."

155332222222122.content:
Soarin smiled to himself and felt butterflies zipping around in his stomach, along with the fritters he had munched on to boost his confidence. They hadn't really worked.

He was sitting outside one of Ponyville's restaurants- he had forgotten the name already- watching the hustle and bustle of the town market. He wasn't in his Wonderbolts uniformHis gaze was mostly upon the apple stand. Actually, he was watching the mare running the stand. Her golden mane underneath that stetson, her lovely orange coat, those adorable freckles, and that sweet smile she gave to everypony who passed by.

He suddenly felt himself getting nervous and stuffing another sandwich into his mouth. He stifled a burp and mentally berated himself. Ever since the last Grand Galloping Gala where he had tasted the sweetest, gooiest, warmest... yummiest... satisfying...

Soarin wiped the drool from his mouth. Ever since he had tasted that pie the golden maned beauty had made, he found himself always craving a second helping of both that wonderful baked good, although 'good' wasn't a good enough word, and the wonderful smile just for him. It was easy, in theory; go up, buy some apples, start and conversation that leads to revealing he was the Wonderbolt that bought a pie from her, and get another. Work towards that smile later.

If it was so easy, why couldn't he just get up and go talk to her?

"More fritters, sir?" somepony asked from behind him. Soarin turned to see an irate waiter holding a platter with his magic. Soarin opened his mouth to say no, but his stomach beat him to the punch with a gurgle. "I'll take that as a yes," he said and let the dish clatter onto Soarin's table. Soarin sighed, took one of the pastries and bit with gusto. It was delicious, to be sure, but it wasn't that apple pie. Every time he tried to eat, he hoped to taste the same treat he had at the Gala. When he didn't, he wanted more until he did. This had increased his already voracious apatite.

He rubbed his large stuffed belly and remembered Sptifire's teasing words. "Hey, keep eating like that and you won't be 'soaring' much longer." It was true, he had gained some weight since that fateful gala. He could still fly and do tricks, but his new belly and bigger flanks made it difficult to do both. He loved flying... but he loved food more. That wasn't an excuse to quit your job and team, though. However, he was petty sure he loved that mare more than flying AND food put together. He loved her cooking, anyway.

He sighed as he looked himself over. Why would she want him, anyway? She was a strong and independent farmer, and he was a lazy and fat flyer. He couldn't even stop a dragon. He didn't stand a chance at her heart. To make matters worse, he couldn't even bring himself to buy another pie. If he didn't get another bite, he was going to go nuts and possibly eat himself silly. He pictured himself a huge blob pining away for more and more to eat. He felt disgusted at how pathetic he was and how likely that seemed.

All too soon he was out of fritters again. And he was still hungry! How could he still be hungry after eight daisy sandwiches, ten plates of fritters, and five slices of lackluster pie? He felt like screaming from the madness of it all.

"'Scuse me, sugar cube," a pony said from next to Soarin. He felt his eyes shrink and his muscles clench. He knew that melodious voice all too well. He turned to see that wonderful mare giving him one of those smiles, even if it was a confused one.

"Uh.. H-hi," he squeaked. He looked at his pile of dishes and felt disgusted all over again. Did she see him making a pig of himself?

"I hope you don't think me rude, but I couldn't but notice ya'll over here."

Oh sweet Celestia, she did see him. Soarin blushed and desperately wanted to hide under a rock. "W-what did you notice?"

The mare smiled again.

1553322222221221.content:
"Ah couldn't help but notice ya look familiar," she said as she rubbed her chin with a hoof.

Soarin's smile threatened to break his face. "You remember me?" he asked with none of his excitement concealed.

She laughed. "Now hold yerself, Ah only said ya'll looked familiar. Now don't tell me... we met at an apple convention? Naw, that's not it. Yer from a delivery service? No, I'd be sure to recognize you. Yer one of Dash's pals? Am I right?"

Soarin smiled. Even if she didn't remember, just knowing he left a strong enough impression to be recognized despite his lack of flight suit and added weight pleased him immensely. "Not quite. I've met Dash. And you too, actually. You probably don't remember, though, since I was in uniform."

"Uniform?" she said. She beamed. "Hot dog, Ah got it! Yer the one that bought the pie at the-" she immediately closed her mouth, looked around, and leaned in close to him. "At the Gala. Yer that Wonderbolt fella."

Soarin nodded. "Yeah, that was me. That was a great pie by the way. I've never had anything better. My name's Soarin."

"Applejack," she said happily and grabbed Soarin's hoof and shook it vigorously. His body wobbled violently from the force. "Glad to know somepony at the stinkin' party liked my treats. I swear, those Canterlot ponies wouldn't know good grub if it got them square in the snout."

Soarin grabbed his stomach to stop it from shaking. "Tell me about it. I'm always starving at the end of those things. Their food is so unsatisfying not like..." he smiled sheepishly. "Not like your pie was."

Applejack giggled. "Why, if Ah didn't know better, I'd say you came all this way just for my home cookin'."

"Uh, what makes you say that?"

"Well, you are drooling a little."

Soarin gasped and rubbed the spit from his mouth. Jeez, he must look like such a slob.

"You know, I like a pony who likes a good meal."

Soarin's eyes widened as Applejack met his gaze and she poked his prominent belly.

"You look like you enjoy a good meal."

Soarin felt like he could melt. "I love food," he said dumbly.

"Well then, ya'll want to come to my home and get some real good fillin's?"

---

Soarin could not remember the last time he had sat down to a family meal like this. His recent binges were certainly nothing like this, with a warm home cooked meal. He was at a large table surrounded by Applejack's family. He felt so strange, but not out of place at all. They were so welcoming to him.

"So yer one a them Wonderbolt fellas Scootaloo goes on about?" Applebloom said. Soarin stuffed another spoonful of butter soaked mashed potatoes into his mouth and nodded.

"A celebrity?" Granny Smith said as she planted another helping of... well... everything at the table on his plate. "To think my little Applejack knows such famous ponies."

Big Mac merely said, "Eeyup."

Soarin swallowed and waved them off. "Oh, it's no big deal."

"Sure it is," Applejack said as she brought in -oh rapture- a steaming hot apple pie. "Don't be all modest now. You do them amazin' tricks o' yours."

Soarin blushed. "Actually, I haven't done them in a while. I've been on a leave of absence for some time"

"Is that because yer fat?" Applebloom asked.

"Applebloom!" Granny reprimanded before whacking her upside the head. "That's impolite an' you knows it."

Soarin sighed a had another spoonful of stew. "Don't blame her, she's right. I've been hungry for quite some time now. I've been putting on weight."

"Ain't nothin' wrong with a healthy appetite," Applejack said as she cut a slice of pie and placed in in front of Soarin. "If a fella's gotta eat then a fella's gotta eat. You've had about four plates, Soarin, are ya ready for desert?"

Soarin rubbed his bloated stomach in anticipation. He felt like he could eat for another hour at least, but that pie called to him. But... granny had made dinner. Did that mean-

"Ah made it myself," Applejack added almost seductively.

That tore it. Soarin stuffed the whole slice into his mouth. He felt like crying. It was so tasty.

"Eat up, sugar cube. I made enough for seconds. Maybe fifths."

None of the Apple clan made any objection as Soarin continued to stuff himself silly. The whole family ate a lot, but as farm ponies they needed the the extra strength. Soarinate three times as much as any of them.

"That was delicious," Soarin said as he patted his finally full belly. "I couldn't eat another bite." He felt so wonderful now that had had the pie within him. Maybe he could start losing the weight at long last. but then he thought back to when Applejack had said she liked a pony who liked food. Did that mean anything about his weight?

Applejack looked at the empty plates in frot of Soarin. "So, where' ya'll stayin tonight."

Soarin had to think a moment to get past his haze of food and make a coherent response. "Well, I was planning on going to a hotel nearby..."

He wakes up the next morning, ready to fly
15533222222212211.content:
"But I would love it if I could stay here the night," Soarin practically pleaded. "If it isn't too much trouble..."

"Right up front, ain't ya?" Applejack said as she leaned over to him. "Ah like that kind of honesty in a fella."

Soarin gulped, but found he didn't mind the attention. "Well, you know..."

Granny Smith looked thoughtful. "Well, we don't 'xactly have a lot of room for ya."

Applebloom added, "Specially since yer so big n'stuff."

"Applebloom!" Granny warned.

"It's okay, really. I am pretty out of shape." Soarin poked himself, regretfully staring at the accumulation of his mass.

"He can stay in mah room tonight," Applejack said. Soarin found himself glad that he didn't have anything in his mouth to spit out. "That bed might jus' be big enough for the two of us. An' iffin' it ain't..." Applejack went up to Soarin's ear, she she certainly didn't whisper, "You'll make a right good bed on yer own."

Soarin felt like he was about to pass out. "Th-Thank you Applejack. I think."

"It is getting purdy late," Applejack said. "An' Ah figure ya'll gotta be tired after flyin' all the way here from Cloudsdale. C'mon, I'm right tuckered out." Applejack pulled at Soarin's hooves and led him up to stairs. "Night, ya'll."

"Night," Big Mac called, and the rest of the family waved after them.

Soarin felt his head spin in joy. When he had come to Ponyville, he certainly had not expected to end up in Applejack's house for dinner. A pretty large dinner, at that. Now he was on his way to Applejack's bedroom to spend the night with her in bed. He felt like he could melt in pure happiness at any moment.

Then, they reached the stairs and he began to climb. Flying was still relatively easy for him, since it was an act of magic. It still cause a bit of strain to life his heavier form. Walking didn't wind him since he was athletic, but he could feel the pounds. Now, as he climbed the stairs, his stuffed stomach swished to and fro and bounced against his legs and he once more felt like a slob. He was such a pig, and Applejack was still a wonderfully toned and fit farmer. She was probably taking pity on him, he thought.

"Here we are," Applejack said as she him into her modest little room. There wasn't exactly a lot on space, so Soarin found he had to take extra care not to bump his flank into the dresser that held delicate pictures.

"Should I just, uh, climb in?" Soarin said with a nervous glance at the one-pony bed. He was suddenly doubting his pity theory.

Applejack giggled softly. "Well, that's the idea of goin' to bed, isn't it?"

"But, well, I'm so big..."

"Ah know. Isn't it wonderful?"

Soarin felt like he might explode.

"Ya'll jus' get in an' I'll squirm into any extra space," She said before blowing out a lamp, leaving them in only the moonlight her window allowed.

Soarin squeaked and gently leapt into the bed, seeing how much feel his belly took up. Applejack worked her way into bed with him, getting a good deal of her body underneath him, using his as covers almost. She pulled the blanket up so it was over them both.

"How ya feelin', sugar?" Applejack asked.

"Pretty darn good," Soarin said as he nuzzled into Applejack's neck. Applejack chuckled and returned the favor.

"Ah bet ya weren't 'specting tah be here tonight, were ya?"

"No I wasn't. I mean... I've become a fat slob. I... ever since I tasted your pie, all I could think about was having more. I've been pathetically eating, hoping for another taste. I let myself go. Just look at me." Soarin slapped his fat underneath the blanket. "I was worried, actually. I thought a strong, independent mare like you would be disgusted with a helpless fatty like me."

Applejack smiled and began to feel Soarin's body. "Remember what Ah said earlier? Ah said Ah like a pony that likes a good meal."

"Yeah?"

Applejack's voice became incredibly sultry. "Ah love a pony who loves a good meal, iffin ya catch my drift. An' Ah do believe ya'll said ya love food earlier, too."

Soarin broke out in a sweat. "I did say that, didn't I?"

Applejack rubbed her nose against Soarin's cheek and placed a leg over Soarin's flank. "Ah'm a pretty honest pony, so let be be frank; Ah think yer cute. Not only that, Ah think yer darn right sexy. Ah thank ya'll fer tellin' me I'm a strong pony. Ah work out everyday on the farm, Ah have to be lean in order to buck apples fer so long. But that's not something I'm particularly fond of in a stallion. An' I sure as shootin' am independant. Ah'm also the most dependable pony in Ponyville, in case you didn't know. Ah like ponies dependin' on me. So to hear that all this time since the Gala you've been wantin' some of my sweets, well..." Applejack gave him a peck on the nose. "Ah can honestly say Ah'm pleased to know that."

Soarin felt like he could die right then and there.

"Ah like the idea of you dependin' on me, of needin' me. Ah'll make you all the sweets you could ever want. You don't have to do a thing. In fact, Ah'd hate you doin' anything. Ah want you to just lay here an' eat an' eat. How's that sound to ya?"

"Sweet Celestia..." Soarin murmured. "That sounds like Heaven."

"What'cha say? Ya wanna give it a try?"

Soarin thought for a moment. "I want to so bad, Applejack. But we barely know each other. Not to mention I'm supposed to be a Wonderbolt."

"We can take it nice an' slow if ya want," Applejack said. "Ah'm in no rush. But ya gotta pick soon."

Soarin sighed. "I know. I just keep getting fatter. I wouldn't mind if I wasn't a Wonderbolt."

"Really?" Applejack asked. "You'd earnestly pick me if ya weren't already a Wonderbolt?"

"... You know what? I would."

Applejack smiled.

"I love flying, but I also love food. More than flying, in fact. And the first time I saw you smiling... I loved that more than anything. Seeing it now makes me want to stay here and do anything you want."

"Hmm..." Applejack said, closing her eyes and leaning into him. "Ah'd make you a great big stallion that depended on me for everything, as much as you'd be willing to let me do for you."

"Ahh, that sounds so nice," Soarin said, closing his eyes. "I'll think about it, okay? I have quite a few bits saved up, and if I sold the home I barely use, I could fund your farm for life. Maybe once they see I'm not exactly getting in shape, they'll let me quit."

"Sounds good to me," Applejack said as they held each other close.

Soarin relaxed utterly, screaming in his mind cheers and praises. He could hardly believe how this had turned out. He was lying in bed with the most perfect mare to ever live, and she loved him as he was. He dreamed of eating her glorious cooking day in and day out, getting fatter just to please her, letting her cuddle him because it would make her smile...
15533222222212211.title: The Truth is Pleasing

choices: Applejack has to do some farm work, but leaves a huge spread.
155332222222122112.content:
Soarin stumbled out the door, his stomach swaying and audibly sloshing from all the food within. He hiccuped as he took his first steps onto the lawn.

"Sure Ah can't interest you in eighths?" Applejack called after him.

Soarin's stomach growled at the prospect. He turned around and opened his mouth to reply, but all that came out was "baaaaarrrp."

Applejack let out a hearty laugh. "Ah take it ya enjoyed breakfast?"

"Was asking for more not obvious enough?" Soarin replied. "Believe me, I'd eat more of your cooking if the extra baggage wouldn't ground me."

Applejack walked up to him and nuzzled his cheek. "Hmm, so one more plate of apple pancakes would make you stuck here with me? Ah might have to force it down yer throat, then."

Soarin felt himself stiffen at the prospect of being force fed more food by the lovely mare before him just so he'd have to stay. "Ohhh, believe me, I wouldn't mind. But I have to get back or I could get in trouble."

Applejack made an exaggerated pout. "Alright. Don't be a stranger, ya hear?"

"You kidding?" he slapped his stomach. "I'm addicted. I couldn't stay away if I tried. Besides, with any luck, I'll be fired by the end of the day. I was, uh... supposed to be losing weight on my vacation..." His face turned red.

Applejack patted the chub of his budding second chin. "Looks tah me like ya put on a few pounds since last night."

If he had to wager a guess, he'd supposed he had put on about thirty pounds since meeting Applejack the night previous. "I'm pretty sure they're going to be mad about that."

"Well, don't worry about them. Remember there's one mare that thinks yer drop dead handsome." She leaned forward and kissed him lightly.

Soarin held himself back from crying out in joy, though it was obviously hard for him.

"Ya'll come back back now, ya hear?"

"O-of course," Soarin said with a wobble. "Be back soon." He flapped his wings and began to float away from the farm, towards Cloudsdale.

Applejack sighed in content as he clumsily flew off.

"Thinkin' he's the one?" Granny Smith asked. from the doorway.

"Heck yeah. He's got the appetite fer me."

"Alrighty, then. Jus' remember he's yer responsibility."

"Ah wouldn't have it any other way.

--

"We need to talk."

Soarin knew that tone and that phrase. They were something he had used on occasion, all for the same purpose.

"Yes, Spitfire?"

"Come to the lockers with me."

"Aren't we already there?"

Spitfire looked around. "Oh yeah. I'm so used to doing this, I have it memorized."

"So, what's this about?"

"Soarin, I know I've been joking about your weight, but it's really becoming a problem."

Soarin sighed. "I know."

"You were supposed to spend the past week exercising, but it looks like you get fatter."

"You sure are blunt."

"You need it. There's no way you can do trick flying like you are, and we don't have enough time to whip you into shape for the next show. What were you doing? You look like you've been stuffing your face nonstop. Look at you!" She slapped his stomach.

"Ouch! That hurt."

"You deserve it, you lug. Now we have to push the show back, and refund quite a few ponies their bits, Then we're going to have to spend more bits on a personal trainer. Do you know how much this is going to cost us just to keep your spot in the show?"

"... Maybe you should give it to somepony else."

Spitfire froze. "What did you just say?"

"You heard me." Soarin pulled out a chocolate bar and made a show of stuffing it in his face.

Spitfire gawked for a moment before speaking. "Do you have any idea what you just said? If you give that slot up, it's as good as quitting."

"Yep," Soarin said through the goop in his cheeks.

Spitfire shook his head. "What's this about, Soarin? You love flying. You love being a Wonderbolt. Why are you doing this."

"Spitfire, I'm sorry. There are some things I love more."

Spitfire looked Soarin over. Her eyes suddenly widened and her frown became a grin. "No way. You found her, didn't you? You found the baker babe."

"So what if I did?" Soarin felt his face grow hot.

"She's a chubby chaser, isn't she?"

He practically choked on the melted chocolate in his mouth.

"Oh my Celestia, she totally is. Ha, ha, this is too rich!"

"Sh-shut up."

"No, no, it's fine," Spitfire said with a sad sort of smile. "Your somepony else's stallion now. It's gotta be fate; One pie, and you're gone." She shook her head. "She likes fatties, and you're the fatty for her. No problem with that. Clear out your locker, I'll get the paperwork ready."

"So... you're letting me go?"

"Eh, it's not like I can really stop you. You've worked hard these past years with the 'Bolts. You've contributed enough to more than earn all the bits you've made, since you made most of our most famous routines. Your head is where all you 'Bolt action was. So you let your body go; so big deal. Maybe we can set up a deal wher you're still giving us routine ideas and stuff."

"Spitfire... thanks." Soarin reached out and hugged his friend.

She hugged his neck flab. "Whatever, you big lug. If you're going to get fatter, you'd better become the biggest stallion in the whole world, you got me? Be the best at whatever it is you do."

"Heh, heh. I just might have to."

"Oh, and keep the suit. Old times sake, you know?"

"Uh, sure. But I might have a hard time fitting into the spandex now."

Spitefire gave a sultry grin. "I think somepony else is going to like that."

--

"So yer really here tah stay?" Applejack beamed.

"If you'll let me," Soarin said back. Applejack leaped forward and squished into his fat. "Ah'm so happy tah hear that."

Soarin melted around her as she squeezed him. "So, uh... is your family okay with this?"

"Course they are. Ah wouldn't invite some strange stallion tah live in mah room without tellin' them."

"So they know that..."

"More or less. You're now one of our pigs."

Soarin went stiff. "Is this some kinda foreplay?"

Applejack chuckled and her look became sultry. "Why, is it working?"

"Yes!" he squeaked, making Applejack fall onto her bed in laughter.

"Hot tar, yer easy!"

Soarin couldn't work up the nerve to say she was wrong.

She got back up. "Well, is mah piggy ready for his eats?"

"S-stop calling me piggy," Soarin said, though he didn't particularly sound like he wanted her to stop.

"Ah don't think so, Piggy. If yer gonna live here, yer gonna be mah piggy. An any piggy of mine..." an apple tart was stuffed into Soarin's mouth, "is gonna be a well fed piggy. How's that work for you?"

Soarin moaned at the flavor assaulting his mouth. "That's works fine, Applejack." He swallowed. "I think Piggy would like that a lot."

Applejack purred. "Well, come on, Piggy, get into bed and we'll get started on yer pampering. I'm gonna make you not want to move an inch."

Soarin made to get in bed.

"Wait!" Applejack said, and Soarin stopped. He turned around to see Applejack poking around in his bag. "They let you keep the suit?"

"Well, yeah. For memory's sake. I might be able to squeeze in it, but if you're gonna fatten me up I won't much longer."

"Hmm, then let's make the most out of it. Put it on."

"Huh? Why?"

"Is Piggy questioning his owner? There might not be pie tonight if that's the case," she playfully replied.

"No! Piggy's a good Piggy!" He put the suit on as quickly as he could. Applejack inspected the material that was stretching around his exaggerated form.

"Good. Ah don't want you taking it off without tellin' me. I want to see you blow out of it."

Soarin felt he was about to blow himself from the suggestion.

"Yer gonna eat an' eat an' eat 'til that costume gets torn to shreds. Imagine it; a couple hundred pounds heftier, the suit is pinchin' ya somethin' fierce. All the fat held tight in a neat package, beggin' to be released. An' when it does..." She gave Soarin a kiss on the lips. "We'll blow right on top of each other."

Soarin moaned in pleasure.

"Now get into bed, Piggy. Ah'll get you started on yer slop fer the day."

choices: The feedings get heftier and heftier. (fast gain)

1553322222221221121.content:
Soarin sighed and his suit creaked a bit. He felt like Hearth's Warming Dinner, Wrapped up so tight. But he'd be lying pretty bad if he said the sensation didn't fill him with glee. He wondered just how much his suit would take... and how much weight he's have to put on to burst out of it. Some part of him hoped it would be a long, hard earned reward after many, many pounds.

Applejack licked her lips and crawled up onto Soarin's engorged belly, grabbing a pie from the spread of treats and desserts. "Now open wide, Piggy, it's feeding time."

Soarin didn't have to be told twice as he opened his mouth and allowed the warms crusted slice of heaven to enter his mouth. He closed his eyes as sticky sweet apple flavored syrup washed over his tongue.

"Yes, Piggy likes his ets, doesn't her? Get nice and full. You're going to be my prize pig, ya hear." She took a bit of some fritter herself before she slipped the rest of it into his mouth.

"W-Wait." Soarin blinked and chewed. "You said a couple hundred pounds heavier. Exactly how big do you plan on making me?"

Applejack chortled and grabbed what had to have been the largest bowl of applesauce Soarin had ever laid eyes on. Gallons and gallons of sweet mush, with cinnamon and sugars tickling at his nose to tell him just how sweet it would truly be.

"How big?" Applejack purred as she began to relentlessly pour into him. "Depends on how much you can take. As big as a couch?"

A moan wormed it's way through Soarin's throat as he began to fill up. Gulp after gulp, he felt himself reaching that full state he had once craved so desperately.

"That ain't big enough. Big as this room?"

His stomach churned ad grumbled happily as his eyes began to roll back from the flavor assault. The swelling was pretty obvious, his mass increases with each gulp he made. He swore he could feel his haunches getting pulled in tighter into his suit.

"Naw, not big enough. Bigger than my barn?"

Soarin whined as he imagined himself so large. Not able to move, not able to fly, not even able to eat on his own. A blob of a pony, jiggling fat the spread out all around, just so much of himself. A big, blue blob of fat, only getting bigger and bigger and bigger. Could a pony even become so monstrously fat? He would need Applejack for everything, from baths, to feeding, to more... raunchy activities.

His suit became even tighter.

"Nope, still not enough. As big as a blimp?"

Soarin screamed through the seemingly never ending mess of goop. He felt so full and tight already. He was always hungy whenever he ate anything else, but something about Applejack's meals made him feel full. Was it just because of all the carbs? It certainly felt like he was gaining weight in mere seconds compared to what it had been like before. On the matter of blimps, of wondered if being inflated felt like this. If it did, he hoped it would never stopped.

"Well, that's a good place to start." The last of the sauce fripped into Soarin's mouth. He groaned and she licked at the excess sauce on his muzzle. "A big blimp pony, fat... tubby... beyond obese. And every pound is all mine. A big baby pig, helpless without his Momma Feeder. Mmm, yes... a good place to start."

Soarin's eyes spun and he tried his best to rub his stomach. "Ooohh... I'm... I'm so hungry... feed me. It's all I can think about."

Applejack picked up a large pot of soup. "That's my good piggy. You'll be absolutely perfect in no time. Come on, we still got a whole table of slop for you."

Soarin turned his head to the table, and how much food was waiting for him. It finally hit him just how demanding being a 'Piggy' would actually be. There was enough food to feed a normal pony for a week and a half.

This was his dinner.

"Oh sweet Celestia...

--

A monstrous belch escaped his lips and he did his best to lick at his lips to get any tiny morsel he might have missed, and was rewarded with multiple sauces and tastes.

Applejack whistled as she tossed a platter into the pile of dishes that had accumulated. "Well, well, well. Ah'm mighty impressed, Piggy. I half expected you to pop during the funnel cake attack. But you held through like a real trooper." She kissed his taut belly all over, working his way up to his lips for a passionate kiss.

Each kiss was accompanied by a squeak and a creak. Sorin sure felt ready to burst, but he made no complaint as his mare tickled his bulging form. Each touch of hers was sensitive and sent his mind into a whirlwind of sensations. He half wondered if his suit was keeping him in one piece.

If Soarin covered the bed before, now he engulfed it. His suit kept him round and shaped like a balloon a little too full, but even then he covered every bit of the bed he was on. A groan and gurgle were emanate from him regularly as his body set to the terribly strenuous task of digesting the largest meal he had even eaten.

"Oh... ooohhh..." Soarin moaned around her lips. "I'm s-so stuffed. H-How big am I?" His breathing was ragged and he screwed his eyes shut. His suit rumbled as his rear end did it's best to relieve the pressure.

"You're even better than Ah dreamed," Applejack sang. "You ate it all like a good boy and you're so fat!" She squeezed his farm in a hug, forcing him to expell more gas. "We'll have to double up your dinner portions in about a week if you keep this up. How's that sound?"

But Soarin didn't respond. A lazy smile was on his face as he snored, passed out.

Applejack smiled and kissed his nose. "Good night, Piggy. Ya ate about a hundred pounds of food today, you've earned it." She wormed her way under his belly to use him as a blanket, snuggling into him. "Maybe ya really can be mah big blimp after all."

1553322222222222222122.content:
She sighed to herself and gazed forlornly at her children wandering around their wasteland, wasting away. Literally wasting away, mind you. Why else did you think they have holes in them? That's their hunger eating themselves up. Anyway, the changelings wandered the wasteland in an attempt to distract themselves from the gnawing of... whatever it was that filled up when they ate.

She had failed them. So close, so very close to getting the sustenance they needed to survive. At this rate, their only hope of living was to split up and become even less of a species than they already were, basically dwindling to extinction. And why? Because of her foolish pride, a desire to one up, to best her opponents. Even worse than that, she had made an idiotic and stupid error in judgement. If love was what gave them power, why couldn't some other pony use it as well? Now it was only a matter of time until they died off.

She turned back around to her false palace made of crags and stone, a mockery of a true castle. She lied on her motty old bed. She would have cried if she could somehow work up enough emotion to do so. As it was she felt too empty to even become enraged at herself, let alone the ponied that had thwarted her. She had enough power herself to last another few weeks at best, but it seemed worthless to even be alive that long if her children would die sooner if they didn't leave.

"This is how it ends," Chrysalis said to herself, her voice echoing through the halls. "Wasting until I am but dust and as dead as what I rule over. All we wanted was love. Sure, we were going to crush their hearts and leave them as husks, but at least they'd be alive. We don't get that luxury, we didn't ask to feast on love. I'd much rather eat cake. Or strawberries. Strawberries are delicious."

There was a knock on her door and Chrysalis reverted back to her vile ruler persona. "Who dares disturb me in my chambers!?"

"A visitor for you, mistress," one of her henchmen said from the other side.

Chrysalis scoffed and rolled into her tattered sheets. "I told all my subjects that I wanted none to come to me. I desire peace!"

"This is different, my liege. The visitor is a pony."

She immediately sat up, her eyes wide in shock. "A pony? A flesh and blood pony?"

"Yes. They want to speak to you."

She leaped up and wondered if she should try to make herself presentable in some way before she remembered that she didn't own anything like a vanity. This was unlike anything she could be prepared for. Nopony ever came to her kingdom. What did they want? To attack? To mock them? She didn't have anything to give, so they couldn't want anything like that. She decided to wing it and just see what they wanted.

She was led to her 'throne' (a vaguely chair shaped stone with a chicken feather stuffed cloth for a cushion) and sat, trying to seem as intimidating as possible. "Bring them to me!"

Her lackey's nodded and brought forth the visitor...

15533222222222222222222211.content:
Buuurrrrppp!

"HAH! Hahahaha!" The fuschia-colored pony laughed at herself, more than a few glasses deep and easily amused. Berry Punch had been living it up for the past hour at Pony Joe's Donut Parlor with Rainbow Dash and Applejack, celebrating her victory at the Sisterhooves Social with her younger sister, Piña Colada. Piña had been put to bed much earlier, and so the three older ponies had gone to Pony Joe's to take advantage of the complementary free drinks for winning the Social.

"Haha! Awesome!" Rainbow Dash said with a chuckle, not quite as intoxicated as Berry. "How 'bout another round for the champ, Pony Joe?" the unicorn called over her shoulder.

"And another batch of donuts! Extra sprinkles!" Berry added, swaying a little in her seat. She had always had a tendency to eat a lot when she got drunk, but tonight was different. She was feeling pumped from winning the Social, and even though she had already packed away a dozen donuts of various flavors, she was feeling ready to gulp down a dozen more!

"I think you may have had enough," the wary Pony Joe called back. "I don't want you making a mess of the place."

"Aww, come on, Joe," Applejack replied. "She's the big champion of the Sisterhooves Social this year! Let her live a little. 'Sides, ya DID say she could have as much as she wanted fer free tonight"

Regretting his decision, Pony Joe nodded and levitated another baker's dozen of donuts to the three ponies in addition to refilling their glasses. Rainbow Dash smiled as she took a whiff of the sweet, delicious scent of the freshly-baked donuts. "Berry," she proclaimed somewhat enviously, "You are so lucky. I wish I could get free donuts and drinks. Heck, I bet I could win the Sisterhooves Social on my own! I'm just that awesome, you know."

"Yeah," Applejack answered as she took a donut and bit into it, "But too bad fer you, ya have ta have a sister to enter with ya. And it ain't about the winnin' anyway, Rainbow. It's about spendin' quality time with yer little sister."

Berry Punch giggled drunkenly, taking a big bite out of her second donut of the batch. "Yeah -HIC- but I gotta say, the donuts and booze are a huge bonus!" She topped off the donut with a gulp of beer.

Applejack and Rainbow Dash barely seemed to hear Berry's comment, instead getting into one of their usual friendly arguments. Berry's focus remained on the food and the glorious, glorious beer. Grabbing a bunch of four donuts, she stuffed them into her wide-open mouth one by one, barely stopping to chew in her drunken greed and simply swallowing them mostly whole. She could feel each one filling her belly as she swallowed them, and was very much enjoying the sensation. So much so, in fact, that she decided to see how much better it would feel eating all the rest at once. Taking up the box, she tilted it up and let the remaining eight donuts slide into her waiting mouth, swallowing them all at once with a large bulge in her throat. "BUUUURRAAAAAAAPPP!" she belched heavily, bursting into laughter again afterwards.

The other two ponies at the table paused their chatting and turned to look at Berry, quite surprised. "Woah, Berry, way to go!" Rainbow exclaimed enthusiastically.

"Hold on there," Applejack interrupted cautiously. "I dunno, maybe Pony Joe's right. Yer eatin' a lot, an' jus' between you an' me, Ah think yer gettin' a little heavy."

It was true, and Berry knew it; her eating habits were certainly having an effect on her figure. She had rounded out a fair amount in the past few months. Her flank was getting pretty big, and her belly was starting to bulge out -- especially now that she was stuffed full of donuts. But it couldn't be that bad, could it? After all, she'd still won the Sisterhooves Social, and she felt good. "Ah, don't worry about it," Berry answered. "I'm fine! I think I could eat two, no, THREE dozen more donuts before I got full!"

Pony Joe, overhearing this, groaned woefully.

1553322222222222222222222222222222221.content:
It's good to be the king. Or at least the king of the Crystal Empire. His majesty Sombra, standing on a balcony, red robe snapping in the wind, armor and crown gleaming in the gloomy light of day, watched his kingdom from afar with a triumphant smile on his cruel face. He had finally done it: he had captured the Crystal Heart and restored himself to his former self, but there was still some loses he had to deal with.

The ones that tried to send him back from whence he came, to imprison him in some sort of dark hole, had escaped to the lands beyond before the dark pony could unleash his power. Sombra turned his gaze towards the sky, which was cloudy with pitch dark clouds. This was the power the king casted, a shield that covered the kingdom; nothing could get in, nothing could get out, except his majesty himself, of course.

But Sombra would never dare leave the safety of his empire, for he knew that this area was placed under heavy surveillance following the events that happened. An attack Equestria would also be fruitless because he had no dark armies to fight it with. For now he had to stay in his protective bubble, rebuilding his evil armies, waiting for the right chance to strike.

But that also had negative side-effects. Boredom quickly settled in, and watching slaves work, smacking away bits of rock from boulders, their pickaxes audible from up there, brought only so much entertainment. A yawn nagged on the king's mouth and he opened his mouth wide, exposing unpony-like sharp teeth, yawning loudly.

Standing around was making him so awfully tired. A growl came from his belly. And hungry. Sombra headed back inside, to a richly, but darkly, decorated room. From the gloom emerged a dark pony-like figure, completely black in color with piercing white eyes and metallic wings. This was one of the king's creations, a dark entity that loyally served him no matter what. He didn't trust other normal ponies, even if they were just harmless slaves.

"Tell them to ready my bath and prepare me a meal," he barked.

The entity asked no questions, but only said in a cold voice: "Yes, your graciousness." And it disappeared back into the gloom, most likely teleported to its destinations.

Not even five minutes later the food and bathtub was ready. Removing his crown, armor and kingly robes, he climbed into the hot, steaming bathtub (which would have deserved the title "pool") with a sigh. It was rather strange but somehow they managed to get a large dinner table, stacked high with cakes, sweets and other fatty foods like fries. It was a lot, even for him.

Even though he did not trust his slaves, he still used some, but only under strict surveillance from his spawn of black entities, which was now in the room, standing five feet from each other, forever silent and watchful, always ready to serve their master, which was being fed.

"It's good to be the king," said he, while being pampered, knowing little that the food he was consuming was causing his abdominal to bulge slightly.
1553322222222222222222222222222222221.title: All hail the fat king.
